description:
Love this spot, the owner Sam is really awesome, he always has wisdom to share and makes exquisite Turkish coffee. His homemade baklava is the best I've ever had, super flaky and not too sweet. Sam has a highly refined perception and is a joy to converse with.

Why ever go to Peet's when you can go to Golden Bear Trading Company, which is better in every conceivable way
author: Kyle C.

description:
This is one of those experiences that you sit on for a week, process it and then decide to do something about it. 
After driving by this place umpteen number of times, finally last week I decided to get a cup of coffee & baklava from this place. 
My toddler picked up a candy and we paid $11.78 total. How? Coffee is $3+baklava $2.50 and candy $6 plus taxes??!!!? Oh and no receipt was given for this transaction. Like a fool I didn't even insist.
Wait, it gets better.
When we went inside around 4 pm the place had one customer/acquaintance sitting there with the owner, chatting. I asked if he has coffee or the place is shut? He mumbled something, got up and got busy behind the counter, I asked him to not brew a strong cup.
Now when the coffee arrived, it was nothing but frothed milk (when I asked, he claimed that since I asked for light brew, he did light brew). But the so-called coffee was nothing but water with cream in it. I was sadly surprised that the man refused to do anything about it! (He laughed it off!) The baklava was good, but not $6-7 good, which Is what I think I paid extra !
When we were leaving the man still yakking with his friend on top of his voice claimed that he has a lot of money, so much that he doesn't know what to do with it... like hundreds of thousands of dollars! Yup, if you serve people frothed cream with water and charge them $$$, you will make a s**t load of money and not know what to do with it! 
Here's my advice, remove the hyperbole from your walls and learn some manners!
author: Divya K.

description:
I have a problem. I have not found any good coffee in the states, excluding hawaii or seattle. That being said, I cannot stand, let alone enjoy coffee that is being served around the area. 

I'm glad I met Sam because although he has a very unique personality (it makes sam....sam), the coffee he introduced to me is on another level. Don't expect the coffee you would usually expect. It's something completely different, but for some reason deep down inside, it hit the spot. He customizes and carefully takes care of his beans. I will most likely be back again for more of that or something else he has down the line. Thank you Sam!
author: Vicky T.

description: Best cup of coffee in SF.  Turkish style.  Hand made sweets.  You need stop in and see Sam if you want an excellent cup of coffee.
author: Sam G.

description:
Been driving by this place after every dental appointment The Sign says, "Best Turkish Coffee in Town ...
And they have it....  Sam is a character... He's got it going on.
 Including an incredible assortment of luscious Middle Eastern Candy  Foods & Wines So... treat Yo Self‼
author: grace g.

description: I stopped in Golden Bear on a Sunday morning I was greeted by Sam who took amazing care of me. Not only was he a great conversationalist, he introduced me to the best pistachio baklava and Turkish coffee I've ever had. I sat and enjoyed my delicious little treat in an incredibly relaxing atmosphere. There is an more than ample selection of beer and wine, and I will most definitely be stopping in again soon.
author: John D.

description:
Again, this review was written on 5/24/16 from my previous account that I'm trying to merge with this one: 

Fast forward 1 year later to last week when I thought that I'd give the place a second chance. WORST IDEA that I had that week. I ordered a mocha Moka Java and it was just as watery and horrible as the cup I had a year ago. I've been living in SF for almost a year and I've been to my fair share of cafes up here and ALL OF THEM are lightyears better than this place. I have no idea how his guy got his place to have the "#1 Coffee shop on Yelp." Sam is obnoxious and can be really rude. I got a vibe that he favors his older, male customers over his females ones. He walked around to the tables of his cafe, talking with his customers while I was in there and he didn't once stop by my table to say anything. 

I gave this place a second chance, and I'm never going back. My advice to you: go down the street to 5th and Irving to get Marthas and Bros (my personal favorite and go-to coffee spot in the area), or go further down the street on 9th and Irving for Snowbird.
author: Kate M.

description:
We visited from Los Ángeles and had the pleasure of meeting Sam. "Life without Sam" will be a complete fu**ed up deal.... we'll be back soon. 
Xx Reeves and Claudia from Amastoria!!
author: Claudia B.

description: Sam makes the best coffee in the world! I recommend you to come and try it! Also, Sam is a unique person that you should meet and learn from!
author: Ebraheem A.

description: Best Turkish coffee in the US! Also looks like a great wine selection. The owner is quite the delightful character :)
author: Katayun S.

description:
Ok ok.  The owner said he would make me the best cup of coffee and I said no way.
I could not argue with Sam .  It is the best latte I have had.

I'm going to buy the espresso beans for my home!

Sam is worth the coffee for the entertainment alone!
author: Curtis L.

description:
Sam doesn't have the best, you can't find it anywhere!!! Without Sam, you may have his stuff, but you'll have nothing!!! 

You know where to find him....6th and Judah....he's not going anywhere!
author: Jorel J.

description:
I guess I was waiting for such a good place to write my first review...
This past week I've been driving to the city, to go to UCSF-Parnassus and I noticed this place had a sign about having the best baklava in town; and after reading reviews on Yelp I knew I had to check it out.
Sam was friendly and he prepared the perfect cup of coffee; we also tried the walnut and pistachio baklava, they were delicious. 
I'm definitely coming back, it will be worth the drive.
author: Lissette C.

description:
I often come to the UCSF library on Parnasus to get work done.

Golden Bear is a must stop for coffee. Their coffee is fantastic, and their halva and turkish delights are great to snack on for brain food. 

The owner is also really fun to chat with! The most handsome and opinionated barista in SF!
author: Jose F.

description: Coffee was excellent! Just as advertised. I also tried their Turkish delight - can't say I'm a connoisseur but the sheer variety of it was already impressive. Not quite sure why it's always been so empty every time I walk by, but the owner is a bit eccentric and our interactions were quite awkward. Other than that, the goods were good! Will go back for more coffee!
author: Yingna L.

description: Best Turkish coffee I have ever had. Must eat with Baklava. This man makes things happen!
author: Saumya G.

description: First time here, but definitely not the last. Sam got me some maddeningly good Turkish coffee. Going to come back for this liquor selection, too. I asked if he had Proper 12 Irish Whiskey but since he just sold out his last 3 bottles he'll be ordering some just for me. I'm still not over how good this coffee tastes.
author: Steven C.

description: This was my first time in this coffee shop. Sam is quite a character! I asked him what his recommendation of coffee to drink is so he gave me some Turkish coffee. I also ordered a baklava. The coffee was actually really good. Had a nice flavor and it'll definitely put hair on your chest. I like the fact that it wasn't super packed or maybe I just got there at a good time as Sam said. I liked how there's a lot of different Turkish pastries and candies. The baklava was really tasty! It was sweet, crunchy, and chewy with big chunks of pistachios in it. The place was super clean and in a quiet area. I will be returning soon! Thanks Sam
author: Danielle D.

description:
By far the best coffee shop I have ever been to. Best customer service. The owner is extremely enthusiastic and You're guaranteed to leave with a smile on your face. Sam is a boss and is full of power. His love for coffee radiates through the conversation he holds with customers. Come and be part of the legacy before it is the number one coffee house in America.  

NO BUT SERIOUSLY YOU HAVE TO SWING BY. IF YOURE AN SF NATIVE OR VISITING YOU MUST ENJOY THIS PALACE. IT WILL MOST DEFINITELY BE THE HIGHLIGHT OF ANY EVENT THAT HAS TAKEN PLACE IN SF.
author: Alex S.

description: Was sauntering around SF and saw this sign that said this place is no in SF and no 9 in the country. I am a puppet for good marketing and made it in. They have coffee,  sandwiches, middle eastern stuff and dessert wine. I got the halwa baklava which was good.
author: Sunil R.

description:
The coffee is amazing and deliciously prepared
Sam is a friendly open man who is funny and sincere and delivers his great cofree with witty sarcasm and passion for good vibes and gratitude shared He makes customers laugh and converse and sometimes marry according to its rich history and local patrons he is the catalyst of positive change for several friends and family
author: Shandi A.

description: Of course you should drink this coffee! Spot my sister's lucky lira (pictured) for forever luck. Exceptional coffee from an even more exceptional man!
author: Lovinia C.

description:
I walked in on a Saturday afternoon as the man himself, Sam, was soon to be closing. He immediately spoke to me as if we were friends, as if I've been coming to his craft coffee, wine-, beer-, and liquor- connoisseur's dream-of-a-place for a long time. Sam asked what happened to me. I don't know man. Did he recognize me from the one or two times I've been here? (The last time being last spring). Or maybe I look like a mess because I've been out and about all day running and working and studying. 

After this brief exchange as if we were buddies -- which btw, I appreciate it when I can walk into a place and feel right at home -- I ordered a large coffee with cream and sugar. Medium roast: Italian. The man himself ground up the beans, placed them into a pour-over filter, and started to make my coffee. We talked about how cold the weather has been and I mentioned that I felt like I was dying when I went running this morning. He was amazed and said my skin must be made of rubber! Sam finished off my coffee with some nice looking brown sugar and cream -- damn Gina this coffee is delicious! 

Inside it is beautiful. Clean white walls, white counters and tables to sit at, and limited seating outside when it isn't freezing. The walls are lined with fridges full of some awesome BEERS! They got beers like Ballast Point here! Additionally there is an amazing selection of hard liquors AND A BEAUTIFUL DISPLAY OF WINES THAT ARE PRICED RIGHT. Plus I'm sure Sam won't mind making a recommendation -- he just seems like that kind of guy.

[Just as a side note for all you other folks that enjoy places like Philz -- this coffee is better. Cream and sugar but not too sweet like Philz and not too heavy due to their cream. Obviously this place is better than chains like Starbucks and Peets (don't get me started) and is very accessible to those that go to UCSF at Parnassus for any reason.]

All in all I will be coming back here. It's kind of out of the way for me but it is worth it. The owner, Sam, made me feel welcome and crafts a mean cup of coffee. He is charming and warm. He makes the Golden Bear feel charming and warm and fun. And he wants you to know. Ya'll are missing out if you haven't come here yet or haven't come back. I'm down to make this place numero uno in the nation and I don't take my coffee, liquor, wine, or beer lightly. Thanks Sam!
author: Kerri S.

description:
My favorite coffee place in the inner sunset is getting bigger on his wine selection and I love it!!!
Really good pricing on a large selection!
Still recommending the pastries! 
Sam the owner is the best!
author: Geraldine F.

description: I'll never forget walking in for coffee and having such a long conversation about life. Rich dark coffee handmade was delicious.  Didn't have a chance to try anything else, but they have good looking tasty treats and quite a wine selection.  A great San Francisco neighborhood spot.  Come in with a good attitude, and leave with an even better attitude!
author: Steve I.

description: The baklava was wonderful! So crispy and delicious, not to mention the coffee selection is superb. So many choices, and made with love by Sam. Thank you and see you again!
author: Deidre L.

description:
Coffee is great - much better than Philz! ... the guy that runs this place is a great character and good person. Very thoughtful and cares about his business. Strongly recommend checking this place out.

Food and Turkish snacks are great as well
author: Dan K.

description:
While walking around the city, my girlfriend and I stumbled upon this coffee shop. We decided to give it a try since we needed a caffeine kick. 

The owner of the store, Sam, welcomed us and invited us to the coffee counter as soon as we walked in. We let Sam choose the coffee beans and after a few questions about our typical coffee order, he decided to grind up the Vienna Roast. He chose the perfect coffee bean for me because I enjoy a lighter roast of bean. 

What makes this coffee shop special is Sam. Based on our encounter, you could tell he enjoys making coffee for his customers.
author: Kevin W.

description:
This is some good coffee! They had a lot of options to choose from. My boyfriend and I rented out an Airbnb down the street from this place so it was super convenient for us. Came here a total of three times, each time trying a different roast and each time we enjoyed it. 

The owner, Sam made our coffee and he definitely takes pride in his craft. The first time coming here, we asked him what he would recommend, he told us to not ask any questions and asked us if we liked cream and sugar in our coffee. Based on our answer he just crafted us a cup of coffee. TBH, he is very intimidating and comes off arrogant but I have to hand it to him, he makes some pretty good coffee!
author: Diane C.

description: I'm next to the man himself. If you don't know now you know. Best cup of coffee ever and service beyond words. Best Baklava you'll ever have. What more do you need-
author: Theo G.

description: The barista will make your day, with up the uplifting coffee and continuous hilarious commentary. Definitely a awesome coffee joint to come to!!! This dude is hella funny though
author: Sumit S.

description:
If I can choose a place to grab a drip coffee in the Bay Area, it's here. Super high quality. 

I call it Sam's because Sam, who runs the shop, simply put, makes this an experience. 

He procures a wonderful selection of beans ranging from Costa Rica to Ethiopia to Yemen and beyond. It's artisanal and they roast the beans nearby as well as make their own (amazing) baklava. He takes pride in his craft and does a great job.

Sam is a one-of-kind human being and always puts a smile on your face. It's never just a yummy coffee, it's always a wonderful moment in the day. 

The shop itself is super neat (impressive wine and spirit collection too) with seating inside and outside. I highly recommend taking a moment to enjoy your coffee with Sam and talk about anything that fancies you, he's great company.
author: Noah M.

description: Seriously good, coffee has a unique taste the pistachio baklava is one of the best in the bay area
author: Tariq A.

description: Had the chance to enjoy a coffee here last week for the first time. I have to agree it is one of the best coffee I had. Very large selection of beans to choose from and a bright clean space to sit down and do some work.
author: A. G.

description: This is Kristi (Caen's wife): This is our favorite coffee shop ever. As Detroit residents, we dream of Golden Bear from our snowy existence months of every year. My husband is a fifth generation born and raised San Franciscan so we come to visit the city regularly. We always make daily trips to Golden Bear and find it difficult to resist multiple stops a day. The coffee is rich, flavorful and soul-warming. The mocha is my favorite. Everyone needs some Golden Bear in their lives!
author: Caen T.

description:
Sam is amazing! Hilarious, friendly, and genuine. The best Mexican got chocolate in the world! With cinnamon. Better than my mom's hot coco!
Will definitely come back for delicious drinks and good conversation.
author: Teagan B.

description: Went here for the first time today and I have found my new favorite coffee spot!! Sam is the friendliest barista and most importantly, a magician with coffee! 100 percent would recommend!!
author: Waing N.

description: First time here and I am in love!!! the Turkish/Red Sea blend is perfect on a Friday afternoon. Location is perfect for students and locals. And the owner, leader, coffee master, Sam, a genius for this shop and for my life. Five stars for the coffee, five stars for the environment, and ten stars for Sam.
author: Rebecca D.

description: A shop that claims to serve the #1 rated coffee in SF sets the bar really high for first time customers. BUT I was so happy with the coffee from Golden Bear that I walked away wondering if I really did just have one of the best cups of coffee in my life! I read the other reviews before going in so I knew to be open to suggestions from the proprietors. Sometimes the customer doesn't know best and should just heed the advice of the experts -- Golden Bear is definitely one of those places. A bonus, was the great conversation we had with Kathy -- she was so pleasant, friendly, and hilarious that the conversation we had rivaled the good coffee. They really set up the shop to be a friendly neighbor spot -- if you want to just order a custom, overly complex cup of Sbux coffee and want to sit quietly on your own...this may not be the spot for you.
author: Jordann A.

description: All I was after was a Turkish coffee and I found it by way of a much enthused proprietor, Sam. Thanks for the delicious cup and keep up the great energy.
author: Kelly H.

description: Sams the man! Best coffee in town. Even better than Philz! He brews one cup at a time personalized to your liking! Come check it out and support local businesses!
author: Curry C.

description: I always have a good time whenever I come to get coffee here. Sam is an absolute blast to hangout with and makes some of the best coffee I've had. I honestly don't know why people go to Starbucks or Phil's coffee when they can get high quality, exquisite coffee goods here in the sunset - AND, where can you find a guy like Sam? That's the real gold in "golden bear coffee".
author: David D.

description: Sam made my cold brew with milk and gave it to me to taste to see if it needed sugar. My response: it was perfection!! It needed nothing!! By far, the best coffee in SF. An added bonus, it comes with Sam's words of wisdom and inspiration! I love this place.
author: Alison C.

description: San is very friendly and not shy to greet customers. Coffee is really good here. Had the Moka Java.
author: John M.

description:
Closed early with open sign still flipped.

Guess I wont get to check the place out. Looks cool inside I suppose
author: Ryan W.

description:
What a great find this place is. I'm not sure how he does it, but regardless of whether I get a hot cup of joe or an iced one, the owner always makes it exceptional. Like....how does he know EXACTLY how much sugar and cream I take??? But he does. Each and every time. Next, I'll go into the service. Every time I go here, which is once every couple months, the staff is always accommodating, convivial, and enjoyable to be around.
Thirdly, great wine selection!!!
Finally, can we talk baklava for a moment? I've been to Greece, and the baklava here is right up there with the fresh baklava I've had in Corfu. 
Unfortunately, I don't live in San Francisco or I would come more often. Yet after a day of trolling about the museums, I come here for my cuppa. Nicely done folks! And can't wait to see you next time!
author: Nicole W.

description: Tried the coffee here for the first time! The coffee is very good. I also had an egg sandwich and it was also very delicious. And the guy that works here is very friendly. It's a must try if you live in the area!
author: Kathy M.

description:
Golden Bear writes the definition of the Inner Sunset - friendly independent coffee shop that offers a little bit more than everyone else, where you are automatically part of the family of regulars. It's a neighborhood institution and anyone passing through will be engaged with the owner Sam. Delicious pour over coffees and teas with a huge variety of options and Sam's connoisseur twists - a touch of cardamom, a fresh mint leaf, and I've never been anywhere with a homemade cream recipe with ingredients that cannot be revealed as family secrets! I mean, Jamaican Blue Mountain pour overs in a corner shop? It's fantastic. Homemade baklava, bear claws and quick breakfast & lunch options round it all out. There is a large well curated selection of wines, liquors and beers also. Good music, Calm and clean interior with pleasant seating, and outdoor tables as well.

People will come in just to say hi, and it's the spirit of home where you can always check in. I love this place!
author: Kelly R.

description: Tried this coffee shop for the first time, excellent service and super friendly. He had me try my coffee to make sure It was sweet enough for my taste, definitely recommended!
author: Maria R.

description: Terrific rich and flavorful taste to the coffee blends. Located right below the parnassus hill towards Funston, this place is next to UCSF medical center and provides a nice ambience to get away and take a nice break. Super clean and organized, the customer service was also tremendous. I highly recommend this place. Much better than Peets.
author: Keith D.

description:
This place made my trip to San Fran! Sam is one of the most genuine, down to earth, humble people I have met (besides me!!). The owner, Sam, will make you feel like a  royalty... oh and there's also coffee.  Came here two days in a row. First I had the Italian then I had Gianluca's El Salvador. Gianluca is named after someone special and Sam will make sure you know it!
Bring a recorder so you can catch all the nuggets. Sam drops so much knowledge you can't even keep up. 

When someone literally 10 seconds after crossing the threshold says... "you made me day" you know you're in the right place!
author: C. A.

description: Paid 7 something for an airport terminal burrito (the kind you have to warm up in its wrapping). I find it strange that all the 5 star reviews are focused on the coffee though "breakfast is served all day." I'll check out the wine selection next time.
author: Jennifer H.

description: There's a wide coffee selection here and it is decently priced for specialty coffee. They took a lot of tables away so there's not many places to sit. But they have tables outside if it's a nice day out.
author: Kristine C.

description: From one barista to another, this coffee is AMAZING. And friendly friendly staff :) the staff was hilarious and made sure we tried the coffee before we paid to make sure we liked it.
author: Moriah G.

description: This is not a coffee house but a lifestyle! My scoot broke down right in front and I went in for one of the best experiences I've ever had. I was not expecting my Brazilian mocha to be that good. The baklava was amazing! I will be coming back to this spot consistently now and highly recommended you coming!
author: Fidel H.

description:
This place has it all, although I don't drink has a huge wine selection.

Great food and coffee, the owner Sam is the man and very outgoing to make everyone's needs made.

Thanks again Sam!
author: Edmond M.

description: Sam is a bit aggressive but he makes an incredible cup of coffee. Ask him for his best cup and he'll make it for you. I'll be back, hopefully you're in the mood when i come back
author: Joshua D.

description:
Opted for an earl grey tea latte and I wasn't disappointed! My server was accommodating and asked for my sweetness preference before making it, and even let me have a sip before letting me go. 

Super cute area with open seating, bright interior design, and huge windows for tons of light to come in. 11/10 would be sure to make another stop if I were in the area again!
author: Jennifer T.

description: Sam is a character.  Stopped in with my wife Sunday for Turkish coffee and baklava and found everything to be delicious.  Will definitely come back.
author: David F.

description: This place is incredible. It is not a coffee shop. It is a lifestyle. Also, do yourself a favor and have a conversation with Sam. You will not be disappointed.
author: Tyler D.

description:
A cute store in a cute neighborhood. If you are wondering about all of the 5 and 1 star reviews it is because of the owners of the store. They will ask you a lot of questions and try to get you to eat or order things that you don't want.  Love it or hate it. 

As for the coffee. Not good. Go to Snowbird nearby for good coffee and Arizmendi for high quality (low cost) baked goods.
author: Kevin B.

description: Great place! Coffee is excellent. Highly recommend the Yemen coffee. Sam is a funny guy and provides funny conversation. A good way to start your day!
author: Pascal A.

description:
Drinks: 5.0 of 5.0
Service: 5.0 of 5.0
Environment: 5.0 of 5.0

Dark Roast! (With light cream & sugar)

Sam (the owner), "You want to live a good life, Sam has a life for you!"

Sam has a strong eccentric personality, he means well, but I can empathize with those who aren't used to an abrasive upbeat persona such as his.

The coffee here is really good! Smooth and bold just the way I prefer it. Very unique and interesting coffee shop with a wide variety of coffee beans, bakery items, and alcohol. I would definitely recommend visiting this shop and chatting with the owner for a little bit.
author: Samuel S.

description: I love black coffee and was looking for a unique handcrafted coffee while I was in the area. I got my perfect light-medium blend with a little chocolate flavor here. The coffee was close to perfect :), flavorful and just awesome. sometimes a small conversation with someone stays with you...and one such man is Sam who is the store owner. As promised here is my review and looking forward to enjoying some more coffee while I am in the area again !! cheers.
author: Mili D.

description: This is an awesome place, I tell you, they have great coffee, Elizabeth can make a mean coffee, Wow fantastic wine selection, and the breakfast bagel is to die for.. Awesome!!! Plus they have great chocolate, Philip marks Chocolates, wow the best chocolate around..   The owner "Sam" is something is somebody you want to be next to.
author: Steven L.

description: Bright sunny spot to enjoy an amazing pour over from Sam! This is NOT a Starbucks experience. Stop in and take a moment to enjoy an amazing selection of coffee and pastries, fun conversation with the owner, and pick up some primo wine for your dinner tonight. If Sam doesn't have a bottle of wine you are looking for, just ask him. He'll find it by the next time you stop by. Great Service. Great Atmosphere. Of course I have included some amateur photos for your viewing pleasure!
author: Julie J.

description: Best coffee in town! If you don't try the espresso blend, you are doing yourself a disservice. Sam is always nice and welcoming. Great place!
author: Anatoly B.

description: My shortlist of favorite cafes and coffee shops in SF definitely includes Sam's coffee shop near UCSF Parnassus. Golden Bear is ultra convenient, quiet and most importantly, great tasting coffee made to order by Sam and his staff for each customer. I love the bright interior, lending library and fast wifi. Its easy to see how the store has remained a neighborhood fixture for years. Bonus: the baklava and pastries are excellent and remind me of the Mediterranean bakeries I would visit back in DC many years ago.
author: Jay B.

description: the most positive dude in inner sunset! sam begins every other sentence with "of course!" sam will pick up anybody's mood. of course he will!
author: Andrew W.

description: As someone who grew up drinking Turkish coffee, Sam's brew was the best I'd ever had. Smooth and really well balanced. The baklava was great as well. If you have a minute, try and drink it in the shop. Sam is a funny and kind guy if you stick around and ask how he's doing.
author: Eisa A.

description: The mocha this guy made me was life changing. Make your daily caffeine fix special. Make it Golden Bear.
author: Kevin C.

description: This is my new go-to spot for coffee before work at UCSF.  Try the baklava - it is excellent, and can recommend the turkish coffee as well, but the coffee selection is expansive.  Owner is awesome, very welcoming and funny.
author: Patrick N.

description:
We happened to be so lucky as to be staying next to a spot with some of the best coffee I've had in a while!
And they've got a great wine selection...I found this bottle that we served at Postino :)
Check it out whenever you're by Parnassus
author: Ben G.

description: Golden Bear is by far one of the greatest family-owned coffee shops in the city. You come in, chop it up with the owner, and order some great coffee. I ordered a Turkish coffee and the blend was EXQUISITE. It's so much better than the Starbucks and other joints around the city. Great atmosphere, great location, and great owner!
author: Chris C.

description:
Coffee is best...Him, not so much.

I do like the coffee, I will give him that.I just don't like coming in and getting questions about this and that when all I want to do is get my cup of coffee and do some work on my computer. That is all.
author: Mark Q.

description:
Super cute cafe with very delicious coffee but just an odd and awkward encounter with the woman making the coffee. It was really hard to ask for what you wanted without her interrupting and telling you what you should get, so we decided to do with her suggestion. 

Coffee was good but I doubt I'll be back because of the weird vibe of the service/cafe.
author: Jhankhana J.

description:
Golden Bear has the best drip coffee in the city.   Flavor is rich and strong.  The interior is clean and welcoming.  Sam is really friendly.  Told me to yell at my brother to help take care of our mother.  

Nothing like Philz... Philz coffee is disgusting.
author: Teck L.

description: The owner was super unfriendly, and he charged me $4 for a medium tea.  You couldn't pay me to go back.
author: Fred J.

description: Amazing place, beautiful cup of coffee, super cool guy who takes amazing pride in his place. Great lunch and breakfast stuff and a good booze selection. Come for the coffee, stay for the conversation with the owner Sam, he's is a modern philosopher who will certainly change your day for the better. "This coffee is a lifestyle, if you don't like it don't pay"
author: Winston M.

description:
No bullshit ... straight-up... really solid coffee.  By far the best roast in the Inner Sunset. Sam is the O.G. of coffee around here.

I'm all about the blended roasts here at the Golden Bear.  Very solid, chocolately flavors, with  no bitterness or acidity. Not sure how he does it, but there's some serious unicorn tears and fairy dust in the secret family recipe that keeps it coming out just right.  THIS is what coffee should taste like, and it's very consistent.  Been enjoying coffee here for years, and it's always roasted right.  

Try the House Blend for a nice combo of medium and dark roasts.  The City Blend is a light/dark roast blend that's also interesting.  Or go for the Turkish for a solid cardamom-infused cup.  If you're into single origin, there are dozen or more available here. I always liked the Mexican, but Sam will tell you what the right one is -- just ask.

Oh, and if you want a latte... enjoy the Starbucks down the street.  For real coffee, this is where you want to be.
author: Dan B.

description:
Never will i step into this coffee shop again! 
My friend and I went in just to see the menu and wine selections and no one was supervising the store.
We decided not to get anything. But as soon as we stepped out, a lady approaced us and forced us back in to get some of the stuff they're selling. We told her "no" explicitly but she kept on insisted. 
So i decided to get iced americano. However she did not make it fresh and it was pre-made in a jug. No ice was added to my coffee, so its just plain cold. 
When checking out, the price came out to be $4 for a small cold americano! 


Not only that hygiene was soooo bad! 
She was apperently cleaning the floor before it and told us she will wash her hands before serving us. 
Guess what? she did not wash her hands and touched our baklava with it.
I also noticed her nail bed was dirty and covered with dirts!! its really disgusting. 


will never come here again!
author: Michelle T.

description:
I ordered a latte here on Friday afternoon. The lady behind the counter seemed unsure about what I meant, which should have been a bigger red flag than I took it to be.
"Hi there! I'd like a latte, please."
"A ... latte?"
"Yes, a latte - can you do that?"
"A latte. Yes."
I had been waiting in line behind another customer and had noticed a cup of coffee sitting, uncovered, behind the counter. After we had conferred about my order, she started tinkering with the very same cup, pouring milk into it and stirring it with a spoon. She handed it to me.
"Your latte."
"Umm... thanks?"
I paid for the drink - $4.50 - for lukewarm coffee that had been sitting out for an indeterminate amount of time, with some milk poured in. Not what I'd call a latte, and far from what I consider to be safe food handling practices. 
I will not be back. Snowbird Coffee is close by and they are much more trustworthy.
author: Lisle W.

description: Many options in terms of blends and each coffee is made to order usually by the owner himself or the other woman who works here. Coffee is tasty with an interesting combo of sugar and cream that gives the coffee a unique taste. I often come across the city to grab a cup before a study session at nearby UCSF library. They serve baklava and other middle eastern treats, which I haven't had the chance to try yet. Try this place at least for the coffee if you haven't already!
author: Cathy H.

description:
I came here to grab a quick snack. I don't think I'll come here for that purpose again. 

I walked in, looked around for a small morsel that wouldn't break the bank. Apparently the cheapest snack is $4. I finally decide on a croissant from the pastry case. The woman working behind the counter gets it for me and then tries to sell me on the baklava. I decline and say: "No thank you, but I'm sure it's delicious." She persists and tells me it's homemade and delicious. I end up caving because she seemed so proud of it. She gives me a large piece and then I hand her $5. As she's ringing me up she tells me I need $3.15 more. $8.15 for a croissant and a piece of baklava?! Seemed a little pricey to me. 

Didn't really like the fact that she insisted that I purchase baklava. I understand that it's something she is very proud of, but I didn't really need it.

They had Kind bars that were $4, a tiny bag of regular cashews for $4, and the croissant must have been $5 at least and had been sitting out all day.

Maybe there is something else about this place that has people raving. Perhaps it's the customer service? I guess you pretty much pay for the customer service with how much everything costs in that store. 

Typical bougie SF corner market. Caters to the folks who have deep pockets.
author: Devin N.

description: Stopped by this awesome little coffee shop today. I found it quite by accident as I dropped my son off at UC for a dentist appointment and decided to go for a walk. I wish I had found this place a lot sooner. I had a cold brew with no sweetener that would make Starbucks feel ashamed of themselves. The flavor notes of this coffee are truly amazing! I also enjoyed a pastry that was equally delicious. This guy knows his stuff. This little store has everything you need, Gourmet coffees wraps burritos alcohol protein smoothies ice cream as well as some Middle Eastern Delights like baklava. If I lived in the city this would be my everyday Coffee Spot! Loved loved loved it
author: j c.

description: yo this yung tpumps here. just got coffee with my king and let me tell you, it was an experience. the customer service was just as good as the coffee. we had been having a hard day and decided to stop in at this coffee shop and our experience amazing. we were laughing the whole time, enjoying ourselves, and the coffee. out of all the coffee shops i've been to this is by far the best experience. get the brazilian mocha, it's sexy.
author: Angie C.

description: Sam is an amazing human being. The coffee is absolutely amazing. The wine selection is incredible and they even have spirits!
author: Christian G.

description: You poor son of a bitches don't know what you are missing. This is the best cup of coffee in San Francisco. Made with self-proclaimed passion and love, Sam and his store represent the very best of the American story. He doesn't want shitty customers so he'll grill you while you're there. If you can't handle it, move along. If you can't tell he loves all of his customers, it's not for you, but that will make him sad. He wants you to leave there a better person and he'll scrub your crusty BS off you. Be prepared. Don't blame him if you needed a good cleaning. Just thank him for his great coffee and tell your friends to go there.
author: Kahuku S.

description: Owner is drunk at work, forcing products on me that I didn't ask for. Very unprofessional attitude.
author: Stan C.

description: Amazing Brazilian mocha! The owner is so friendly and fun, he had me in stitches! Very close the UCSF making this spot perfect for a quick pick me up. Also carry an eclectic selection of beer and wine for on the way home. Highly recommend!
author: Matthew M.

description: A cornucopia of brew selections but the brew master recommended panama when I asked for a dark. Drinking it right now. It's the smoothest dark I've ever had. It has the flavor of a dark roast but with the texture of a cold brew. Absolutely delicious and very reasonably priced.
author: Yang Y.

description:
Came in here with 2 friends and spent a long time!! We all felt really welcomed and the environment is great!  Kathy was very friendly and gave us a lot of snacks and let us try her hummus.  

The coffee was also very good, there's so many options to choose from!! I got the organic ecuador blend and it was very smooth, but also earthy and flavorful, just how I like it!  

I might come back and study here or catch up with old friends because it's an amazing place.
author: Jonathan W.

description: This hidden gem is so underrated. The Turkish coffee is my ultimate fav. Nobody makes it like you, Sam!
author: Alessandra A.

description: I guess the guy in charge has a love it or hate it attitude. "If you don't like the coffee, you don't pay." Sounds good, but not with the weird, forced expectation that it's the most amazing cup of coffee in the world. It's not. The pour over coffee cost $4.50. It was weak with too much cream, and yes he only offers cream. It tasted like creamy coffee. I watched him pour the hot water too fast, not a slower pour which allows the beans to impart their full flavor. Did not like the creepy vibe.
author: Captain C.

description: This is probably gonna be my go to spot when classes start in the fall. This cafe came up #1 when I searched for coffee & it did not disappoint! I got a scrambled egg & bacon sandwich (6.98) & a Turkish blend coffee w/ cream & sugar (4) & both hit the spot!  Sam was so nice & really gives you the pick me up if the coffee doesn't do that for you. So overall, great service, coffee, & food...so go visit & make it happen for real!
author: Megan D.

description:
Coffee:  I had the Costa Rica, which tasted great and Sam made it with just the right amount of cream.
Customer Service:  Sam is awesome! Made me laugh he entire time he was making the coffee.
author: Em C.

description: Good coffee shop! It's a little hole in the wall I recommend their cold Brazilian mocha it's really good! Don't mind the owner he's a nice guy and likes to chat with his customers. I would definitely come here again.
author: Nando R.

description:
I came for a piece of baklava but what I got was a something that I needed - a smack in the face with questions about my life that I was afraid to ask myself. The tea that I ordered came with a side of brutal honesty and mind expanding challenges.

I'll be back, Sam, whether you want it or not.
author: Ilya K.

description: Perfect corner spot to enjoy a cup of coffee made with love. The beer and wine selections are unique with everything from reasonable to high end choices.
author: Kellie M.

description: Sam wants to be the best.  He pays attention to his customers, the ambience of his shop, the beans he's using, the way he makes his coffee, where his signs are placed, he pays attention to EVERYTHING.  I respect his grind.  His humor/ personality took awhile for me to get used to, but after 1.5 years of getting coffee from him, I'm used to it and love his sass.  I will always ask "what is a good dark roast?" just to erk a sassy response.  His mom is very sweet too.
author: Eric H.

description: This is hands-down the richest coffee in the city. Made cup-by-cup and you can taste the pride Sam has for each pour. All the sweets made me feel like I was back in Istanbul and I left with a smile on my face. If you thought Philz was good, give this place a try and see if you don't change your tune.
author: Emily V.

description:
Shady service. The old lady offered to have me "try" a hot chocolate since I ordered a cold brew mocha, and usually that implies that it's on the house. I told her I didn't really like it cuz it didn't have coffee in it and she said "okay anything to make you happy" and then when I get to the register she charges me for both drinks?! After I nicely tell her that I only wanted the cold brew because I came here for coffee she kept going back and forth about giving me 1$ off and that I'm getting a good deal for two drinks when I only wanted one.

TL:DR Shady practice, old lady forced me to buy an extra drinks that I didn't want.
author: Jasper H.

description:
One of the best coffees I've ever had. Ask Sam for a recommendation and you'll get your money's worth!
Impeccable taste and world-class service, definitely hard to beat!
author: Mahesh N.

description: Watch your wallet here! As mentioned in a couple other reviews, there is an old lady who works behind the counter that will give you the wrong change. I gave her a 20 dollar bill when I was here with my girlfriend and she tried to pretend that I did not and was trying to overcharge me. The coffee may be good (I left the place leaving my purchase at the counter) , but there is at least one employee there who will take advantage of people not paying attention.
author: Elliot S.

description:
ok, the sign says voted #1 coffee in SF and #9 in the U.S.  I thought 'yeah, right....no way'. I had to try it.... $4 for a medium coffee..ouch... BUT it is an amazing Cup of java!! perfect. they have many, many kinds from all over the world
 My pick a El Salvadoran bean was great. Server friendly, clean shop, great seating both in and out. looked like very interesting pastries too.
author: Charlie M.

description: This is not only my favorite spot to get a high quality cup of joe, but the staff makes every experience unique and fun. Sam always has me leaving rolling in laughter, and with a smile on my face; a trick hard to come-by before I'm properly caffeinated. 100% recommend!
author: Tyler W.

description:
Golden Bear Trading Company has a sign outside that says "#1 on yelp! #9 in the nation!" Inside it looks very modern and sleek, with white tables and chairs. I always pass by it, but I'm a little hesitant to go in because the first time I went in, the owner asked me about yelp and asked me to write a review. (...which explains all the yelp reviews!) 

That being said, I do really like their coffee. It's very good! They have a big range of lights, mediums, and darks to choose from, and they freshly grind it in front of you. You have the option of mixing in some cardamom with your coffee, too. 

There aren't too many people who work there, so you become familiar with the owner and the two (?) staff members. They sometimes give a coffee for free (because the owner insists it's the best) or a biscuit, and the owner sometimes even talks about the problems in his life. It's not the same kind of hipster coffee shop you see popping up all over San Francisco where they're trying to be cool and hip and nonchalant. It has a little bit of that older vibe where owners will actually try to talk to you and sell you their business - which may or may not be something that people look for.
author: Julianna K.

description: Perfect place for a weekend morning to do reading or work. Some of the best coffee in SF.
author: Josh G.

description: Creepy owners are always there passive-aggressively trying to suck up to you or mildly insult you for not appreciating them enough. The bakery selections are Not Good despite the male owner declaring that I've never had a croissant as good as their's. And super tired of that lie on the board outside - Yelp Voted Us #1 in SF, #9 in Nation. Go to Snowbird for your coffee or Arizmendi for baked goods. I live a few blocks away and always avoid this place.
author: dogdaysOsummer A.

description:
A somewhat hidden cafe a block away from Irving St.

The old Korean guy that works here is so cute and is such a hard worker. He constantly cleans up the store and was very attentive to make sure the coffee he made was just what we want.
author: Novalina N.

description: Best cup of coffee in the area! If you haven't tried, give it a shot. Not inexpensive, but worth it. And the Turkish Delights are are delicious and go well with or without the coffee :)
author: Valentine S.

description: This place is solid and a hidden gem!!!  You can make a dessert out of the coffee I just drank.. excellent coffee!! Very unique and delicious.. to top it off they also have a good wine selection and good prices.
author: Efrain P.

description: After eating Plutos, I made my way to this alcohol selling no bar coffee shop. The ambience is nice with modern furniture and acoustic guitar music. There's also a wide variety of selections to choose from. We ordered the house blend, Turkish, and Tanzania Peabody. The Tanzania was meh. No real strong notes. The house blend was so so as well. I really loved the Turkish coffee with no sugar or cream. The fruity notes were perfect for me since i usually like Ethiopian. I would definitely want to come back here to try more or just study in general. Free wifi!
author: Kevin J.

description:
Awesome experience!!!!

It was my first time in this place, saw it from across the street and didn't even looked it up on Yelp before going in, which I usually do. Huge warming welcome from Sam the owner, he is just the best, great attitude, very energetic, polite and most important friendly. I ordered the chicory & vanilla tea with a cheesecake muffin. OH MY GOD!!!! This was totally delicious and fresh, you HAVE to try it!! Also the place is very cool and cozy, specifically for rainy days like today. Keep up the great work Sam.

I will definitely be back very soon for more of that deliciousness.
author: Francisco Javier B.

description: Stopped in for a coffee because I've heard awesome things. Sam the owner is the man! He enlisted me to help him with setting up a display and making sure it looked good and treated me to a coffee for my effort. His beer selection is on point and the coffee definitely lived up to the hype! Also looked like he had a very solid liquor selection. If he doesn't have it you probably don't want it!
author: David S.

description: Delicious burritos and breakfast sandwiches! Service was quick and polite. The guy checked in on us several times which was great. We both had hot chocolate and it was creamy and delicious! Definitely would recommend!
author: Ashlee A.

description: I don't really write yelp reviews but Golden Bear is on another level. Great cup of coffee near UCSF! My cousin in New York swears by this place when he used to live here so I had to check it out and it's definitely gonna be my go to spot. Check out their new logos too which the owner Sam was really proud of today. Sam, you make the best cup of joe man
author: Troy S.

description:
I came across this place while strolling the UCSF's campus. My buddy and I went in because the inside looked pretty dope. 

The lady behind the counter was extremely friendly, she had a few customers and made me a coffee to try because it was my first time. She seems to care about her customers and welcomes them with joy and care. A professor was tipping her as he left and she insisted that he kept his money. 

Style of the place is pretty unique. She has a bunch of different grounds of coffee in containers and about 6 pour over stations, depending on which ground you choose she'll put the powder in front of you and pour over and the coffee will begin to drip in front of you, guaranteeing freshness. 

Besides the coffee, which seems to be the main attraction she has pastries, regular beverages in fridges and alcohol. Nice seating, calm ambience and an overall good vibe.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
v confused as to how this place is so highly rated. Is Sam the old Asian man?
- no music
- no humans
- poor service
- need to pay extra to stay? (apparently 26 cents?)
- cold
- cold

I got the mint tea, and it wasn't very good. no tea leaves, or even a tea bag? Tricked by these positive reviews.
author: Juliana P.

description: As soon as I walked in I felt comfortable. The clean, beautiful environment makes it a very inviting place to sit down with my laptop and get some work done. The coffee was delicious and made with care. Sam makes you feel comfortable and reminds you to be happy, relax, and have a good day. Definitely going back.
author: Nicholas C.

description: This is the best cup of coffee I've ever had. 100 times better than Philz! Sam and Elizabeth helped me pick out the kind of coffee they thought I'd like best, then made a fantastic cup for me with just the right amount of cream. I have to stop in every time I walk past!
author: Cameron N.

description: This place has top notch coffee! I'm usually very critical on how people brew their black coffee, but I have to say that this guy is one of the best. Not only that, but you can buy beer and liquor at this shop as well! The black coffee is smooth and tasty. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Richard C.

description: The coffee that Sam makes and sells is probably the best coffee in Sf or one of the best in terms of quality. You can taste the difference! The shop is great and cozy, I can't point out a single thing that I don't love!!
author: Khaled A.

description: A lot of options for a delicious cup of coffee. They have food and very tasty Turkish sweets too!
author: Elmira M.

description:
UPDATE of my review: after thinking through this more and seeing other 5 star reviews since writing, I stand by my statement that this is NOT the best coffee shop in SF. I have no idea why people are writing so many positive reviews.

Original review:

It's a good coffee shop for what it is which is a solid neighborhood shop. Nothing less, nothing more.

I'm not 100 percent sure what all the 5 star ratings are about for this place. In fact, all over the shop itself they have posted copies of an Internet article rating this place as one of the best coffee shops in the US on yelp. I don't know if I agree at all.

Here's my review: good coffee. Seems like a good selection of ice cream and wine. Service was ok to good. Clean restaurant. Hard to find parking. Average atmosphere, good prices. Smells clean.

See how average my review was? There's not really much to write this place. It's average. I'll give it 4 stars though because it is exactly what it is which is a 4 star average neighborhood coffee shop
author: Eric G.

description: If you're looking for mediocre coffee served by the creepiest uncle in the world, this is your spot. I feel like the owner means well, but I also fully acknowledge the rapey nature of everything he says, as well as his indiscretion of hitting on 14 year old girls. Probably won't come back, but hey - life's full of mistakes.
author: Alex P.

description:
I would go out on a limb to say that this is the best coffee shop in the city. I wandered here with some family after being in the area to be greeted by the owner, Sam, and he made me the most delectable, smooth cold brew mocha. He is funny, totally knowledgable about the product, and will help you pick the perfect drink according to your cravings of the moment. The vibe of the shop is both modern and welcoming, a refreshing contrast to the white hipster fuckboy aesthetic that has spread through SF like the flu or an unfortunate STI.

His mom is cool too. She called me a handsome young man and knew that I was Filipino, which means five stars (duh).
author: Jonathan M.

description:
It's always nice when grabbing a cup of coffee (or hot chocolate, in my case) becomes more of an experience, and less of a "grab it and go" kind of thing. The owner is absolutely one of the nicest guys around, and really focuses on one customer at a time - a rarity this day and age!

THE OVERVIEW.
+ Very good selection of beer, wine, and hard alcohols available for purchase
+ A small in-house community library
+ Small selection of indoors seating
+ HUGE variety of coffees to choose from (all ground on-site, and the owner can easily recommend you the one best suited for your palate)
+ They also make a pretty mean hot chocolate

Support local businesses run by fantastic owners!
author: Claire S.

description:
Golden Bear has obviously blown up thanks to Yelp. They were made for each other really. Even with all the pomp and circumstance, Golden Bear was nearly empty on a Thursday afternoon for one of my final Yelp visits in my hometown of San Francisco before leaving for the East Coast (again). I'm glad Golden Bear was one of my final visits. 

It was quiet and the space is perfect with all the fridges of craft beers and wines. Then you have your spirits artfully place on bookshelves essentially. The selection could get a little better, but I don't think people really come here as their local liquor store anyways. 

What they really come for is the coffee and pastries. The ambiance is truly one you look for in a coffee shop. Not one where you have lines everywhere and people bustling to get to their corporate America job. I'm sure the UCSF and local Sunset crowd loves a book and cup of Joe at Golden Bear.

I had the Turkish black and it gave me the bitter kick I love in coffee. It was splendid. My mother had the Italian with some cream and sugar and absolutely loved it.

Anyways, stop with the corporation coffee and the poseur "local coffee shop now in 25 locations". They all care about the bottom line in the end. Beans = cash to them.

Come here. Come to Sam (sorry I didn't say hi, but thank you for a great final SF experience). They're just here for the love of the coffee. This is a bit off the beaten path, but this is it. I know it's just coffee and snacks, but it's just that done, oh so well.

I can't say enough. It was all appropriately priced and placed. I'm glad I came here when I did and I'll definitely be back if I'm ever back in SF. Places like this deserve our business. Thank you Sam and Golden Bear. You made me feel at home one last time.
author: Joseph L.

description: So happy I discovered Golden Bear. Sam (the friendly owner) recommended the Vienna & I've had it twice this week! Will definitely be coming back because the coffee is amazing, no wonder it was voted #1 in SF. Customer service & ambiance is top of the line. Excited that I found my go to spot for coffee.
author: Aisha L.

description:
This is by far the best coffee in San Francisco... dare I say the whole country. 

Classic pour over with so many beans to choose from! I love the Mexican and the Special French. I always ask to go easy on the sugar too, which makes it just a little sweet. 

The owner is also as awesome as the coffee. Golden Bear is a real gem.
author: Emily E.

description:
Not only is the coffee delicious and the breakfast burrito filling, but Sam adds a whole new level of excellence to the experience. 
He makes customers feel like an old friend and is more than accommodating. Great experience, great place, great people
author: James M.

description:
Amazing tea that's served as strong as coffee, and pastries that transcend whichever company has won a monopoly on providing generic fare to every other San Francisco coffee joint. 

Chocolate dipped cookies are sublime. Staff is incredibly warm hearted and welcoming. A last oasis of a real Neighborhood in this city. Get in before it's bought out by another Peet's.
author: Eryk S.

description: Went in for a coffee and a sweet roll and came out with a bad feeling. The man behind the counter was quite arrogant and told me I would probably never have a better cup of coffee. Well, his coffee was actually weak and he put way too much sugar and cream in mine. It came to eight dollars which was excessive. I would never go back and didn't appreciate his snob attitude.
author: david m.

description:
I find myself reluctant to write this review... it sure would be a shame to come back here next time and find a line of hipsters out the door and down the street. But, heck, this place has hundreds of reviews and seems safe enough so far, so here I am writing the review.

I've been to dozens of coffee shops in San Francisco -- the big names and the small -- and I think Golden Bear is my favorite of them. Part of it surely is the wide selection of well-roasted beans (note: theirs is *by far* the best light roast I've had in San Francisco). Part of it is the idiosyncratic preparation: coffee is all ground ultra-fine in Turkish style and then made pour-over style in a repurposed diner rack using a basket coffee filter. Part of it is also the delightful woman who's been behind the counter every time I've been here. Heck, maybe part of it's also the balaclava. Combined, everything just makes for a great experience.

If you want to try something a little different from the crowded downtown coffee shops, hop on the N and go out to Golden Bear. If you're anything like me, you'll find yourself back here again and again.
author: James B.

description:
Needed a place to do some work so the bf and I come here after reading glowing reviews. 

Bf ordered a Cold Brew Mocha and the lady behind the counter confirms "Mocha?" and points to their hot chocolate powder, to which the bf says Yes. She makes him a hot drink and he says "Oh I wanted the cold brew mocha, isn't it a cold drink?" She becomes argumentative and says she asked him if he wanted hot or cold and he told her hot. Now my bf is super polite with strangers but he's not a pushover. He says he didn't say that and said he wanted a COLD brew mocha, pointing at the menu and she ignores the menu and keeps pushing back, saying that he ordered the hot drink. Now that I think about it, perhaps it was supposed to be a hot drink made with their cold brew coffee but in all fairness the name is kind of confusing. However when the bf kept saying he wanted a cold drink, the lady accused him of lying, which is what irked me the most. It's like C'mon lady! Admit that there was a miscommunication and move on!

Another customer tries to give her the benefit of the doubt and says she's probably making it hot first and then she'll add ice cubes to make it cold. Nope, she grabs a pitcher of pre made stuff from the fridge and pours it out for my bf.... He just takes it because at this point, he just wants to move on and get to work. THEN she tries to get him to try the hot drink she made....We read those reviews of her charging for drinks she offers to customers to "try" so we were like No thank you. She offers the failed drink like 5 more times before giving up. Sheesh. 

I ordered a iced (I verified it with her) cold brew tea latte and it was pretty much 70% creamer, pre made iced tea from the fridge, and a spoonful of granulated sugar. Bleh. I tried bf's cold brew and it was also Bleh. Should've walked out once she got argumentative but dangit we still needed a place to work. Won't be coming back.

Oh and Wi-Fi doesn't work here.
author: Alice C.

description: Cozy little coffee/tea shop with a verity of drinks. Got the vanilla bean tea with milk. Was great. Also tried the Italian coffee. Family owned and service is fantastic! Pastries are all homemade. The family gave us free pistachio baklava and oh em gee! Amazing crust, taste, and crunch. Not too sweet but perfect. Can't wait to come back and try other treats. Again very friendly family! Def come here
author: Natalia B.

description: The coffee is not good.  I'm a big fan of cold brew but the quality of the coffee served doesn't justify the price. The owner is very moody and will get unreasonably angry if you ask for an iced drink. This is a place to avoid.
author: Shar M.

description:
Amazing. Simply Amazing!

The coffee is freshly made right in front of you, so hot and delicious.

They have Almond milk, Soy, and regular milk! Anywhere that has almond milk is going to win me over. I have had a mocha and a croissant and both of which were great. I don't think I've ever had a mocha that tasted so rich. High five to the gentleman that made it that morning. 

A large list of pastries to choose form, even some beers and wines in the store side. 

and BAKLAVA!

The place is super clean and gives UCSF affiliate 10% off with badge.

Employees, you gotta know what you want when it's your turn, their in a rush!
author: Elysia M.

description:
I have tasted coffee around the world  and I am very impressed with their coffee.

Clean environment, relaxing atmosphere, and good service.

I highly recommend this coffee shop - and it is quite a gem!
author: Sinnie C.

description: Awesome coffee, nice people. Highly recommended. Will definitely come back again. Did not try the food, but looks like they have baklava there for sale.
author: Tamar B.

description: Funny thing. Walked in here on some work business. Joked around with the man Sam and then walked out with a GREAT cup of coffee. Sam loves what he does and you can tell it from the drinks he makes. Definitely coming back!
author: Chris M.

description:
We had high tea with a couple of friends and decided to stop by here before going home.  

Sam was pretty nice and entertaining.  His promise is that if you don't think the coffee is the best he'll give it to you for free.  I got the Tanzania (with milk) which was pretty good.  My friend got the italian and I forgot what my boyfriend got.  Both said they're coffee was good. For our three coffees it came out to be $12.  

I liked the place, it's spacious and they sell other desserts, ice cream, and alcohol.
author: Lydia K.

description:
If the coffee was just alright coffee, this place might just be any other corner store. What truly makes Golden Bear a top listed place is the coffee itself. It's definitely top notch, fresh and rich in flavor. There is a variety of options, listed from light to dark, but I simply asked for whatever one was best. Sam had me try what he said was his favorite, Kenya AA. It's extremely good, and he knows it. 

Other than the delicious coffee, Golden Bear is just a store - liquor, snacks, coffee. Sam clearly knows/remembers his customers, which I can appreciate. He has really good coffee, and he knows it - he'll tell you it's going to some of the best coffee you've ever had. He also told me (more than once) that I'd need to write a Yelp review. Personally, being a little defiant, it nerves me a little when people tell me to write a review just to write one. If you do well, I'll write one - you don't have to request it! 

Basically, three star location with some five stars coffee. 

(TOP 100 PLACES TO EAT IN 2015, #9)
author: Kailyn T.

description: I enjoyed two pieces of balaclava and and iced tea with cream and sugar. The atmosphere was relaxed and calming. A definite must visit if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Dustin P.

description:
I don't know what's the fuss about. 
I also don't understand how a cup of coffee and a creme cheese bagel cost me 10 bucks. 
I had a dark roast and it had a very strange aftertaste. 
I can't judge all their beans but the one I had was not that good.
author: Juliana B.

description: Delicious coffee that is prepared for you right in front of you by an owner who is interesting to meet and will undoubtedly draw you into conversation if you have the time. As someone new to the neighborhood, friendly faces are always a huge plus.
author: Isaac L.

description:
HOLD ON TO YOUR WALLET!  DON'T GO!  The staff here are criminals who pull out every trick in the book to take the cash out of your wallet.

If you hand her a 20, she will go as far as offering you products instead of your change and plead with you to take the products.  

My household will never go back there, even though it's basically next door.
author: Nick L.

description:
I serendipitously dropped by this place on my way to Academy of Sciences. My husband and I needed caffeine before spending the day chasing after our active toddler around the aquarium. 

[Some context: I live near a Philz. I am soooo tired of Philz. Yes, that is some high and mighty entitled hipster SF BS, but it's true. I am born and raised in SF, so whatev. You ain't gonna find Starbucks in my house.] 

So I naively ask the owner, "Do you only serve coffee or do you make cappuccinos, etc?" I know I could have looked at the menu, but I had a screaming toddler waiting for me in the car so I just needed answers! The owner patiently says "No, just coffee, but it will be the best you ever had."

I'm generally suspect when people speak in superlatives, but after that first sip of that cup of cold brew, all I could think was, "Daaaang, girl." This was in my head of course. I politely nodded and thanked the owner, gave my husband the coffee as he waited patiently in the car. 

After his first sip, my wanted to slap me with his eyes and ask, What is this place?! 

Yes my dear, better than Philz for sure.
author: Joann A.

description:
When the "top 100 places in America according to Yelp" list came out, it left a lot of San Franciscans scratching their heads because it's missing so many famous SF places, and instead you see that quiet coffee shop that you always pass by but which no one ever talks about (nor Instagrams). 

It seems that most reviewers love this place because they like how nice the owner is. Yes he's friendly and chatty, but overall I still find it more or less an average coffee/average food cafe. The space is nice (clean and airy, with glossy white tables that remind me of an Apple store) though I find it a bit random that it's part grocery store. 

Food selection includes pastries, baklava, and sandwiches, and in my opinion, prices are on the high end for what it's worth. I've tried their famous bearclaw and didn't find it too special, mainly just a huge, very sweet pastry that I may be craving if I feel like I failed an exam. 

Also, being a Cal Bear, I can't help but grumble at the thought that GB Trading Co appears to have poached the Golden Bear for the cafe name and logo.
author: Edna C.

description: Great hand crafted coffee! Sam is a blast to talk to and is sure to make you feel at home. In an era where coffee roasters are everywhere  Sam distinguishes himself with simply great cups of coffee.
author: Kevin B.

description:
I occasionally swing through the area to do a bit of work at Parnassus. As a newbie to San Francisco, I am always on the lookout for new places to eat and drink, namely coffee. 

Upon walking through the door at the corner of 6th and Judah, I was cordially greeted by Sam. I told him I was new to Golden Bear and asked for a light roast recommendation. He asks if I want with cream and sugar or black, and I replied light on both. He suggested the Guatemala and promised that if it wasn't the best cup of coffee I have ever had, that I wouldn't have to pay. Well, I'll be darned if it was one of the best cups of coffee I have ever had. Smooth, no bitterness, just the right amount of cream and sugar. Sam is a master at his craft, and he knows it too.

The space is clean and almost eclectic, with a cafe complete with coffee beans, pastries and desserts on one half of the store on one half, and a collection of alcohol and snacks and candies on the other. There is a 10% discount for UCSF staff and students, which was much appreciated. The next time I'm in the neighborhood, I might come back to grab a hot delicious cup of coffee, a bag of beans for my home pour overs and for a quick friendly chat with Sam.
author: Shirley V.

description: Great coffee and wine shop with a large selection of wonderful wines!  The friendly staff greets me every time I walk inside.  There are also fresh flowers for sale and various snacks and non-alcoholic/non-coffee drinks as well.  Plenty of seating to people-watch or get some work done by the large windows :)
author: Kate A.

description:
I love this place.  It's perfect for a piece of the most amazing pistachio baklava ever with a special blend freshly brewed black coffee.  Sam is a very interesting guy to talk to and I let him choose the coffee special every time.  His coffee and baklava always taste fresh and of highest quality.  


His pistachio baklava is by far the best I tasted in the US!
author: Ahmad A.

description:
Sam's baklava is the best on the planet.
His hot chocolate and coffee are also stellar.
I look for excuses to come to this place - not exactly in my neighborhood, but I always want to see how close I can get, just as an excuse for his baklava.
author: Duey C. H.

description: I don't know where to begin with! This place is a lovely coffee shop in SF that gives you more than what you expect. I had the best coffee of my life at this place. In a stressful busy morning, Sam made me feel relaxed and as if I'm at home and enjoying my time thinking about nothing but my coffee. I would definitely come back again and I highly recommend this place.
author: Ryan A.

description: Sam is a living legend. Best hand-crafted coffee, told him make it his way. Results speaks for itself.
author: Victor Y.

description: This place is amazing , great food and AMAZING coffee. The owner ( I presume) was super friendly and was more about us enjoying our food and coffee than making us pay right away and just letting us relax. Great selection of coffee too!
author: Mariesa A.

description: ITS ALL TRUE!!! Best coffee in San Francisco! And all of the food and wine is amazing. Plus the owner Sam will greet you with a smile and ask how you are doing because he *genuinely* wants to know. I can't say enough how amazing the coffee is :)
author: Christine R.

description: Awesome classy specialty coffee shop. Sam makes a great drip coffee "if you don't like it you don't pay for it" You can find lots of great unique beers from all over. He has everything one may want/need from coconut water C20 and Evessi to kombucha GT's and Humm. They also have lots of great sodas and other drinks. You can find something for everyone at this awesome specialty coffee shop.
author: Nick S.

description:
"Success is liking who you are, liking what you do, and liking how you do it" - Maya Angelou. 

In this regard, Sam is truly successful. He makes a damn good cup of coffee and makes you feel like you're in his house, not a shop. 

Get a dark roast with cream. And a Turkish delight to go.
author: Richie B.

description: Awesome coffee, awesome owner and great vibes. The next time we fly in from Salt Lake City we will be sure to stop by and visit!
author: Chris S.

description: First time in today.... had a light roast Sumatra with cream and an egg and bacon sandwich this morning. Sam made everything made with love! If you don't believe it ask him! Great cup of coffee from a guy who passionate about making coffee! Love supporting local businesses when they love what they do! Will definitely be a repeat customer! Go see Sam, you won't be disappointed!
author: Vinko S.

description: Tasty and rich drip coffee and best baklava I've ever tried! If you're expecting warm customer service don't so go in understanding that the coffee and baklava will make up for it haha. Bring cash!
author: Alejandra M.

description: Came here after hitting up Off the Grid at upper Haight and glad we did. It was freezing out and pretty late so I decided to stay away from the caffeine and get a Mexican Hot Chocolate. It was everything I could ask for hot, sweet, creamy and a dash of cinnamon. The owner Sam that's featured in all the pics was there to make us our drinks. Really friendly guy that was asking us a lot of questions of why we decided to visit his place. Lots of patrons were popping in and saying hi to him by first name. Great little coffee shop and the owner seems so prideful with each drink he put out. Additionally, this place is full of liquor if you need some other dranks!
author: Lindsay C.

description: Thought this would be a great coffee shop to walk from UCSFMC. The reviews looked great. But I wished I looked at all the reviews. And everything negative that was said about this place looks to be true. If the OWNER doesn't like you, your out of luck. Owner feels untouchable because he lucked out with good reviews. Wish I would of saved my money n got a cup of joe somewhere else.
author: Nik T.

description:
Greeted by the infamous owner, Sam, today. We were perusing the menu on the wall with indecision for some time, and I asked him how the Cold Brew Mocha tasted. I'm not one to love mocha's to begin with because more often than not, they are much too chocolate-y and / or sweet. Without another word, Sam starts mixing chocolate powder with hot water, throws in a spoonful of turkish spices (I asked him, "what's that?" he says, "just let me do my job" ... it was cardamom, btw), pours in the cold brew and just a drop of heavy whipping cream. The way he crafted it made it seem like a work of art. It was calculated, careful, perfect. 

He hands it to me and says "try that." I really can't stress how tasty and full bodied this concoction was. You just need to try it for yourself. Very simple. We also got a Tanzanian medium roast drip coffee. Very good, or should I say "exquisite." Sam didn't let us call his coffee "good," it had to be described as "exquisite." 

People rave about the Baklava here, so naturally I had to try a piece. Boy, best baklava I've ever had, seriously. Not soggy, not overly sweet, not overly greasy and weirdly oily. It's fluffy, chewy, sweet in every single bite. I will DEFINITELY be back for more.
author: Lauren S.

description:
It's not often that I rate a cafe after one visit, but I was super impressed with the wide coffee selection and excellent service that I received! 

I met a work friend for a morning meeting, and as I rushed in late and harried (thanks BART and MUNI), my anxiety level quickly diminished once I saw the inviting atmosphere at Golden Bear.  The wide, wooden tables mixed with the high ceilings made me think this place has great reading/working potential. I also noticed they have a wide selection of wines and liquor for purchase, so this place could also turn into your local liquor mart if you are so inclined! 

The owner was quite friendly, and my friend, who is a frequent visitor to the cafe, seemed quite impressed by his level of attention to our orders. There's also a HUGE selection of coffee to choose from, and my Yirgacheffe brew was quite tasty. 

I will definitely visit this place again when I'm in the area!
author: Keith H.

description: Best coffee ever. I tried coffee all over the world. I work in the city on an ambulance and drink coffee hourly. Hands down the best coffee I've tried. High quality and a work of art. If you know coffee than you know GBTC is the best place around.
author: Rick S.

description:
I'm coming back again for sure. This is such a nice family run coffee shop. Not only are the owners kind, but the coffee is awesome. Each cup is freshly ground to order, and with so many options, you really can't go wrong. 

Also you would be a fool to pass on the baklava.
author: Patrick P.

description: I'm not really a fan of the Sam's over-the-top insistence that this was the best cup of coffee I ever have. My cuppa was brewed alright and it was cheap, I'll say that. The place is nice to work at but honestly there was something off about the coffee and it felt slightly over-extracted to me.
author: Han Teng W.

description: Stopped in after a great morning run. Visiting from New York and glad we picked this spot as the shop to duck into. Sam is a mensch and a warm personality. Breakfast egg sandwiches on point. Pour over coffee perfectly made. Convinced me to put some cream into the coffee, and worthwhile call. And I really have to comment on tb baklava - made in house, and you can tell. The pastry layers were crisp and buttery and it overladen with honey and sugar, like some store bought can be. So good!thanks, Sam
author: Aaron G.

description:
Sam is legendary. If he isn't, well, he should be. 

I've been in SF for about a month and am still figuring my way around the Inner Sunset area. The second I walked into Golden Bear, Sam immediately greeted my friend (who was visiting from Sebastapol) and me, and proudly showed off his offerings. You can't fake that kind of enthusiasm and passion. If you don't like it, you don't pay, but everything was excellent! I tried the cold mocha, hot chocolate, baklava and some chocolate marzipan-ish dessert, which were all well-balanced and not overly sweet. 

Sam is a character and one that makes living in Inner Sunset enjoyable. I will definitely return and try the other menu items.
author: Audrey T.

description: As always the delicious coffee never disappoints. Great beer selection. Impeccably clean. Amazing service!
author: Nicolas B.

description: Visiting from Los Angeles and it's one of the best coffees I've ever had. No joke. Each cup of coffee is individually dripped. And he adds his magic touch with cream and sugar and it's simply the best. And the gentleman behind the counter was super lovely.
author: Helen K.

description: Awesome place... good service... make you feel at home kinda place... coffee service is great, you don't like it don't pay for it .. place is super clean, lotsa good desserts and wine selection.
author: Kelly B.

description: People here are really nice, and all the coffee here are handmade, and you can chose the beans or the stuff you want to put in the coffee~
author: Shu Z.
