description: The sign outside is a lie, I'm sure of it. I gave this place 2 chances... First time I tried a croissant, which was not good. The second time I bought a bottle of wine for $17... Turns out I got bamboozled. It tasted worse than yellowtail, and I looked it up online because I thought there was no way that should have cost $17, and I was right. Retail price is $7.99.
author: WunderTwin x.

description: Wow, strangely I haven't been to Golden Bear Trading Company yet, though I've been at UCSF for two years!  Great single cup of coffee, and what a variety of beans to choose from, including Jamaican Blue and Tanzania Peaberry!  Great friendly service... I would have to call this poetry in a cup.  I will definitely be back here...
author: Atul B.

description: This is my neighborhood coffee place and I enjoy grabbing a great cup of coffee here. Sam is garrulous, fun and always entertaining. And they got 100 on their food safety score which is unheard of.
author: Urban C.

description: Totally an experience with Sam! Great coffee and a great man! We've gone back for 3 straight days of our vacation!
author: sammy k.

description: This place is awesome!  Sam is a great guy this place has THE BEST coffee in SF. ( Phil who??).  They have great alcohol selections and the place is very cozy.  Gotta try the Brazil coffee it's amazing!!!  Definitley a place to bring family and friends.
author: Sam J.

description:
Unlike the expected coffee experience churned from the corporate Goliath down the street, the Golden Bear Trading Company acknowledges your unique greatness over an experience as mundane as a coffee purchase. 

If you're the "don't talk to me before my coffee" type of person, this is the perfect place for you. You will be challenged to get over that little weakness, and be a better person for it. 

Oh yeah, and the coffee is good. Drink up.
author: JonPaul T.

description:
Sam is back from the dead!

Sam is back and he's pouring the best cup of coffee in San Francisco.
I'm actually not a huge fan of coffee, probably because most places sell coffee that is very mediocre or just plain bad. When you taste a cup of coffee from Golden Bear Trading Company you'll understand what I'm talking about. It's amazing.
author: Ken A.

description:
Sam is the absolute best. Great sandwiches and coffee that will change your life

Looks like my review is in the short side
author: Erik B.

description: Randomly found Golden Bear through Google Explore while staying at an Air BnB in Twin Peaks. We walked 1 mile down the hill and were extremely pleased with delicious coffee & homemade pastries. I got a blueberry cream cheese danish & my sister got a bacon egg & cheese burrito. The owner handbrewed our coffee and made us feel welcomed and right at home.
author: Danielle S.

description:
You never know who you may run into at the Golden Bear! Kareem!

Sam served him a Cup-O-Love, so I know he'll be back soon. 

I wonder who will show up at Golden Bear next? With Sam, you just never know! This guy is connected!
author: Jonathon T.

description:
I think the coffee here is reasonably priced because it's pour-over but it's far from the best I've ever had. The flavor of the Sumatra is only so-so, I'll have to go darker next time. The chai lattes are a little watery. And Sam is quite the character but his in-your-face personality and his very clear love for $ scares me a bit. A lot of people interpret that behavior as "friendly," but being Asian and having to deal with Cantonese hustlers on the daily here in the Sunset, I can sense a shrewd businessman when I meet one. I also wish I could add my own cream and sugar, but hey, maybe Sam knows best.

Overall, the space here is nice and they sell flowers and wine and snacks and the best baklava in the neighborhood besides Lavash. I like that it's open late. Even though I think Sam is a relatively new owner of this corner store (circa 2009?), I hope he's here to stay. UCSF just wouldn't be the same without the Golden Bear Trading Company.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Sam is the man, just look at his strong stance. You can tell that this man is never going down. Whatever you need he'll make it happen and then some. The food is exquisite and it's got that homely look like grandma use to make but taste's better. The place is clean and pristine you can't even find a garbage can in the place because you can't associate anything in this establishment to trash; from the food, to the coffee and the people who go here, I challenge you to leave this place not thinking Sam runs the best damn coffee place in the city.
author: Eamon V.

description: I am addicted to Sam's way of life!  Golden Bear Trading Co. is not just a coffee shop it is a way of life. If you want a coffee shop go elsewhere. The Turkish coffee is incredible as well as the salmon and egg bagel sandwich!  Sam has some great sagacious life advice if you want that too!
author: Edward R.

description: This place has the best walnut baklava I have ever had! The owner Sam is hilarious. He made me a delicious cup of tea. If I lived closer, I would come more often. Next time I'm in the neighborhood I'll be at Golden Bear Trading Company!
author: Jason M.

description:
Sam and Golden Bear are two staples of the inner sunset. 

"If you don't like it, you don't pay," repeats Sam on my semi-monthly visit. He says so with the utmost confidence; I always like it, thus always pay. 

I recommend a breakfast bagel followed by some baklava. Add a coffee to that (made to Sam's liking means made to your liking), and I can't think of a better way to kick off your day.
author: Jack M.

description: The owner was not a friendly person. As a new patron, I asked for recommendations on what drink to order and immediately was given a bad attitude. Then tells me to take a picture before touching my food and write a good review on yelp. Seriously? Overall uncomfortable experience.
author: Rox C.

description:
Yo, honestly only 2 stars not 1 because I feel bad. Why should I considering I'm a consumer just being real...

First time I went Sam WAS the man: he couldn't have been kinder, more willing to give me extraordinary customer service, and have me feel that my business was appreciated. Sam sat outside with me while I drank my coffee, we had a decent conversation- but funny enough he kinda weaseled me into buying some pastries from him even though he made it seem like they were on the house.  That obviously left a sour taste in my mouth (not literally, the baklava was quite good "only star")

Yet, I chose to give him one more chance and come back. I was in the area with a friend and we were dying for some coffee. Golden Bear was the closest and it had been good enough product wise for me to try again. But oh my, not only was Sam far from hospitable, but he had an employee there who couldn't tell coffee beans from soy beans! Worse yet, his hands and fingernails looked disgusting- screw being unkept, they were down right gross.  

And good ol Sam, not one to coach up an incompetent employee: he belittled this man, glared at him and insulted him as though the mistakes were his fault (my friends coffee was not made to order) and ALL in front of us, the customers. Clearly Sam, his lack of training is YOUR bad. 

If you read all this, you know why I'll never be back. Ahhh fck it, only 1 star. Shine with that.
author: D V.

description:
I love this coffee shop, probably the original pour-over coffee place in SF. The owner, Sam, takes great pride in his coffee and after one sip, you'll understand. He also keeps a terrific selection of homemade pastries, cakes and Turkish bars. I don't live in the inner sunset anymore, but whenever I find myself over there, I make a point to stop in and grab a cup. I went this morning and it turns out my timing was good -- Sam hasn't been around lately (apparently he suffered some type of injury because he's hobbling around). Anyway, for those who do know the place, rest assured -- Sam is back. 

Cheers and enjoy!
author: Pete H.

description: We ordered the house coffee and hot chocolate, and they were unbelievably amazing.  The flavors were so rich and flavorful.  The owner was a really nice and polite man.  Street parking wasn't that bad, and we were able to find parking within five minutes.  We definitely need to come back again and try more drinks!
author: Cheryl N.

description: The best coffee I have ever had! I come from NYC and I haven't seeing someone make the coffee as Sam does. Each cup is personalized to your tasting and brewed right in front of you--cup-by-cup. There are plenty of options in terms of beans but I personally got a medium Italian roast. It was great; not too acidic and very smooth.
author: Richard P.

description:
"if your not here at the golden  bear, keep shopping. you can only find love at the golden bear where Sam is. How do you spell love? S-A.M. Love is at the Golden Bear"

The words I heard Sam repeat over and over. I wanted to quote him. 

Some of the better coffee I had in SF and probably the best on this side of the city. I tried the Mocha Java and ordered a chicken wrap. Coffe was great the chicken warp was alright. 

Coming here for great coffee and the character that Sam is makes this place a must try if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Jude N.

description: True hospitality. Places like golden bear give me reason to love yelp! What a treasure this space must be to this community. Great coffee & baked goods.
author: Lena Claire W.

description: This guy. He's like your very own neighborhood coffee-shop Buddha. I come here regularly in the mornings, and Sam is always there with a smile on his face, and a quick joke on the tip of his tongue. Now, while you can go to Phil'z (which I do adore), Phil'z coffee Isn't the same as Golden Bear's; you come for an experience, IF you're open to it. Sam is a part of that lovely experience. Coming to Golden Bear in the morning and chatting with Sam is a quick and easy way to get your cup of Joe while simultaneously being reminded that the world is great, life is good, and people (especially the lady-folks ) are beautiful. Come to Golden Bear with an open mind and some positive vibes; you'll be in for a treat.
author: Glen T.

description:
Love this Place!

As you can probably notice, I am not a very eager review writer, but this Coffee Shop deserves all 5 stars and a strong review!! Not only the cold brew coffee is top notch, but also the very pleasant customer service made my day on several occasions. First time walking in, I asked for a cold brewed coffee and only afterwards I noticed that I have left my wallet in the car, the barista gave me the coffee with smile on his face and told me "no problem". This king of genuine kind attitude is not very common nowadays. Next day I came for another cup of coffee and of coarse also to pay my debt! 
I strongly recommend this place to all the coffee lovers and not only!!
author: E M.

description: This place is a gem! Stopped by because I saw some baklava in the window and wanted to try it. I'm Jordanian so I know authentic when I taste it, and let me tell you this is the best baklava I've had in SF so far! Their blueberry muffin was better than the Starbucks one in my opinion as well. Sam was really nice and friendly, and I will definitely be coming back here for more deserts soon!
author: Khrystal A.

description:
Sam is not satisfied if you think his coffee at Golden Bear is merely very good - he wants to persuade you that his coffee is The Best.  And I would have to say that it is, due in large part to Sam's engaging and positive personality.

I tried about a half dozen of the coffees at Golden Bear, and all were excellent and flavorful.  Sam makes each cup individually, grinding the beans when you order.  He also has Danish pastries and baklava, a selection of wines, and other foods available.

Sam's coffee is indeed exquisite.  Maybe I can convince him to expand to Austin, TX.
author: Joseph P.

description: I wanted to like this place. Clean, well-stocked and well-tended to, but both times I went there the owner looked me up and down and made some sleazy comment. I won't be going back.
author: Amy H.

description:
THE BEST BREAKFAST SANDWICH I HAVE EVER HAD. I will be coming back to this place in the future because I also have to try the best cup of coffee I will ever have. This is the best place in the city and probably the best place in the nation. I heard that the owner walks on water and turns rocks into gold.

Dear Other-Sam-who-I-heard-built-this-place:
Thank you for building this wonderful cafe, but you're really missing out now. Too bad you're not here. We are having a great time here and you will miss it always.
author: Neil Z.

description: Possibly the best cup of coffee I ever had. They grind the beans one cup at a time. The barista, Sam is very friendly and proivides great service and conversation. If you are ever in the inner sunset hood of San Francisco treat yourself to a cup.
author: Dan C.

description: We've driven past this place on the way to UCSF a few times and saw the signs on the window regarding its ratings, so we've been meaning to stop by soon, and that 'soon' was yesterday. Went in after lunch and, since it was a first-time visit, asked for a recommendation for a dark roast. With zero hesitation Sam casually-yet-expertly made us an excellent cup of Mexican dark roast drip, black. And he wasn't lying either when he said that the coffee will taste even better when it cools down--hours later the coffee was still very much delicious (not merely/barely drinkable like the coffee from the other drip places). The chat was amusing as well, but I can see why his brand of humor might be off-putting for some people that have their undies in a perpetual wad. Sam is definitely a character--he would fit in perfectly as a recurring in Seinfeld episodes. If you can't handle that sort of humor your visit may not be as entertaining as ours was, in which case you might want to stick with the chains or that robot place. But if you want a perfect cup of coffee and a few laughs as a bonus, go here, and then write about your coffee epiphany afterwards. (If you drink wine, during your visit you might want to direct your attention to the mounds of wine bottles for sale on display in the inner half of the store.)
author: T J.

description:
Our grandson is at the UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital, we are staying in a Painted Lady on Fourth. When we woke up the day after our Thanksgiving Feast we Yelped for a great morning coffee. Right around the corner was the Golden Bear. Yelp reviews were great. I put on my pashmina and walked the three minute walk to this special treasure.
As soon as we walked in we told Sam we had found him on Yelp! I let him know how much I loved cardamom...he asked if I wanted cream and sugar and did I want him to choose my coffee? I said, "of course"! He blended some Turkish beans, added some extra attention, sugar and cream and after handing it to me asked if it was the best cup of coffee that I have ever had. 
I sipped, I tasted...and oh my...YES, YES, YES!!! Smooth, tasty, and perfect!!!
We will be back!!!
author: Kathy F.

description:
Me: "Good morning."
Him: (crickets chirping)
Me: "Do you take debit cards or only cash?"
Him: "We take whatever. What do you want?"
Me: "A latte please" (trying to read the menu but feeling pressured. this was my first time here)
Him: "There's no such thing as latte. Is this your first time here?"
Me: "Yes!" (hoping for some direction or explanation)
Him: "Well read." (pointing to the menu)
Me: (walks away...never to return and tell ALL my friends not to bother)
author: Daniel D.

description: This place has fantastic coffee and tea, Sam's not kidding when he says it's the best in the world! Sam will give you wise life advice as he pours your delicious coffee and don't be surprised if you stay a while chatting. The baklava is delicious too! One of my favorite stops in San Francisco!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
I have been a patron at Goldenbear for over a year. Sam makes the best cup of coffee money can buy. Not only is the coffee amazing but Sam is one of a kind and you will never forget him.

Yesterday Sam made me a cup so GREAT that it should be illegal.

So...if you like Pete's, Starbucks or Philz you obviously don't appreciate a good cup.

Go see Sam at Golden Bear Trading Company and you will never go back.


There is also nice selection of quality wine, liquor and beer.

"How do you like me now"
author: Chris S.

description: Sam is an amazing guy, and Golden Bear Trading Company is an incredible place. I came in to use the bathroom, stayed for a cup of peppermint tea with hand-picked mint leaves, and chatted with Sam about how life is a fucked up deal. One of the most EXQUISITE places I've been to in the city. I highly recommend it.
author: Austin R.

description:
I have retarded taste buds so, for me, coffee, until you get down to the Maxwell House level, is just coffee. But I LOVE Golden Bear for one reason: The owner, Sam.  He cares so much about pleasing his customers, trying to make interesting conversations with his customers--AND he does it with intelligence. I've never seen a coffee shop owner with such a fertile and friendly mind. 

And he's a kind person. While I was drinking my coffee, a customer came in and said he wants a good bottle of red wine for under $10.  Sam said, "That I don't have." But Sam walked over and noticed a last-bottle of its kind. It was marked $23.98.  "It's all right. It's the last one. I'll sell it to you for $10." That's a mensch.
author: Marty N.

description: My friend and I came in to buy a kombucha and after waiting 5 minutes while the owner allowed a customer to taste test various drinks politely asked to pay. The level of passive aggression we experienced after asking to pay was unbelievable. The owner scolded is for asking, and then told us we should have just taken the kombucha and walked out, paying later. He also yelled at us for using a credit card and told us not to come back. We won't. I've never experienced such terrible disrespect for trying to buy an item.
author: Ali F.

description: Sam welcomed our large (about 20 people) and spirited group and was the consummate host.   And his coffee is the best ever.  This is my favorite coffee shop anywhere!
author: Steven W.

description: Absoloutley amazing coffee and food! Owner is adorable and truly loves the art of coffee making and most Importantly making his customers smile. Breakfast was AWESOME! Had the breakfast sandwich and cinnamon role followed by a perfect latte! Also loved the market inside with a unique selection of wine, beer, liquor and spirits!
author: Sarah G.

description:
I haven't had pour over coffee this good and I've never seen a shop ground the beans to order. I had a regular Ethiopian (medium roast) which was fantastic! Sam, the owner, is a nice guy and really engages with his customers and made us feel welcome. The baklava was good too.

The shop is very clean and well lit which made for a pleasant experience after dinner. Definitely coming back!
author: Josh L.

description: Stopped by this morning to do some work and grab a coffee before heading to meetings at UCSF. Parked randomly near Golden Bear and walked in, what an awesome experience. Chill vibe, great music, incredible coffee and excellent bagel, and Sam makes you feel totally welcome. Sam makes each cup fresh and by hand (there are like 15 different roasts available), and he told me if I didn't like it, it was free. How cool is that!? They have a great selection of wine and spirits here too. If you are in the area, forget all the other coffee spots, come here and check it out.
author: Daniel L.

description:
"Best cup of coffee you ever had.  Or else I close up the shop and go home."

He wasn't lying, either.
author: Michael G.

description:
Golden Bear Trading has lots of fine wines,  beers, microbrews, and a price tag to match. they do their own pastries and coffee roasting too.

tasted baklava(2.5)slight sweetness, crispy layers, whole unsalted pistachios in the middle. great natural taste, not a pastry fan though.

brew: french dark roast drip over(3?) house brand
-silky smooth, robust, no harshness, almost like sightglass, heavier character
5 stars for coffee

drips:
-barrista says i don't need to pay if i don't like it.
not just a slogan, he means it,. 
-passed on the pastry after a sample, never a fan of pastry though,.  
5 stars for coffee, 4 stars for the rest. service 5 stars.
author: Victor G.

description: I just experienced the most horrific morning coffee in this place. The joint gets high reviews, after reading some of them, I figure most reviewers love this place because of the 'nice'  and chatty owner. After a brief discussion the 'nice' owner claims that we are like his ex-wife, bringing up the things she now does to other men, disgusting, in this context, continues with others stuff not printable here. Bottomline, he was way, way out of line with his comments for us to have a nice cup of coffee.
author: Salla V.

description:
My in-laws and I came here on a whim one day and I gotta admit, it was the best random urge I had all week. 

The cafe has amazing fresh beans from his own factory that lend their irresistible aroma to the somewhat bland environment (given I was there when it was pitch dark outside). 

The best part though, in the eyes of my fiancée, were the Turkish delights and dessert snacks. They were the best I've had in America and I've been to Turkey before. I can tell you they were pretty much on par with the traditional ones I had in country. 

We had one on one service with the owner who... Has a real particular charm about him. One of those cocky and ambitious types, but a real friend once you warm up to him (and him to you). This is a great place to be a regular at if you enjoy authentic traditional coffee.
author: Wesley Y.

description: Phenomenal coffee, excellent service, amazing turkish treats!!!!
author: Bryan K.

description: Came in and it took the old lady 30 minutes to make 3 drinks. The cold brews we ordered tasted like water and had no caramel like we asked. She basically made whatever concoction she felt like. The most bizarre coffee experience I've ever had. The old lady had no business working there. So if you see her at the register, walk out.
author: Layma A.

description:
Golden Bear is definitely a neighborhood staple.  If you're coming here, get the fresh, homemade baklava made by Sam himself.  Sam is a loyal owner and treats all of his customers like family.  He knows you by name and is always interested in how you're doing.  It's nice to know he's got your back.

He also carries only the best products and he personally endorses each.  I also stumbled upon wine in a can (I think called MANCAN) which was just awesome.

Check out the picture of Sam that I made him pose for with the fresh baklava and some of his new products!

Can't say enough great things about this guy and his store.
author: Michael G.

description:
AT and I got the iced mocha, iced coffee, and baklava.

The iced drinks are made with a cold brew--no ice used! No hot coffee was poured over ice to make the cold drinks, thank goodness. The iced coffee on its own is a bit dark for our taste, but those who enjoy dark roasts would probably very much enjoy it. The mocha is made with the same cold brew but with hot chocolate powder, sugar, and heavy cream. Probably the best iced mocha I can remember ever having... Also, the Baklava was also delicious.
author: Julia N.

description:
Almond croissant, you complete me. And Sam is the man to facilitate this important part of my morning. I ordered a Turkish and Sam goes "Oh I just made the perfect cup of coffee." He wasn't lying.

But really, Sam has been so gracious to make us feel so comfortable as we wait out a medical storm brewing at UCSF. Come by here. Drink the coffee, eat the food, talk to Sam.

And look at this beautiful almond croissant.
author: Karen J.

description: Will the owner please stop yelling at people from the doorway of his cafe? Three times this happened to me; he curses at just about anything and everything it seems. Maybe some folks find that endearing, thus the high and numerous reviews. But when I go out for coffee, I am there to RELAX. And when he finally stopped shouting and took my money, the coffee was just okay; good but not worth the hassle imo.
author: Michael B.

description:
Sam is a character, and this is a great place. There is excellent coffee, excellent service (although in the gruff, direct, but very helpful style), excellent sandwiches (although somewhat limited in selection). If you're looking for being anonymous in glitzy shop, this is not for you. If you're looking for gracious host, social atmosphere, great coffee, great food, and surprisingly great beer and liquor retail selection, this is for you.

The day we went, they only had brisket sandwich, but it was outstanding. I had the Turkish / Red Sea coffee, which was rich, smooth, excellent. I even bought a pound of beans to take home since I don't get to San Fran more than twice a month.

And as a bonus, the prices are very good for this quality.

This will be my go-to cafe when in the UCSF area.
author: Phil H.

description:
Kind of impossible to add to anything that has not been said.

1. Personality makes it worth the trip.
2. Cold brew is sick. Sick. Sick.
3. He'll coarse ground anything for you.
4. Learn about Middle Eastern confections.
author: Carun J.

description:
Sam made me a cup of coffee Wednesday around noon, saying if it wasn't the "best if ever had", that it was on the house. Well, I happily paid my $3 and am happily holding up my end of the deal by writing this review. 

I'm a Philz lover for sure, but without one anywhere near my house, this will definitely be my go-to local shop. Well done, Sam. I admire your confidence surrounding your product and pricing:)
author: Brooke C.

description:
I haven't written a Yelp review in a while but the service here has motivated me to write one. I normally frequent other coffee shops in the area but I was looking for a strong cup of joe at about 7:30 PM and this was the only place open. As many other reviews have stated, the owner was unpleasant. I asked him how many shops of espresso were in the mocha and he sneered at me, "there is no espresso in mocha. We don't use machines here." Okay, every other place in the world has espresso in their mochas but I guess I'm an idiot. He then tells me it will be the best mocha of my life (it wasn't) and that I will definitely be back. Perhaps you can just be polite to people and let them come to their own conclusions? These were just a couple of examples of an uncomfortable experience. I feel bad for giving a small coffee shop and a (I'm sure) hardworking person a bad review. But I also feel that this place could do with some much improved customer service.

Side Note: I had never visited this place in the couple of years I've lived in the area because I had heard unpleasant stories from others as well.
author: Varsha P.

description:
I needed to spent a few moments collecting myself before a meeting nearby and I stumbled upon Golden Bear. The Owner, Sam, made me feel welcomed and promptly provided me with one of the best cups of coffee I've had in some time. 

If I lived nearby, I could imagine sitting by the big windows and spending some serious time here.
author: Joe K.

description:
I was driving by and you can't miss this big open space on the corner of 6th Avenue and Judah. I went in originally for a coffee and ended up with a bear claw that melted in my mouth it was so good, and a sausage, egg, and cheese sandwich on an English muffin, soooo good! Sam, the owner, is very charming, very funny, and kind. The smooth music gives this place such an ambient feel that it's epitomizes what I consider the essence of San Francisco, laid back and welcoming. 

They also sell wine, juices, and all kinds of sweet treats, I highly recommend it if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Nora S.

description:
Holy tea leaves! I just experienced the best cold-brewed black tea blend I have ever had.  Not icy, so as to allow your palette to experience all the flavors packed into this blend.  Just a tad floral and a little grassy (in a fantastic way). The flavors transform with every sip and makes you want more.  This is Sam's secret blend, so you must come here for a try.

Tucked away from busy Irving St, but close enough to it and to UCSF, it's a perfect low-key place to hang out, people-watch, and enjoy a good drink and snack while you're at it.  It's clean, comfortable, and well-appointed with a nice selection not only of high quality coffees, sandwiches, and wraps it has a classy selection of whiskeys and wine.  Seriously, anyone who carries Auchentoshan, Oban, and Balvenie 21-year Portwood on the same rack (in a cafe of all places!) has my respect.  Come and get used to Sam's greeting, "Relax, I give it to you!"
author: Paolo M.

description:
Google "define euphoria" and it will say find a way to San Francisco, hang out with Sam and enjoy a masterpiece from this man! I'm not sure if it's a blessing or a curse to have an extremely passionate & picky coffee drinker in my Odysseys but in doing so I find myself striving to seek out the finest, boldest roasts to sooth her insatiable pallet. Once again the Yelp app proved to be a esteemed guardian angel, delivering me from the commercial and the mediocre coffee shops to this heavenly perfection of fine roasted brewology. (Yeah I made that up). My only regret is not staying closer to the Golden Bear Trading Co so that every morning could be extraordinary. 

We walked into the shop and were enthusiastically greeted by Sam (the owner). I informed him of my request of the darkest boldest roast of his best Turkish blend to satisfy the toughest of critics. Sam went to work, a scoopful of beans into the grinder, a cup of perfectly heated water and to my amazement hand brewed right in front of my eyes. The presentation alone thrilled our tastebuds! Eagerly Sam & I watched my girlfriend savor the first taste of this masterpiece and without hesitation-perfection rolled off her tongue!!! Nothing makes me happier than satisfying my extremely picky girlfriend so well that she eagerly requested a second cup after devouring the first. A mocha for me and a savory pastry set me up perfectly to enjoy my mornings delight as we sat out front of the shop watching the clouds rush by this beautiful San Francisco landscape. 

Sam is an amazing business owner and more people should strive to be like him. He is so sure of the quality of his coffee he said "here try this and if you don't like it, it's free". We spent that morning and the next morning getting to know Sam. His genuine personality & outlook on life set the course for our holiday and I'll tell ya...... I haven't enjoyed a mini getaway this enthusiastically in a long time.
author: Jay M.

description:
My husband and I recently moved into the Inner Sunset neighborhood of San Francisco, after living about a mile away in Cole Valley. This was one of the first places we started frequenting in our new 'hood, and let me tell you, this is our new favorite spot. Sam knew our names by the second visit, and he literally makes our morning every time we stop in. The coffee is the best I've had in San Francisco, and he makes mine with cream and brown sugar; which I now dream about. It's absolutely the best. You can pick your type of coffee since he makes each cup by hand, so it feels like a trip to the ice cream shop. And he makes sure I always get to taste mine first; chivalry is NOT dead!

So glad we live nearby; I'm excited to come back to grab a bottle of wine or other necessities when we're not just stopping by for coffee.
author: Kate W.

description: Great coffee...Sam is very easy going. He keeps saying if it doesn't taste good its free..Bought 1lb of his special coffee blend..
author: Giorgio B.

description:
I've been coming to Golden Bear Trading Company for a long time and Sam makes the best of the best pour-over coffee. Period. He's also the most friendliest barista / owner I've met and will chat you up, give you personal attention and keep you entertained and happy as he makes his coffee for you.

Don't let the name of the store fool you. The coffee here compares with the best anywhere!

I always make it a point to stop here for a cuppa and a baklava after my late night swim sessions and the coffee here always warms me up in the cold Sunset fog.

Let's support this business and keep Sam's excellent coffee flowing because if we lose Sam and this gem, what will we have left? It will be a very sad day for coffee lovers in San Francisco. Where are all you connoisseurs of fine coffee at?
author: Arjun T.

description:
GREAT coffee and desserts, plus a very nice selection of beer, wine, and liquor for purchase. (They also have breakfast sandwiches and lunch foods, but I haven't got to try them yet.) Owner Sam is a great guy with personality to spare. They're also open early and late, which is fantastic, especially for an outstanding early-morning coffee!

There's also a good amount of seating inside and outside.
author: Shaun J.

description:
Hands down, the best coffee in the city! And Sam made the experience worth while. My girlfriend and I came in simply to get some coffee to go and be on our way. Sam was more than welcoming and quickly got us comfortable enough to want to stay. He described himself, the shop and asked us about ourselves. 

He described his drinks as the best and even offered a challenge - if this coffee was not the best I have ever had, it was free. Bold statement, right? I took him up on his offer as he finished up the drip coffee.

I took a sip and he was right, the coffee was the best! The house blend was bold but not overwhelming and he added just enough cream to make it smooth without feeling sugary. He won the bet and  made a returning customer that day. Check this place out!
author: Joseph L.

description:
I walked in and out after realizing they had no nut free and dairy free options. However, one of the customers ran out and told me that their coffee is so good even black because it's not acidic and super light. I tried their water processed decaf (I never drink black coffee) and it was THE best decaf coffee I have ever had. 

A little on the pricey side for not even an espresso drink (decaf was 3.00) but well worth it to come back once a week for a treat!
author: Melissa S.

description:
If the majority of 5-stars reviews here are real, they are entirely driven by the personality of the owner. Sam is clearly an effective salesman, and boy does he sell! He asked me 2 times to try (= buy) a couple of different pastries, asked me several times to write a great yelp review and told me to tell my friends and colleagues about Golden Bear.

Anyway, the coffee's ok. It's not great. It's definitely not "the best f@#$in' cup of coffee" I've ever tasted, as the owner proclaimed. It was pretty typical pour-over. A couple of other places in the neighborhood have better coffee. 

I didn't try the pastries but i did notice that the prices on the booze and other typical corner store items were ~25-50% higher in general than the prices at the corner stores around 9th and Judah.

I doubt I'll go back.
author: Jim R.

description: Even though I went to CAL, I don't just frequent Golden Bear Coffee because of the name. I love this place because the owner cares about the coffee he sells, the delicious treats he serves, the adult beverages he has on stock (I prefer beer, so, I am partial to his beer selection).  Kathy, one of his baristas, is a lovely who treats me like a family member more than a patron. If you want an international experience with a delicious cup of Turkish coffee go to Golden Bear Coffee, especially you fans if Stanford, just kidding....
author: Stephen B.

description:
I was running early for my appointment at UCSF and figured I would stop at the little cafe and get a hot tea since it was cold and drizzly outside. I'm a little bit of a tea snob so I was pleasantly surprised to see Sam the owner scoop out loose tea from one of the many tea varieties behind the counter for my English Breakfast. He served it at a good temperature too which I appreciate, a lot of places the water is scalding hot and I end up asking for ice to cool it down so I dont have to wait 20 minutes to drink it. 

Sam was very nice and friendly, I liked the tea so I decided to grab a half pound of the same tea to take home since they have bags conveniently placed next to the register. If you like handcrafted coffee and tea and a welcoming and friendly environment this place is for you. If you are the type that likes to wait tapping your foot at the drink counter impatient to pound down your fifth triple mocha 4 pump frappa latte of the day, this is probably not the place you're looking for.
author: Noah H.

description:
Sam (from the pics here) the owner sure was on his A game! I was just passing by and thought I'd grab a cup of coffee. This cute super clean store sells pour over coffee just the way you want it. 

You pick which beans you like (I got the Colombian dark roast which was strong and acidic), then Sam freshly grinds the beans for a delicious pour over. He also creams and sugars your coffee for you. Wow! Great service!
author: Liz N.

description: There is nothing to say that already hasn't been said, but Sam urged me to write a review and post his picture. The coffee at Golden Bear is great, but Sam is undoubtedly the reason this place is on the Yelp Top 100. It was an unforgettable experience showing up on a normal Wednesday morning and being graced by his presence. If you live in any part of the city, do yourself a favor and make the trip to this unique place.
author: Kenny D.

description: The perfect combination: baklava and coffee! With the owner's recommendation of the house blend coffee, I obliged and have no regrets. The coffee was smooth and rich. He put the perfect amount of sugar and cream. The baklava was not too sweet and complimented my morning treat so well. I will definitely be back!
author: Marie N.

description:
Pros:
- place is clean
- decent selection of food and drinks 
- coffee is good

Cons:
- many items are overpriced, especially the sweets near the register 

- the owner, Sam is very sleazy. He feigns friendliness, but under the surface you can feel that he only cares about getting more money out of you. There's something dark and creepy in his eyes. It wouldn't surprise me if sometime down the road we find out he was a sex offender.

He is very pushy about selling you extra stuff every time you come to the store. Once he talked me into buying one of his pastries. The pastry was clearly not fresh, though he of course claimed it was. He warmed it up in the microwave(which made it mushy). As I bit into it, he stood behind the counter and added adlibs to my eating experience: he kept saying "mmmmm, isn't that good? Mmmmm yes. Best ever right? Mmmmm yeaaaaaaaahhhhhh".

I just get really bad vibes from him and he's the main reason I'm giving a bad review. I switch sides of the road when I approach his coffee house. It wouldn't surprise me if he did some really deviant shit in his time off, like killing small animals or molesting children.

I also suspect that he's manipulating the yelp review system in some way. The amount of positive reviews he's gotten, in such a short period of time, is disproportionate for a small, average-quality coffee store, in a residential neighborhood far away from the city center. Amid all the glowing reviews, there are a few that echo a very similar experience to the one that I've had. 

If this place switched to a better staff, this place would be at least 4 stars. Currently, I recommend you stay away.
author: Robert B.

description:
This corner shop was completely off my radar until I was out on New Years Eve looking for a good cup of coffee at 9pm. Most places were closed and we didn't want to have to default to Starbucks for our caffeine fix. After a quick search on Yelp, we saw that Golden Bear was nearby and proceeded to make our way to the mystery spot. 

2 spoonfuls of brown sugar and a splash of half and half later...sweet and creamy coffee heaven was met. Perfectly sweetened and creamed Turkish and French Roast coffees appeared - rich, bold, and satisfying. Dare I say it was better than the Philz Turkish coffee?! You are however paying Philz prices here though. Each cup cost is equivalent to a small latte, but it's completely worth it. I can't tell you how many times I've been disappointed by cheap, mediocre coffee. 

There are lots of other roasts to choose from and many are unique, but I like to stick to my dark roasts, and each cup is specially prepared right in front of you. They have an extensive selection of alcohol and a cool candy section too with European chocolates and such. Oh and you know those Haribo gummy colas? They have Haribo smurfs here. Yes. Smurfs. 

Can't say much about the pastries or other drinks on the menu...but for now, one of the best cups of coffee I've had in the city.
author: Deanna Y.

description: Best mocha I've ever had and "made with love." I have to go to the UCSF infusion center every month, but I just found the silver lining!! GOLDEN BEAR is right down the street and it's wonderful!  As I sat in this quaint shop for the first tjme, I watched the owner Sam, greet every single person with a smile and conversation. He made me a salmon bagel to die for! Thanks Sam, I'll be back soon :)
author: Breauna K.

description:
I tend to walk a little further to get a more reasonably priced coffee, that admittedly is a little less good. I like what's on offer here, great food, great coffee, but what lacks is the atmosphere and friendly nature of more local joints. The owner is clearly proud of his wares, as he told me in great detail just how many people love his place and come from miles around.....As I was trying to sip a coffee in peace, which was great btw, this was a touch intrusive. 

In all, great coffee. The baklava is double the price it should be. Or more. Wowser.
author: Chris H.

description: Hands down one of the best cups of coffee I've had in a long time. Seattle coffee snob has been brought to her knees by this sweet nectar of the gods.. handmade by a master, each cup is lovingly prepared by the charming owner from Israel. Seriously, so good I wanna marry it..or at least have an elicit affair!
author: Summer S.

description: The Golden Bear Trading Company is no doubt my favorite place in the city to buy a cup of coffee (its worth pointing out I work 20ft from a Philz). It's also great for a pound of beans for making coffee at the house (if like me you drink your first cup before 6am), a 6 pack of good beer, a bottle of good wine and even a bottle of whiskey. But the most important part of The Golden Bear Trading Company is the man that makes it all happen. The pride that Sam takes in his store and his merchandise makes me want to spend my money with him.  I like to keep a pound of the Mexican at home and I don't even touch my coffee maker anymore... it's strictly boiled water and a paper filter pour over for me.
author: Nick O.

description:
One of my favorite places for fresh and friendly coffee.  Sam is charismatic and is always trying to spread positive energy.  Love the huge variety international and local fresh drip coffee. Also love the chocolate cheese cake muffins.

P.S. After a night shift at UCSF I caught Sam cleaning up the intersection in front of the shop. He was scrubbing and sweeping every corner, not just he corner in front of his shop. SF needs more business owners like this.
author: Chad B.

description:
This is apparently the #1 rated SF coffee shop. I ordered an iced mocha (which, I think, was hot chocolate mix, some sort of sugar, heavy cream, and cold coffee all mixed together). A little out of the norm of a typical iced mocha, but I think I enjoyed it. The guy working the counter (I have a feeling he's there all the time) seemed pretty disinterested in helping us out. My boyfriend ordered the organic Peru dark blend but unfortunately spilled it all after a few sips. 
We went a little before lunch, but their sandwich menu was enticing. Build your own with a decent amount of ingredients to choose from. 
Maybe I'll go again sometime and get a sandwich.
author: Rachel W.

description:
Wow!  I yelped into the golden bear trading company in San Fran sunset. I have been on look the out for the right tea to take with me to give out to all the burners this year in black rock city at burningman 2015. 

Standing in line ahead of me, another burner (I overheard her preparations story she was telling Sam) ordered her coffee, and Sam pointed out the teas he had for sale. I picked up peppermint, jasmine, earl gray, gunpowder green, and this chicory and vanilla Yerba mate. Sam, who let me know it was ok to refer to him as not just really good looking, but an all around diva of a man, made me a free cup the way he likes it, with cream and sugar, and I am enjoying it thoroughly. 

Sam tells me that he wants to go to the burn this year, but it's not his time. I told him I am bringing him and serving him up via his tea. Thanks Sam!! The golden bear has it going on!
Peace and love
JD
author: J D.

description: This man is the most unwelcoming, unkind, coldest person I've ever had the misfortune of meeting. His presence and nasty glare started my morning in the worst way possible. He talked on his phone during the entire transaction, neglected to greet my friend and I, and ignored us when we asked questions. My friend has been here before and overheard the owner (the man who I referenced) harass customers into writing him 5 star reviews on Yelp. I wish I never went here, I hope I can save people from ever stepping foot into his store. He's in the wrong business.
author: Kate D.

description:
Self-run cafe with a super friendly owner named Sam who caters to his customers' personal needs. Been open for a year at a convenient location by UCSF.. Which a friend of mine and I stumbled upon during a lunch break coming from a training at UCSF.

Ordered the smoked salmon on a sesame bagel--toasted and salmon was on point. Took a sip of the Panama dark roast coffee my friend had ordered--a tasteful blend that you don't often find at just any coffee shop.

Sam, the owner, even had us try a piece of his pistachio baklava--not too flaky with just the right amount of sweetness. Mmm!

The cafe serves other pastries, sandwiches, and lotsa choices of handcrafted coffee and teas. There's also a wine selection and a few little goodies and snacks towards the back displayed in a grocery-like area.

Thanks Sam for your awesome hospitality!

PS. He didn't even make us pay 'til after we were done.


$7.59 for that bagel though.
author: Angela Camille D.

description:
In San Francisco, there are a million places to sit and download your latest addiction off wifi, thousands of coffee shop's, and hundreds of wine shops. 

There is only one Golden Bear Trading Company.  

You get all of the above and more, so much more!!! Sam, the proprietor, functions as barista, sage advice giver, and the local mayor. If you have visited a few times, he knows your name, he knows your dog's name. He knows which bottle of whisky you bought last time AND the one you wanted too but didn't (next time, Smooth Ambler 10 year, you WILL be mine).  He also whips up a savagely good cup of coffee.

The open space is immaculately tidy with tables and a lovely high bar against the windows, which is perfect if you want to pretend to work and instead watch the world go by. The shop is a true neighborhood haven. If you come more then once, Sam has your order down and fine tunes your coffee with cream and sugar all the while catching up on your life and introducing you to the guy standing behind you. It is impossible to be lonely at the Golden Bear.  The place also has an awesome wine and booze shop. Fancy pants dinner party and nothing to bring? Go to Golden Bear and Sam will help you out. There are swanky Napa Cabs, French bubbles, and affordable wines available. I have even special ordered a few cases of my favorite when I had a big birthday bash! How many spots will do that for you? 

Golden Bear Trading, you have a place in my jaded San Francisco heart.
author: Anna S.

description:
I walk past this place on my way to work and finally stopped in the other day. Amazing 
Coffee and a great atmosphere. Will definitely be a regular.
author: Sean K.

description: Light & welcoming lady greeted me right when I walked in. I couldn't make up my mind and she promised me that she will make me the best coffee, and she did. Walked out of the cafe thinking when the next time I should come back.
author: Henzel M.

description: I am not sure why everyone is rating this place so highly. I went there a few months ago after reading all the good reviews. The owner is out right creepy! When I asked him if I could use the bathroom, he said "It's very special, right in my bedroom and will cost you $4000." I honestly wanted to run out of there, but politely ignored his comment, ordered a coffee and pastry, and sat down for a bit. He was also rude when I asked him what kind of coffee he had. He said " I have over 40 different kinds of coffee, what are you talking about?" He made me look stupid for just asking a simple question. He did tell me that I didn't have to pay if I didn't like the coffee. I think the coffee was ok- not the best I'v ever had, and I still paid. I trust my instincts, and I didn't get a very positive vibe from this guy, hence I didn't use the bathroom. Never again will I set foot here!
author: Saziya L.

description:
FYI: This coffee shop doesn't serve espresso drinks.
+ Don't be fooled by "You don't have to pay, if you don't like the drink." You will still pay.

I think people either love this place or hate this place. I personally am not a fan -- it's just not my style of coffee (I like soft espresso drinks like latte). I am giving a 1-star not because of their coffee. I don't like how the owner pushes people to like their coffee.

When I went there the first time to try it out, the owner kept saying they have the best coffee in SF and said I don't have to pay if I didn't like it. I didn't like the coffee, but still paid and said the coffee was alright to the owner bc I didn't want to be rude.

My second visit was when I went there with a friend who wanted to try it out. I didn't want to order one for myself, because I knew it wasn't my style of coffee. When my friend ordered one and I didn't, the owner gave me an attitude and kept asking why I am not getting one when it's the best coffee in SF. I told him I tried it last time, and I didn't like it. The owner got furious and kept saying I should try it again and said that I don't need to pay if I didn't like it. I felt kinda forced to order one, so I did. I tried their cold brew again, and, as expected, I didn't like it just as my last experience. However, I didn't wanna say "I'm not gonna pay, because you told me I don't need to pay if I don't like it" so I still paid!! When I didn't like it and I knew I won't like it!! Anyways, that's my story. You may like the coffee, but I didn't. And I don't like the owner's cockiness and sorta rudeness.
author: Erika S.

description: As a newbie to the area in search for something to eat. I decided to swing into the modern sandwich/liquor/coffee shop and was very pleased to meet the unforgettable Sam who immediately made me relax and take a seat while he enjoyably made my sandwich with love and enthusiasm. Who knew a simple sandwich could taste so good when you see how it is prepared. If you are alone in the area and looking for a bite. Go hang out with Sam. He will be sure to put a smile on your face.
author: Aaron H.

description: Sam is such an awesome guy and will make whatever amazing coffee you want! Tell him your style and he's got it! The perfect cup! There are so many coffee bean choices it's insane! Plus the baklava is the best I've ever had! Completely homemade and delicious. I live in the area so I'm lucky to have him so close!
author: Lauren B.

description: Sam makes a *very* good cup of coffee. Definitely the best cup I've gotten at a coffee shop. I'm glad I came!
author: Christian C.

description:
Remember Philz? Back when you could walk in, say coffee with cream and sugar, and be handed a cup of something that just might be illegal it was so good and was obviously being made by a man who knew what you wanted better than you and not only did you know better than to tell him how to make this elixir, he would ignore your proto-hipster attempts to school him on his craft. 

Meet Sam. He might actually be Phil. I don't know - but I haven't had a cup of coffee this good since the last time Phil dumped out my coffee and remade it because the barista learning did something inexplicable wrong.

If you find yourself at UCSF, take a walk - it's good for your health and this is good for your soul.
author: Heather L.

description: Sam makes the best cup of coffee.  And the lady that works there is the sweetest person.  I love this place.  They have really good croissants as well.  I like that its the same people and a friendly place to come in the morning or evening.  I also love their cold brew coffee.  Also, Sam always gives me a little granola snack with my cup of coffee which makes my day!
author: Aubrey A.

description:
Sam warmly welcomed us and prepared our drinks: coffee & peppermint tea. The tea was poured through and through, so the result wasn't overly seeped - it was refreshing & perfect! The coffee was aromatic, creamy, and very smooth. Since my friend, Vicki, is a food blogger from Canada, Sam gave us samples of his famous baklava. Vicki scored it 5 out of 5 stars due to its contained sweetness & flakiness that simply melted in your mouth. It pairs very well with any hot beverage, especially their coffee. 

It was a very unique & personable cafe experience :)
author: Jenny K.

description: My cousin and I came in here because she suggested it. She said the coffee was really good and the way the owner made it was delicious. When we arrived, the owner wasn't there so I was bummed I didn't get to try it his way. To my surprise, he came up off the bench, while he was on break, to personally make me my cup of latte. It was delicious with the perfect amount of sweetness, cardamom, and bold taste of espresso. I will be returning soon.
author: Sadaf S.

description: Sam is a really swell dude and is confident in his business. Really good bagel breakfast sandwich
author: Mikey M.

description:
I went into Sam's today on my birthday with my girl friend. Sam treated me like a son and gave me some amazing life advice. Then some cake. It was delicious cake. At the Golden Bear Trading Company lies a very unique atmosphere that reminds one of home. 
Sam keep up the awesome work
author: Duncan A.

description: Sam is the man and his coffee is grade A. Highly recommend Golden Bear for anyone in the area or around it looking for a fantastic cup of coffee, a place to work, or a good conversation. Will definitely be back.
author: Ryan K.

description:
This is my first yelp review but I felt like I had to say how amazing this place was after my visit. When the owner, Sam, told me his coffee was out of this world I was a little skeptical at first, but after my first sip I was hooked.

I got the Ethiopian Yirgacheffe and it was awesome. Such a smooth cup of coffee that left nothing to be desired. I finished it so fast I decided to get something for the road and inquired about the Jamaican Blue Mountain. Its a little pricey, $7 for a medium, $10 for a large, but man is it worth it. Drinking this made the other coffee taste like crap. Each sip was like taking in a warm, loving hug. Only, it quickly disappeared and left you craving more and more. 

Sam makes the best damn coffee this town has ever seen, and I see myself going back real soon.
author: Edward H.

description:
Very disappointed! Been wanting to try this place for sometime and I went in today only to be refused service because he did not have time to make two deli sandwiches. No one was in the place so, I was very confused to hear he did not have time to serve us. 
     He told us to go to the submarine deli sandwich shop which is not an ideal place in my opinion. Don't think I will return which bums me out because I've heard it's a great place for coffee, tea, pastries, etc.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I just moved to the inner sunset a few weeks ago and Golden Bear Trading Co. is my new favorite spot. The coffee is DELICIOUS, there's a refrigerator full of the best Ben & Jerry's ice creams and the alcohol selection is quite impressive. What else do you need?!
author: Lauren S.

description: Update of my old review. I've been to this place 3 times since the first and it's always amazing. Highly recommended.
author: Will N.

description: Great coffee and service.  Sam is a pleasure, I had been taking care of family at UCSF for 3 days and found the Golden Bear on the last day.  Great seating outside, wonderful staff and the prices were fine, I'm not sure what the other reviewers were thinking.
author: Scott S.

description: I stopped by Golden Bear for a sandwich just before they closed. Despite it being a few minutes before closing the owner was very gracious and welcoming. I had a delicious sandwich, a cup of coffee and nice chat with the owner. If you come here for the coffee you will get the very best cup in town and I say that having tried over 30 of the highest-rated coffee shops in town. I enjoyed the food and the coffee but the unique service is what I remember the most. Now, about to the coffee. The taste is as good as any coffee I have ever had. Rich flavor, tantalizing aroma without that upscale chain-store coffee aftertaste. A must for any coffee lover visiting San Francisco and if you live here and have not yet discovered this hidden treasure, do yourself a favor and swing by. It is so choice. If you have a few beans I highly recommend picking up a cup.
author: Hugh M.

description:
In the city looking for a coffee spot near the hospital and we came across this lovely little coffee shop. Sam the gentleman behind the counter was super helpful. I saw that you could add cardamom to your coffee, so I asked him what coffee went best and he picked on and fixed me an awesome cup! He suggested I try the baklava as well and it did not disappoint. This shop also has a great liquor selection. As well as wine and beer. 
If you're in the neighborhood give this place place a try!
author: Bliss F.

description:
"It was a good day. Because I made it a good day. Did you hear what I said? I MADE IT. Because it's kindness that matters in this world and what you give to people not what you take for yourself . That root beer -- it is only two years old. I'm a grown man who cries and who says I'm sorry when I'm wrong. That is much more important." 

Spoken by Sam, who asked me to write a Yelp review for him so that "together we might make history" and make his establishment number one. Sam, you gave me much more than a root beer, and I thank you for it. (Though I have to say, with such a great beer and wine selection I was disappointed to see that Mug was the only brand of root beer you sold. Get some Kemper, my man!)
author: Paul K.

description: What a lovely place to sip coffee and relax. Amazing flavor which was only exceeded by the kind hearted and loving owner. What a beautiful soul! Best Halva in the world!!!
author: Ray O.

description:
I've been coming here for seven years and it's been five years since my last review. So much has changed in that time that I need to update it.

Sam is the man! He makes me feel like family, not just a customer. He's made lots of changes and a tremendous investment in the place. The inside is so nice and inviting since the remodel, and it's nice to see people sitting at the counters and tables working on their laptops, tablets, and smartphones. His coffee is amazing but it's his wine selection that you need to go check out. I love collecting and drinking wine and he has the absolute best wine selection in all of the Inner Sunset, Parnassus Heights, Cole Valley and Haight Ashbury. If you are looking for some unique, excellent, and exciting new wines you should definitely stop by!
author: Rebecca G.

description: I have stopped in a couple of times. The first time I asked for a hot chocolate -- asked if I could have it with non-fat milk and cinnamon -- owner was quite brusque and had an attitude -- said something like "My way is the best way and you'll like it." Not friendly at all. I chalked it up to his having a bad day maybe, and came in on another day to try something else. Same kind of welcome. No wonder I walk by all the time (I work at UCSF) and it's always empty. You get much better friendly welcoming service at the Beanery, and certainly Martha's.
author: M H.

description:
"It's more than coffee, it's a lifestyle."

I was just a simple caramel macchiato drinker at starbucks, so I was initially intimidated to walk into a store with countless containers of different flavors of coffee. But then Sam approached me. His positive attitude is contagious and it shows in every cup of coffee he brews. Seriously, coming here is as much of an enjoyable experience as it is a delicious cup of coffee.
author: Kevin S.

description: Best coffee shop ever! Sam, the owner, really knows his coffee, not to mention his baked goods. I came in with a friend on a sunny Wednesday morning and got the Guatemalan Medium Roast and a lemon poppy cupcake ...  both were so delicious & hearty. Sam went out of his way to make us comfortable and even gave free biscuits :-). Definitely recommend - will be coming more to this spot when I'm ever in Inner Sunset.
author: Yousef H.

description:
My new obsession. 

SUCH. GOOD. COFFEE. Came here because I was craving coffee and this place is luckily within walking distance. I tried the Guatemala with cream and sugar and OH MAN, it's just delicious. Sam does say that it'll be the best cup of coffee you ever have and says you don't have to pay if you don't like it.  But I did. And I'm addicted.  

His handcrafted coffee is just SO incredible - a bit pricey, but incredible.  Their breakfast sandwiches are pretty yummy too :) 

Basically, I will be frequenting this place. A LOT. I wanna try all the other varieties of coffee.  He also sells spirits and wines which I haven't taken a look at but it looked like a pretty hefty selection. Free WiFi is also a HUGE plus. 

All in all, I think I've found my new favorite place for coffee :)
author: Steph S.

description:
This place is amazing, the coffee is so fresh and creamy. Sam is also friendly, the shop is clean and also a good selection of bakery
Who doesn't like a personalized coffee to start a day! Definitely will come back
author: Xiaoxiao W.

description: The best coffee hands down. :) The Mexican hot chocolate was amazing and the coffee was perfect
author: Sooshi K.

description: Sam made me a large Tanzania Peaberry, adding my cream and sugar to the perfect balance. I think it was the best cup of coffee I have ever had in my life and I am a coffee lover. Sam was welcoming, gracious and friendly. The Golden Bear Trading Company was clean, well lit and had tables and chairs both inside and out. I highly recommend this little coffee gem near UCSF.
author: Leslie E.

description: My book club meets here -- Sam saves a table for us and is very welcoming. I love that I can get a delicious cup of fresh-brewed tea to drink during the meeting, and pick up a bottle of wine on my way out. Try the baklava!
author: Amy G.

description: Quality products, Quality coffee, and a worldly essence. I tried the Turkish blend with cardamom. Sam, who is the owner is knowledgeable and open to questions.
author: Stephen F.

description:
Morning coffee with Sam is more than "Amazing",
the evening wine selection is Wonderful, and the quality at Golden Bear is superb.  
I started coming here a year ago because my girlfriend lives around the corner and she requests it frequently. Just this morning we stopped in on our way to Tahoe and shared a warm cranberry scone, artichoke breakfast burrito and of course COFFEE. Although all the coffee is "amazing" It is hard to decide. We usually get the Organic Peruvian but newly added and just as tasty is the Jamaican blue Mountain. We are always greeted with a kind word and a smile. 
The hand selected and taste tested wine selection is one of the best I've seen in this city. Sam will be happy to help you find just what your looking for.
author: rob r.

description: Had a very relaxing morning with a bagel and some really good coffee after biking really hard from the east bay to get to the dental school. This was exactly what I needed. Thanks Sam!
author: Laurel M.

description:
Unfortunately Sam (the owner) was not the guy serving customers at the counter, the Asian man taking orders was less than helpful and not the most friendly. When asked what the difference between their Italian and Ethiopian roasts was, he didn't know and doesn't drink coffee. 

Other than that, the 10% discount for UCSF affiliation is appreciated and wifi + great lighting, tables and plugs is a plus. The bathroom is down a steep ramp so be careful, but aside from all that, the place is clean and optimal for studying and getting work done. Mocha itself was great, cocoa was semisweet and a good balance, frothy foam on top was delicious, and I will be sure to try plain coffee to taste the full flavor sometime. 
Will be back for the coffee and the setting.
author: Joy H.

description: Ummmmmmm. The coffee is fuckin delicious. Just...go and have some. Sam is the man over there. The Ethiopian blend is delicious and smooth.
author: Joshua H.

description:
Golden Bear Trading Company is a true gem..I have lived here for over 25 years
and never have I found such personable service, amazing tea and coffee drinks with a fantastic spread of homemade sandwiches and a wonderful new selection of local artisan chocolate to boot! Sam's customer service is the best there is....Go and see for yourself! You will be glad you did!
author: Stacy I.

description: Delicious tea. Very friendly service. Good selection of treats and drinks if you're looking to get picnic fixings. Apparently the coffee is delicious as well.
author: Camille E.

description: Handcrafted coffee, looks really professional! It's a nice experience and you can feel the freshness of the coffee
author: Levona C.

description: Golden Bear Trading Company is the most authentic and warm local cafe in the city, and Sam is its heart and soul. I am a San Francisco local and am lucky enough to have just moved into the sunset and discovered this place. The coffee and food are second to none, but mostly I look forward to coming here for Sam's infectious energy, humor, positivity and generosity. It's the best part of my day. Only lived in the neighborhood a few weeks and already a regular. This place is one of the ones that reminds you how amazing this city really is.
author: Alison L.

description: I've been meaning to try this place for a while since I've always heard great things about it and I live close by. The iced brew latte coffee is fantastic as well as the salmon and egg bagel! Sam is passionate about his coffee and the food and only uses the best ingredients. What a nice find in the inner sunset!!!
author: Albina K.

description:
Randomly stopped in for a quick cup of coffee and wow, what a treat. Not only was the coffee excellent (they roast their own, and brew it as you order it) but they have the best baklava I've ever tasted. 

As I sat and talked with one of the owners, Sam, I learned that everything is created in-house from roasting the coffee to making muffins and other baked delights to the house iced tea blend they brew.  Sam is very personable and clearly passionate about making sure his customers have a positive experience. I certainly did, and will definitely go back again. 

They also have a selection of wine, beer, and other convenient things one might need like eggs, milk, etc.
author: Cristina F.

description:
Golden Bear is such a warm & inviting space. Sam (the owner) is gregarious, hilarious and lovely. He shows his customers, whom he calls family, enormous amounts of love, and is present and playful with each order. 

The tea (Gunpowder Green) was exquisite, and the croissant was warm and delicious. 

Come visit Sam. Grow your fam.
author: Adam W.

description: This review is only about the service, nothing to do with the food or drinks. Owner (I'm assuming he was the owner) was extremely rude to me. I asked if there's wifi and he gave me a response that was rude and completely un called for. Then he told me to hurry up and order so he could take his break. Never was made to feel so awful in a coffee shop in my life.
author: Amy W.

description:
Sam knows service with a smile, and stays cool no matter how busy his place gets. He's always chatting with customers, and will get you to taste your coffee before you pay - he's very proud of what he makes and goes out of his way to ensure you're happy and satisfied. 
With beautiful, clean decor, it's a comfortable place to sit and work, or chat and relax.
author: George T.

description: Stumbled upon this joint by accident and ooooh I'm so glad I did!! No joke, I just enjoyed the most delicious piece of baklava to ever touch my lips and my smoked salmon and egg bagel was DELICIOUS. Seriously to die for. The owner was fantastic too- great, friendly service. I was in a rush and wish I could have stayed longer to talk to him about the coffee and pastries they sold there- it all looked amazing. I will definitely be back :)
author: Kim V.

description:
This place is such a gem and I wish we found it sooner!

I loved the personal touch from Sam. He was very welcoming, super friendly and he made us some amazing coffee! 

We will definitely be back for the coffee, brownies and the conversation with Sam!
author: Rhea A.

description:
Talk about some good coffee and company... This place feels like you're at home relaxing and enjoying a good cup of Joe, but it's more than a regular cup of Joe, you're drinking one the best out there. Plus with the company of Sam(owner) , you'll feel merrier and sense the passion he has about the coffee he offers. This place is just a must try and experience.

There are many coffees to select from, a few breakfast and lunch dishes, and pastries. I haven't tried some of the baklava or dishes yet, but it looks homemade and according to Sam, all the ingredients are fresh and top notch.  I'll definitely try it next time. 

By the way, if you're looking for a Starbucks Coffee, this is better, just don't be looking for some crazy Frapp or shaken tea concoction.
author: Donn D.

description:
Sam's the man! Right from the moment you come in he will great you and welcome you like you've never been welcomed before. 
Only time I've had someone so interested in my presence was when they were trying to scam me out of my tourist dollars by selling me something I didn't need. 
Sam is different. He stands behind his products and his shop with pride and it shows in what he serves. 
Would definitely go just to visit Sam, but the coffee there is pretty good too!
author: Derwei C.

description: Stopped in today and met Sam, I have driven by 2 times a week since Feb. today I felt I needed a pick me up and a snack. I had a large cold brew with cream and a chocolate chip cookie. I must say it was some of the best coffee I have ever had. I am so glad I decided to stop in, Sam was friendly and took care of me personally. I will be stopping in again on Friday... I highly recommend you stop by.....
author: Stacy P.

description: Coffee, Turkish baked goods and wine selection. Neighborhood gem.
author: Rob M.

description:
I thought I would be on a perpetual Yelp hiatus, but Sam's enthusiasm and persuasion got me motivated to ramble on the Yelp-mosphere again. 

The coffee is tasty. Much tastier than the sugar/cream/addictive-filled beverages at Starbucks. The baklava is flaky, aromatic, nutty, and satisfying. Here you go, Sam, five stars on Yelp for you.
author: Jenn H.

description: I would give this place zero stars if I could. The owner is extremely rude and I am surprised  he manages to stay in business. His sister used to run this place for many years and all of a sudden disappeared a few years back, so I obviously asked him where his sister was since I was a regular at that store. Not only did he deny having a sister, but responded to my question saying "I'm here to take your money."  Needless to say, I never went back.
author: Herman R.

description: Damn. The best coffee I've ever had! Better than philz I must say. Perfect balance of sweetness and creaminess. Since I like my coffee on the black side, Sam got it perfectly. Everyone should check him out.. Def getting the baklava next time
author: cliff a.

description: The owner is great, hella funny, and very personable. exquisite coffee. They have a really good selection.
author: Jerry F.

description: Coffee is served Philz-style - choose your blend, specify cream and sugar. Light roasts here taste better than the light roasts at Philz. They have a floral/aromatic element, kind of feels like a coffee-tea blend. Very delicious. The place is perfect for chilling/studying - spacious interior, calming music, very clean tables, and very fast wi-fi! The owner of the place (Sam) makes each cup himself! He's funny and energetic, treats everyone like a friend. The delivery guy came in to drop off supplies, and Sam made him a cup of coffee.
author: Jeffrey Z.

description: Let Sam make you the perfect cup of coffee.. As he says just tell him what you like. I was amazed by the flavor of the coffee - the subtle differences in choice of beans etc and his knowledge is what makes the finished product. Enjoy!
author: Matthew H.

description: Went in yesterday.  Was very impressed with the knowledge of Sam.  He made me a perfect coffee.  Then I bought a pound of Kenyan coffee.  Amazing!  Wish he was in San Mateo!
author: Sunil M.

description: Sam has Some of the best coffee around! I stop here every time I'm in the city no matter how far away I am. Friendly service, quality beverages (including a phenomenal selection of beer and wine!!) and great food...5 star worthy without a doubt!
author: Jay R.

description:
Having spent my undergrad years at Cal, I was already happy when I found out this place was named Golden Bear Market.  With my last final for the year approaching in less than one hour, I needed a strong coffee (and an excuse to leave my desk that I had been studying at for the past __ hours).  

The owner was chatting with a guest outside, but when he saw that I needed help, he came inside.  I ordered a coffee and he made it quickly.  He asked me if I wanted cream or sugar. I went with just cream.  The pour-over coffee was made very quickly and he had me taste it to make sure it was to my liking.  The coffee is flavorful and does not having any burnt/acidic taste at all.  It definitely gave me the caffeine buzz that I was looking for.  

I asked for his recommendation on baklava and he suggested the pistachio.  It was very full of pistachios and pretty tasty, but a bit sweet overall for me (but I think this is just to be expected.)  It worked fine with the strong coffee.  The total came to $5.49 and the whole trip took less than 5 minutes; not bad at all.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I was looking for a relaxing way to end my weekend trip to San Francisco and stumbled upon Golden Bear. 

When I walked in, my friend and I were greeted by the owner, who is very friendly and personable. He is clearly passionate about the quality of his offerings--and has good reason to be! 

While I'm no coffee connoisseur, I thought the iced coffee was good. The real star of the show, though, was the baklava. Golden Bear makes its baklava with whole pistachios, rather than chopped nuts. The pastry dough was light and flaky because it was drizzled--rather than drenched--with honey, which also allowed the flavor of the nuts to come through. 

I don't visit the Bay Area often, but I will definitely try to make it back here the next time I am in town.
author: Derrick H.

description:
I am SO GLAD that I live a few blocks away from this place!  The owner, Sam, is friendly, helpful, and funny.  His baklava is the BEST (as he promised me).  
The place is very clean, including the bathrooms.  The free wi-fi is also really fast.  I'll definitely be making this my new favorite coffee shop that I frequent.

EDIT:
This guy thrives on yelp reviews.  
I don't know of ANY other businesses that are this new that have 500+ yelp reviews!  That's just crazy!  I am a small business owner so I understand that yelp is important in the bay area, but should he be influencing customers to write yelp reviews?  We do that on our own, right?
author: Daisy A.

description: I walked by this place and stopped in for a coffee. The owner was very attentive when I walked in, but also very sassy. In fact, borderline rude. I asked for a latte (I didn't know it was drip only) and he said "No lattes here lady, but if you want a cup of coffee that will change your life, I can give you that" and I laughed but he was annoyed with me and dead serious. So I got my coffee which was okay, but not life changing. Sorry! (not sorry)
author: Marisa L.

description: This is probably the best coffee shop I've been to, especially if you're a tea person. Afaf and his family are kind, welcoming and always bring that special touch to their handmade drinks and amazing food. Can't beat the homeland music and family feel. We have the pleasure of seeing them a couple times a month when we have to travel to sf, but if we were locals I'd come down more often. Treats you won't find elsewhere like baklava, macaroons, israeli chocolates and more, plus a great selection of artisan wines, liquors and craft beers plus some groceries makes it a good stop for any of your daily needs.We love you guys, and are happy for anytime we get to pop in n say shalom! For anyone who doesnt understand why its getting such good reviews, please keep walking, this is a great place to be Appreciated, not a consumer $$driven corporate starbux kind of place, and if ya don't get it, you're probably a perfect starbux consumer target.
author: Katie A.

description: My day took a turn when I missed my stop on the bus and left me lost in the Sunset district. Luckily, I found this gem of a cafe. I ordered a large house blend and a bear claw. I don't usually add cream and sugar but it was prepared perfectly. The customer service was also great! I don't live in this district but I definitely plan to return for a good cup of coffee.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Sam was very friendly and makes an excellent pour over coffee (I got Vienna beans). Very light as advertised with no bitterness. 

Probably one of the few places in the city with decent coffee and a pretty good selection of Scottish and Japanese single malt.
author: Richard A.

description:
