This is some of the best coffee ever. I first found this place in '13 while visiting a friend at UCSF. SAM, the proprietor, made me a cup of traditional coffee from his native Haifa. With cardamom, cream and brown sugar, it is a delight. 

I don't get to the City often, but when I am in the area, I hit the Golden Bear Trading Company.
author: Kate M.

description:
This is not a place to go. First of all, the coffee is below average. Second, Sam is definitely a good salesman, but overly pushy in an unpleasant manner. He kept asking you to come back and bring more friends.

Still don't get it why there are so many 5-star reviews and why many Yelpers posted Sam's photo. How many of you would post a photo of the owner of a coffee place?

Let's do some simple data mining. This place got 20 5-star reviews from July 1st - July 22nd(today), 2015. This frequent 5-star reviews are abnormal, given the fact that this place is always empty. Let's compare with other popular coffee like Philz. Philz at South San Francisco only got about 12 (4 or 5)-star reviews in the same time interval. You know Philz always have a long line.

These frequent 5-star reviews are very likely to be fake. So stay away from this place.
author: Quan D.

description:
Overpriced deli with below-average fare for the neighborhood.  I'm not sure how this place gets good yelp reviews, there are many coffee and sandwich shops nearby with much superior food.  This place never has a line and is usually empty -- for good reason -- you have to put up with the owner!

The owner is an over-the-top, crass character who will talk your ear off the entire time you're in the store.  You will definitely feel uncomfortable as he pushes coffee on you and gives sound effects "mmm, isn't that the best, right?" the entire time.  He will go on nonstop about how he makes the best sandwiches, the best coffee, etc etc in the hope you'll believe him. Then he asks you to post a yelp review and tell people about him. 

The coffee is mediocre and he does the Philz-style one-cup-at-a-time pour over so at least it's fresh, but his pushy yammering the entire time makes the experience unpleasant.  

Most of the store's items are overpriced and come from Costco -- you can see Sam parking his car in front of the shop and taking Costco boxes into the store to stock the shelves.

I live a block away from this store and I walk another two blocks to go to another deli, rather than walk in there and have to talk to Sam.
author: Shamus S.

description:
I've been there twice. Coffee is really strong and just a cup will keep you all day long. The first time I got there, the owner was around, it was late morning and he made sure that I enjoyed the drink. The second time, there was only the older guy (barista?). When I entered the store, he was sweeping the floor outside. I said hi and told him not to rush. Though he was way too eager to take my order. So eager, that he didn't wash his hands. Hello!!! How about Food Safety??? It was disgusting. He didn't wash his hands after handling money neither,
I remember I had Brazil roast, it was too acid for me. Honestly, I did't manage to finish the cup because of unsanitary.
author: Katie K.

description: I love coffee and was surprised/delighted to find an amazing cup right around the corner from me. Located on the corner of 6th & Judah, Golden Bear is sunny, roomy, and serves a delicious cup of coffee. There are tables and counter stools for work. Aside from coffee, you will also find wine, beer, ice cream, and snacks. If Sam (the owner) asks if you want cream & sugar in your coffee, just SAY YES.
author: Kallyn G.

description:
Sam makes one amazing cup of coffee! I had the Turkish blend and couldn't be happier with how it came out - smooth, dark,  and fresh!  

Sam, thank you for jump starting my day!
author: James C.

description:
I go in and the owner isn't even around. I use the restroom and proceed to the counter. Didn't have any salmon bagel as requested. Asked about the "breakfast special" which turned out to be a pre-made saran-wrapped, refrigerated English muffin with egg and cheese. The owner hypes it up to my face that it is "hand made" after taking it out of the cold case fridge and microwaves it on a coffee filter. All the while saying it's the best and boasts about how he has the best bathroom. Then he tries to bs me into buying the "best coffee"

Has signs all over the cafe saying that it is #1 in San Francisco and #9 best in the bay. Total bs - All hype and bs. How is this place even more than two stars? Don't let the fake ambience and renovation fool you! Never coming here again - would give 0 stars if I could.

If you want the best overpriced "handmade" microwaved English muffin with egg and cheese, please come here.
author: Larry L.

description: Philz? Blue Bottle? Four Barrel? Nope, even better. Coffee here is by far better, not only the beans, which there is a huge selection, but the process itself. Plus, you get to talk to Sam while he makes it. Best spot in town!
author: paul v.

description:
I haven't been to Golden Bear since they remodeled the place, but I went today and the place looks beautiful. I had the Turkish coffee with cardamom and a delicious piece of homemade baklava. Sam made a smooth cup of Turkish coffee and when he handed it to me, he said, "It's going to be the best cup of coffee you'll ever have." It was so good, I had to resist ordering a second cup!  

It's a great place to study at because it has free wifi and tons of space. It also has large windows for natural light. Sam was so kind to check in with me to ask how the coffee was and that is what you call great customer service.

If you're ever in the mood for some excellent coffee, check out Golden Bear. There are different types of coffee beans, sweets, and food. They also have a wine section and flowers in the front. I'll definitely come back for more!
author: Lauren Y.

description:
I'm writing this as I'm enjoying my cup of coffee from Golden Bear. Mmm. I don't know how I've been working in this area for almost 3 years without trying this place. I've been missing out! The owner, Sam, is awesome. He's really friendly and actually takes the time to formally introduce himself. 

There is a wide selection of coffee beans and the best part is that he grinds the beans and drip brews your single cup complete with cream and brown sugar (if you want) after you order so it's super fresh. I tried the Turkish blend today with cardamom and it's amazing. Sam adds just the right amount of cream and sugar and the subtle hint of cardamom is perfect. 

This place also has pastries (including baklava!), breakfast sandwiches, and even serves as a liquor store with a wide variety of beer and hard liquor.

I've walked down here twice this week and I might just go again tomorrow!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Best coffee shop in sf. Love the owner and he always has something nice or funny to say. Will wait or go out if my way to come here. Such a gem for people looking for great coffee. Sick of other locations selling you with their hipster bullshit and not the coffee. This place doesn't disappoint!!
author: Mike S.

description: This place is something else. In a very good way. I like to think that I have a decent knowledge of good coffee. But talking to Sam shows me I have a lot more to learn. First time at a shop and I like to let the barista give me some tips on what to get. If you get overwhelmed by the large amount of different roasts, just ask Sam and he will whip something up that is perfect. Yes, San Francisco has a lot of good designer coffee shops like Four Barrel and Sightglass, but Golden Bear should be on every coffee fanatic's list. You'll leave with a great cup of coffee, a great attitude, and maybe even a life lesson or two.
author: Conor U.

description: Owner told me it would be the best cup of coffee I ever had, and I think he may have been right. I'm a bit of a coffee snob and this coffee exceeded my standards.
author: Charley A.

description: I have died and went to coffee heaven . We got the cold brew and owner sweetened it for us. I was in loooooovvvveeee
author: Masha G.

description:
After walking in, you can already tell the place is special. The owner Sam immediately welcomed me and I quickly learned that I just met one of the nicest people in the world.  I could give 5 stars just based on how Sam treated me after in arrival, but as many others have said, that is not the only good thing about Golden Bear. 

The coffee I had was a blend Sam made himself. Simple, black, drip coffee, but it was one of the smoothest and least acidic coffees I have ever had.  He really knows his stuff, and it will now be my go to coffee spot in inner sunset.   

I also ordered the smoked salmon breakfast bagel.  Great salmon, fluffy eggs, cream cheese on a toasted bagel, you can't really go wrong.  Sam was also nice enough to let me try some of his Baklava.  I will be the first to say I am not a Baklava fan, so I had an expectation that I would not like the sample. But I was wrong.  Baklava is normally too sweet for my taste, but his was much more subtle with the sweetness and the other nuttier flavors were the star.  It is the only Baklava I have ever liked. 

Lastly, I am a whiskey guy. So when I find a coffee shop that is also a liquor market that has a good selection in whiskies, I couldn't be a happier guy.  They also have a great wine and beer selection.  My new one stop shop. 

Go for the coffee, stay because Sam is simply amazing.
author: Richard C.

description: No better place to drink amazing coffee and enjoy tasty snacks. Sam made me feel at home and put me at ease as my brother was getting surgery down the street at UCSF.
author: Zev F.

description:
This has to be the best cup of coffee I've ever had in my life. Sumatra light roast was my choice, freshly brewed by the cup. 
I cannot tell you how glad I am I walked in by chance. 
I've worked at a coffee shop for years now, and I can say without a doubt that this is the best cup of coffee I've had in my life. 
I also stopped by for a bite to eat and the sandwich was also very delicious. Perfect amounts of everything. 
Isam definitely knows what he is doing.
author: Dulce O.

description: Come to Golden Bear Trading Company to meet Sam- he's a fortune teller AND the owner! The Chicory Vanilla Yerba Mate with almond milk was divine.  I recommend this spot to anyone looking for a cup of bliss and a good snack.
author: Margie S.

description:
Fantastic coffee find! Everything is handcrafted and made with pride by Sam the owner. He is extremely friendly and makes a delicious cup of java. I normally drown my coffee from Starbucks or Peets with cream and sugar but the brew is so good here that it's unnecessary to alter it in any way. 

A great gem in the neighborhood!
author: Stacy T.

description: Delicious coffee, great atmosphere. Selection of coffee beans is varied and well chosen.
author: Jesse H.

description: I'm decidedly new to the city, so I don't have enough experience to evaluate GBTC relative to other places locally.  I can say that this is the most welcoming, relaxing cafe for getting things done that I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing.  My tastes are simple, but the medium house blend is everything I want in a stout cup of black coffee--steaming, toasty, smooth.  And you'd be hard pressed to find a barista zanier and more inviting than Sam.  Abundant space, free wifi, lots of outlets: I will be back any time I want great coffee to accompany a productive grind.  As Sam was sure to remind me: here, they serve a cup of love.
author: Matthew C.

description: Great atmosphere, great coffee and a surprising selection of whiskey!  Sam insists on making his sandwiches from scratch and his coffee strong. 10/10 will be back.
author: Taylor G.

description: Having just moved into the city, I was on the search for a local coffee spot. Came across this shop on yelp and thought "are there any pictures of coffee and not this guy Sam...?" Being that it was 9pm @ night, options limited, I decided to check this place out. Walked in, greeted immediately by the man himself, and the rest was history. He recommended me a drink when I was indecisive, a dark chocolate latte, told me if I didn't like it then it'd be on the house. Well, my wallet was a few dollars lighter because there was nothing not to like about the drink. All in all, a great first experience, stand up guy. I now understand why his yelp page is also Sam's fan page.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
BEST COFFEE EVER!
I was in town with my husband who was at UCSF and was glad to find a place across the street from where my daughter and I were staying to get my morning coffee.  Not only did I find the best coffee but Sam, the owner,  was great to meet and greet us every morning when we stopped in for my coffee and every evening for beverages and snacks. We even bought coffee to bring home which I have been enjoying every day. We will definitely be going back when we are in town.
author: Marie M.

description:
I am so surprised to see this place has so many positive reviews. I think many may be fake. The pictures on yelp make this look like an amazing place. Yea, no. It's basically a minimart that tried to add some coffee service.

Drinks:
They do not have any syrups for coffee. As a result my co patron opted for a mocha. He didn't even want to finish it (which is very unusual) because it was subpar.
Ordering the mocha was a bit tough. Clearly this isn't what they normally do. They added hot chocolate powder to a regular cup of coffee. Mind you, mochas are listed on the menu.

Seeing the difficulty ordering the mocha, I ordered a Mexican hot chocolate. This hot chocolate was made with "hot" water and hot chocolate powder and a small sprinkling of cinnamon on top. It was served barely warm. Not quite Mexican hot chocolate. Disappointing for $3.75. (!)
Again, an item from off the menu.

Food:
The pastries looked questionable and likely not fresh. Those pictures on yelp, hmmm must have been specially setup for a photo-op. You will not find that kind of display when you visit the location.

Well, what can I say, we were hungry and hopeful so we ordered food anyways. I tried the butter croissant. Bleck, not fresh. My co patron tried the breakfast sandwich on a bagel. (Egg and cheese)
Ummmm they added cream cheese.(?!) this was not listed on the menu and is an odd addition to an egg and cheese breakfast sandwich. Not only that, the bagel was NOT  fresh. He could hardly bite into it. Needless to say, we did not finish our food.


Environment:
As mentioned above, this place looks like a mini-mart that decided to add on coffee as an after thought. The pictures on yelp are great, but that's not the environment this place offers.

I cannot say if the prices are decent for the alcohol on sale (bottles, not consumption) because we were here for breakfast.

We will definitely not be returning.
author: Zoe D.

description: As a Seattleite addicted to coffee, I can tell you what's a good cup of coffee. But I also can tell you what's a horrible cup. Sam at Golden Bear bet me that he can make the best cup of coffee I've ever had. And I must say, the Costa Rica pour over he made me is up at the top of my list. The coffee has a light body with a slightly acidic and fruity aftertaste. It's pretty clear that the beans are fresh. So to anyone visiting UCSF or those at/around UCSF, make sure you stop by and enjoy a damn fine cup of coffee, you won't regret it!
author: Philip W.

description: Updated to add: the baklava is to die for and very fresh as well! Be sure to order the pistachio :)
author: Vieta K.

description: You know those places where you always just have to wave or honk when you go by? That's what Golden Bear is for the palette and Sam, the owner, is for the community. That's even before you get to his delicious coffee. Today we came in...he made us amazing coffees...one of them an awesome blend of four coffee beans. Don't just stop at the corner...come on in and be amazed! And if you're extra nice...he may just give you a free taste of his delicious baclava!
author: Hernan V.

description: Sam is incredible. Not a friendlier host in the world. His passion for his craft of coffee is incredible. Jamaican coffee is best overall coffee in SF.
author: Matt V.

description: This a local gem. I've come in a number of times on my way to UCSF and I have always left happy. Sam is great and takes a lot of pride in his business. He makes the best coffee around and his smoked salmon bagel is my favorite way to start the day!
author: Reese W.

description:
Great coffee and beer selection. Very good location near to UCSF in the Sunset.

Owner is very kind and helpful. Would definitely recommend. Hope this place stays open and successful for years to come!
author: Brett H.

description:
This was my second trip to Golden Bear. I was in town with family and we made a special trip to enjoy a fabulous cup of coffee together. We were not disappointed. Sam delivered.  While there we also had the dark chocolate, almond coated halva. It was beguiling and addictive!  The baklava is also to die for. And, of course, we couldn't leave without a macaroon. 

Check out Golden Bear Trading Co. You won't be disappointed.
author: Nancy M.

description: I had a cup of the Kenya dark roast. It was a clear and strong cup (no bitterness and no aftertaste) and so I brought a pound of beans home with me. There's a lot of coffee selection and each cup is single-brewed. Very nice atmosphere with a friendly owner. There's also a nice wine & alcohol selection. This is a great neighborhood find and I will come back! Thanks again Sam :-)
author: Anmay K.

description: It's my 3rd day in SF and the first coffee shop I tried, based on Yelp reviews. Sam looked very friendly and warm from the first encounter and made me feel very comfortable. He is very good with people and makes the experience beyond coffee, tea, and wifi (of course if you are also willing to). I will go back to his place as long as I stay in this neighborhood.
author: Sou M.

description: I stop by every chance I get. Coffee, wine, treats... Or just to visit with Sam. I love the Golden Bear.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Sam is a gem. Super welcoming, eccentric and helpful. His be in the moment and totally unique mentality is both refreshing and entertaining. His company alone is enough to warrant the 5 star accolade. 

There is an expansive melange of diverse coffee choices. He makes an excellent cup with cream and sugar, all frothed by loving hands.

The baklava was flaky, light and not too sweet. Definitely some of the best i've ever had. I cant wait to go back and try more pastries and menu items. 

The place feels like a cafe in Tel Aviv--such excellent vibes.
author: David B.

description:
Felt like I was back in Europe.  Sam made an amazing cup of coffee, great sandwiches and the baklava was so good!  There was no rush to hurry up and pay and get out of there.
Picked up some tea and can't want to try it.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Fun place, nice decor, good coffee. 

Came here on a sunday night to get some work done. This place is known for the coffee and the turkish desserts. I am not usually a drip coffee person, so probably no the best judge of how this compares to other coffees, but I liked what I had. I like the white theme for the tables and chairs. 

Sam, the lively and energetic owner does have a good sense of humor and made the small set of people on a sunday night feel very much at home. Most importantly, got a good amount of work done while sitting here so this place definitely gets a 5 star !
author: Mohit L.

description:
As a graduate student, I am constantly looking for a quiet place to work in the inner sunset. 

It's really welcoming right off the bat. White walls and furniture make it really bright inside, and it gets a ton of natural light too. Perfect for studying. 

There are plenty of things to choose from as far as drinks and food. I got a turkey and swiss sandwich. It was just what I wanted and made pretty quickly. 

I only wish the wifi was a little better. But I definitely see myself coming back to study.
author: Martha G.

description:
The absolute BEST coffee within walking distance of UCSF. Hands down beats Starbucks and the little corner carts next to the Hospital, and it's only 2 blocks away. 

I am not one to spend a lot of $$ on coffee, ever. But this coffee is worth it, comprable to Philz. 

Also, a great beer/wine selection, really great and personable owner, tasty baklava and decent baked goods in the morning! But, it's their ground upon order, richly flavored, perfectly roasted pour over coffee that has me coming back every time!!
author: Melanie M.

description: Sam provides a very unique kind of twinkle in the gem of SF, that will inevitably rub some people the wrong way. But between his rough edges and haphazard manners, he really just wants to spread the love and be loved in return. I'll be ever appreciative of him sharing his fruit with me while I enjoyed his freshly brewed Jasmine tea.
author: Ginger B.

description: This place quickly impressed me.  If you enjoy fine wine, coffee, tea, or single malt scotch, you should drop in.  They know how to make excellent pour over drip coffee, every aspect of my sandwich tasted fresh, and I had a great conversation with Sam (the owner) about other excellent local businesses and food.  He wants your business, and is willing to work hard to get it.  I'll be returning.
author: Chris K.

description:
The always-friendly staff make this an easy stop when I'm a block or two away, and want a coffee, food, snack, or to pick up some drinks for a party. And speaking of coffee, their variety is impressive (personal favorite is the Turkish Red Sea Blend), and you will find that if Sam makes it for you, it will be the best cup he's made all day; hard to argue with.

Worth your time to stop by and check it out.
author: Carl F.

description:
I had the best cup of peppermint tea from here. It was brewed with a lot of love. 

Stay strong, Sam.
author: Winny M.

description: Visiting from Florida. I tried 10+ different coffee shops in the week I was here. The only coffee shop I visited twice was this one. They have the best iced / cold coffee, and Sam is a trip to talk to! Try the baklava too while you're there, it goes great and it's freshly made in house. Totally worth the rating it has!!!
author: Haley C.

description: Great selection of some hard to find whiskeys, and local wines. Sam will help you with anything, even if you have personal problems, he will tell you a story to make you feel better... As long as you try his coffee. Good coffee, good place to study, and good place to find wine for my girlfriend who is a borderline alcoholic... But i already talked to sam about that. He told me to try beer.
author: Daniel P.

description:
The coffee is amazing. I can personally vouch for the house blend and the Brazilian. 

Sam is a treasure. Enthusiastic, warm and passionate about coffee. 

Grab a cup, have some pastry (or the very tasty salmon bagel!) and sit out front on a beautiful Inner Sunset day. (If it's foggy, per usual, you can sit inside.)
author: AJ H.

description:
I can't understand the bad reviews this place gets, as infrequent as they are. My girlfriend and I walked into Sam's store a few months ago and he finally convinced us to write a Yelp review (it didn't take a lot of convincing, just some reminding). 

Hands down, Sam's coffee is the best coffee I've had and it's still my favorite in the city. You can tell the man knows his coffee, and he's very proud of his house blend, which he combines himself. The coffee is gorgeous, a mix a light, dark and medium beans and it smells even better. 

I'm stoked I found this place, and I go whenever I'm walking to Inner Sunset. 

A solid beer selection is a nice added value, too.
author: David R.

description:
Best service and sarcasm on the planet. Sam will lighten your day in the most profound spiral of jokes you've ever experienced. 

Also...get the drip coffee, there is a secret ingredient.
author: Louis T.

description: I love coffee but there's nothing like being in Sam's arms because you can guarantee his coffee is pure and unadulterated. Sam makes his coffee with his soul, mind, and body and it is heavenly ;-) we are hooked!!! I mean, I'm back here for my second cup of coffee today...... And the baklava!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Sam told me to write him a Yelp review.

I told him that he's already quite the man on Yelp and doesn't need my help.

He told me to do it anyway.

Sam's Golden Bear coffee: Kicking A every day.
author: Lisa E.

description:
Just had the best cold brew coffee ever. Such a clean taste and experience. Had a great conversation with Sam about life and living. I've been before, and I'll be back. 

Also I noticed he put in a beautiful beer & wine selection. So different than this shop used to be 3 years ago!
author: Jeremy H.

description:
Sam is a cool dude.  Big personality.  Super friendly.  I like him.
Coffee seems like a Philz wanna be (not that Philz has patented the One-Cup-At-a-Time, but.....)

Says his last name is Jaber -- same last name at Philz proprietors (Jacob and Phil).
Told me he was "best friends" with the lesbian Rabbi at Temple Emanu-el.  Guess he could tell right away which team I bat for.

Coffee was great but could have been a few degrees warmer.  
I'll be back for more frolic and merry with Sam.
author: Susie S.

description: Delicious Mexican hot chocolate and baklava.  It is a cafe combined grocery where you can also buy liquor.
author: Andrea V.

description:
Came here for the late night space to work, stayed for the people. I walked in, expecting to get a drink, glue myself to my laptop, and leave with an average experience. 

Instead, I was welcomed by Sam, the owner, and a delicious cup of "Sam's Special Latte". I have no idea what he put in it or how he made it, but it's the best latte I've ever had. To add to this experience, I savored this latte while deep in conversation with one of the regulars. 

Definitely coming back here again. Every person that walked into this cafe left with a smile. I'm a cafe junky and this is the first cafe I've been to where the atmosphere wasn't just "put your headphones, down your caffeine, and work because that's what you're supposed to do". Rather, the atmosphere is very welcoming, personable, and best of all, a haven from the mindlessness of life.
author: Diana T.

description: Come here for the delicious coffee, eclectic selection of booze, natural light, but most of all for banter-fest w/ owner Sam. What a character!
author: Amy H.

description: I had a cup of the Medium Roast Italian and it was exquisite. The owner is a phenomenal barista and preaches you only pay if you like it. Trust me, you'll like it.
author: Bay A.

description: Best coffee selection in the neighborhood and the deli cabinet is always stocked with the great breakfast foods. I grab the Ethiopia yorgacheffe medium roast and the breakfast burrito. Nails it every time.
author: Martin W.

description:
Alright - not many places even move me to review them but this one does!

It starts and ends with Sam with a lot of goodness in the middle. 

Sam, is a very welcoming, warm and loving owner of the space. He is more than happy to oblige you with whatever it is you are in the mood for. "if you don't like it, it's on the house" He'll say. THAT, i appreciate. An owner who stands behind his business and wants to know that you are more than satisfied. 

I had 2 orders of Halva, not one, because it was THAT good and a cup of Sam's special herbal blend tea. mmm mmm GOOD. 

The Space is just beautiful! clean, light, spacious, and inviting. You just want to be here and it feels great. 

Sit and have a coffee, read a book, people watch. The big windows make it feel like you're outside which is a welcome change from some darker spots in the neighborhood. 

And like I said, it comes back to Sam. He is a man who lives and loves with a full heart. He is a happy person with an infectious energy that you just simply can't ignore. 

You'll leave feeling whole in your experience with Sam and the crew at Golden Bear.
author: Jason H.

description: I ordered a mocha with three shots. The  guy says 'we don't do shots, it's my way not your way'   Hmmmm that doesn't mesh well with me. Maybe word things differently next time. Hey Sam this is a review done my way.
author: Francis R.

description: I just moved to SF a few weeks ago. I am lucky to live less than 2 blocks from Golden Bear Trading Co. This is the best coffee I have had in SF by far. In fact, I am sitting outside of the place right now, enjoying a fantastic cup of Vienna light roast in the sunshine. Yes, sunshine. The breakfast sandwich I just ate was fantastic too. A few reviews said it is pricey, but I think it is pretty reasonable overall. Sam the owner is also an entertaining guy. Wanted me to have my sandwich and coffee,  think about things, write a yelp review and then worry about the money later. Done! :)
author: Ashley F.

description: If you're not SAMs hands, go try the rest, but I know Sam is the best.  Best unexpected experience looking for coffee. Sam is the man.
author: David K.

description: Sam was cool,he kept the shop open a bit longer to serve me one of the best cups of coffee I've had in a while. It was the House blend. Definitely will come back
author: Jose A.

description: Fantastic everything! This place will replace my weekend regular mocha trips to Philz. Sam is great, extremely personable and will let you try things. By far the best mocha in town! Try the chocolate dipped and nut encrusted sesame bars, they are out of this world!
author: Gulshan L.

description: At Sam's suggestion I decided to try rthe Jamaican Blue coffee ($10 for a medium). Despite the steep price it was worth the adventure. Doubt I'd pick this baby up every day of the week, but for an occasional treat, it's a solid tasty smooth beverage. Pretty great wine and alcohol selection as well for a small corner market tucked into the burbs. Regularly get a bit of a confrontational vibe when I'm here, which isn't personal and is just odd, but if you don't mind that, come on down.
author: Marcos S.

description: Excellent coffee! Clean environment. SAMs a friendly guy  who gives great service. Plenty of room inside and out. Come enjoy. That's what it's really about. :) baklava was perfect with the coffee!
author: Joe Z.

description:
I had a bad experience with an old lady today, presumably the person that runs this place. And, per other reviews, I am not the only one. 

This is not a direct review of the food or items, but a review of the person associated with this market. So here goes:

I went to Sunset for: 1. A long-postponed haircut at Friendly Cuts, and 2. Some delicious pastry from Arizemendi's. As many would know, parking is really difficult in this neighborhood. I found a spacious parking spot in front of this place. "I am so lucky!" WRONG!!!

I proceed to back up and park. I just about finish when I notice an old woman with a thick accent come out of her store and say "let me see if you hit my car." WHAT?!!? akhftesdhfue!!! You have to be kidding me. I did not. I nicely smiled and told her that I didn't, because I really hadn't. She would know because her Market has windows spanning the entire place. She sat, literally, less than 15-20 feet away from her car (aka ~3.5 lengths of me, as I am not very tall). If I had hit her car, she should have seen a minor jolt, OR, heard a small sound, OR, BOTH, OR have seen my guilt-ridden sorry face. If she couldn't see a possible tap from that close, then she has got bigger problems. This woman proceeded to keep me there as she examined the previous/old inflicted scratches on her front bumper. Seriously, crazy.

....After my errands, I walked to my car to drive away. I had not even gotten into my car before the old woman (who was again sitting by the window) stood up and purposefully watched me leave. As I left, I looked into my rear-view mirror and saw that another car had snatched a "nice" parking spot. I also noted that the old woman was keenly observing the other driver, perhaps ready to pounce on another victim. 

Seriously rude and accusative. I don't understand why anyone would come into this place when she is around. Doesn't she have better things to do, such as...run her shop?
author: Lily Z.

description: Ordered the cold brew mocha today, and Sam worked his magic once again. There's an extensive list of beans here, but leave it up to him and you won't be disappointed. If anyone knows coffee, it's Sam.
author: Nicole E.

description: Best coffee un San Francisco. We took a bus to get here. Great Service. Sam is the man.
author: Alan V.

description:
Though we haven't formally exchanged names, the owner (who I assume is this magical "Sam") always welcomes me with a warm smile and ample suggestions.

The reviews don't lie: you'll leave here with a smile on your face, an incredible cup of coffee and a little boost of faith in humanity. 

As a newbie to the 'hood, Golden Bear was the obvious choice as it's just a block from my place. Lucky me. I even went so far as to try the competition and will say, without a doubt, that this will be my go-to spot for coffee and a great bottle of wine (not mutually exclusive). Try the Turkish Roast or the House Blend. Both are incredible - light floral notes but strong, solid coffee.

Thanks for making my mornings a little brighter (and caffeine-filled) - Golden Bear, you've got my vote.
author: Liz W.

description: Wonderful quiet atmosphere with lots of natural light. The shop has a clean modern aesthetic. The perfectly selected coffee was smooth and delicious, and the breakfast wraps/burritos filled our bellies.  We loved seeing the place being run with confidence & agility by the owner all on his own. We can't wait to try the baclava we bought to take home!
author: Meaghan N.

description: I love this place, great decor and an even better host. Sam is extremely friendly and makes sure all his customers are happy and enjoying the food. The coffee is to die for and my turkey sandwich was just as good!
author: Merkeb Y.

description: This place has some amazing coffee. You have to try it. The place was remodeled recently and looks beautiful. It's a great place to work or study. If you're driving by to pick up coffee they have a couple of parking spaces outside.
author: Rocky B.

description:
Let me disclose: Golden Bear Market has character amplified by the owner.

Golden Bear Market are for those who appreciate character.

Sam has an East Coast charm. He is a straight shooter.
Dry humor, no West Coast flowery tones here.

Kathy just made me a great fruity Ethiopian coffee blend, smooth + fruity tones.

The modern white panel bars add a modern touch.

Great place to work with fast wireless and their coffee surely breaks through the foggy sunset grump.
author: Rayfil W.

description: I got the best cup of coffee on Mother's Day morning! The owner Sam was also a pleasure to meet. If you ever need a really good cup of coffee, this is the place to go. It's also a beautiful coffee shop, decorated with lovely sunflowers and assortment of colorful flowers in front for sale. Pick some up for mom and grab a cup of coffee. You won't regret it! I will definitely come back! :)
author: Rochelle L.

description: Great coffee and service! Sam will hook it up! Good place to go and get coffee and breakfast. Recommend for anyone near UCSF. I'm leaving the area so sucks that I won't be able to stop by daily gonna miss this place! Who's gonna replace the man Sam?
author: William M.

description: Sam is the man!!! The handcrafted coffee is the best in town and the service is unbeatable!
author: Brian B.

description: Very interesting place with a large variety of wines, beers, liquors (including moonshine HA!) and what could easily be the largest true range of coffee and tea in a small shop format in the city. Definitely took the bait on the coffee challenge...either you like and pay for it or don't like it and walk away. No regrets on that one. As many others have said, Sam is a great salesman and a true personality, the kind that makes living in the city so unique and cool.
author: Joe D.

description: This place is not only original and smack dab in the middle of a great part of SF... but the barista Sam is the best! I just went in to charge my phone and I ended up hanging around for over an hour just because he made me amazing tea latte along with cracking jokes left and right. I'm coming back here and bringing all my friends most definitely!
author: Kiva H.

description:
Sam is the best purveyors of coffee. His suggestions are always on point. His selections are incredible and his execution is far above par! If you're looking for the smoothest most savor able coffee then you now know where to go.

If you're lucky, get the Jamaican Blue. If not, Kenyan AA for an amazing bold choice!
 
Looking for some great wine and liquor too? This place is a one-stop for the best of whatever you need in libations:)
author: Nicole M.

description: I come to Golden Bear regularly any chance I get.  I get the Turkish/Red Sea blend and it's pretty amazing.  So amazing I start to crave it after a while of not having it.  The space is nice, clean and a great place to meet friends or do work.  Sam is awesome too - nice friendly, and pours a great cup of drip coffee.
author: Paul R.

description: This man makes the most fantastic tea and coffee, it's really unbelievable how he does it. When I ask him his secret, he always says "it's made with love". Also great selection of beer, wine, chocolate, and anything that a proper corner store should have. You name it. Stays open late, free wi-fi, man the list goes on and on! Simply the best.
author: Edmundo V.

description:
Such a great new addition to the Inner Sunset. Sam makes delicious tea/coffee. My boyfriend and I go there on the regular now. 

Thanks Sam!
author: Toni H.

description: This palace is really awesome,  with great drinks and service. I got latte and baklava.
author: Tumar T.

description: I come all the way from Redwood City for this coffee!! Sam is irreplaceable and my friend and I have spent many late nights and early mornings here. The bagels sandwiches are out of this world, but the coffee is the best cup of coffee you will have in your life. The Turkish Red Sea roast with cream and sugar is the only way to go!!
author: Soula Y.

description: I just moved into the neighborhood and this coffee shop happens to be 3min from my house so it's very convenient. The owner Sam is a very pleasant fellow.  The customer service is great and he makes you feel at home. I'll probably be back several times a week on my way to work since it's such a nice place to stop by and grab a quick coffee or bite to eat. The ice mocha I had was great! Not overly sweet like some of the Starbucks drinks I've had before but just the right combination of mocha/coffee flavor. I highly recommend this place if you live in the area or stop by. I'll probably try some of the other drinks on my next visit.
author: Jeremy G.

description: I have passed by Golden Bear countless times on the way to work at UCSF. I never paid attention, it was just another coffee bar. I recently broke down and walked in. It was much different--an odd assortment of food and beverages, an odd layout. Owner Sam addressed me. He's a character. After talking with him awhile the Yiddish word 'mench' came to mind. But, what sold me were his confections and coffee. I became an instant regular. Whenever I have the opportunity to work at UCSF, I will breakfast by Golden Bear -- or, to me, Sam's.
author: Don S.

description:
Since arriving in Inner Sunset I've taken a tour of the local coffee stops. Out of the five or so places I have tried so far, Golden Bear was by far the best cup. His prices are a bit higher than other places but you most definitely get what you pay for in terms of the quality of the product. I haven't tried his baked goods yet other than a sample of the baklava, which was very good. I find most baklava to be over sweetened but his strikes the right balance.

Sam, the personable owner of this establishment, is also very friendly and clearly passionate about what he does. Every time that I have gone here he has struck up a conversation. I was in a bit of a hurry today and actually felt bad that I wasn't able to finish up talking with him! If you are an extrovert, this is definitely the cafe for you.
author: Tom W.

description:
Friendliest owner ever and the coffee here is phenomenal. This place offers 30+ types of coffee roast choices. If your'e easily overwhelmed by choices like me, I highly recommend just leaving it up to Sam, the owner. He will not disappoint you. He also makes you taste test it for approval before you pay. Customer service doesn't get better than this. 

Also, Wifi works perfectly so it's a great study spot- unless you're easily distracted, because it's also a great place for people watching.
author: Joanna H.

description: My go-to place to buy coffee beans. Sam has a great selection by the pound, and at very good prices.
author: Matthew S.

description: Excellent fresh coffee.  Grind and brew before you. Fresh croissants. Owner is very caring and hospitable.
author: Saurabh S.

description:
A gem of a coffee shop. Sam is friendly and a joy to talk with. The coffee is expertly prepared and is silky smooth. The shop also has excellent pastries and a wide range of beers to boot!

I highly recommend.
author: Chad K.

description: On a spontaneous trip to sf, we happened to just be in the neighborhood  of the golden bear market. The front of the store was inviting with fresh flowers out front, but the inside is a bit more simple, there were a few mis matched tables and an old couch in the middle of the space.   off to the left is pretty much your average liquor store set up, but its behind the counter where all the action happens! when we walked in Sam was already practicing his craft, in front of a very basic set up of three metal funnel looking things and good Turkish coffee.  you don't have a choice of getting a grande skinny Carmel macchiato with an extra shot, extra hot here. nope, not even close. here Sam asks you, " do you want sugar or no sugar?" haha very simple coffee, but is was so good! its was a great cup of joe and i enjoyed watching him making the coffee so simple without fancy gadgets. Sam was fun, nice guy, he saw me taking photos and he told me to continue to take more! haha, cool guy.  He also made us a cup of Mexican hot chocolate. It was good, but it didn't have the extra kick i like in a Mexican hot chocolate.  but i wouldn't knock him for that, its so hard to find a great mexi hot chocolate anywhere!   I also indulged in a scrumptious piece of baklava! oh it was phenomenal! just perfect! you must try one for yourself!
author: Brenda B.

description: The Jamaican blue mountain coffee is to die for. As Sam, the talkative Turkish owner, says: "you're lucky to drink it". Regular coffee is 3.50 and 4.50. The Jamaican is $10 and $15 for medium and large. But I'd do it again. Without thinking twice.
author: Keyur S.

description:
What a disappointment. After reading many positive Yelp reviews, I thought I'd stop in at Golden Bear and get a good cup of coffee and a sandwich to eat while reading my book. I ended up doing none of these things.

Don't get me wrong- I understand the appeal of this place. It's definitely got character (literally, the store owner is quite a character), and its always nice to go somewhere where you feel like you're visiting a friend rather than running an errand or buying a cup of coffee. But lets not forget- it is still a business, and we are not visiting the business just to meet a character or to give away money for some slight small talk. 

My experience at Golden Bear Market is best summarized as this conversation:

Owner: "What can I get you?"

Me: "Hi, do you accept credit cards?"

Owner: "That depends on what you want" (I get it, he likes to joke around)

Me: "Could I get a sandwich and a turkish coffee?"

Owner: "No"

Me: "You don't serve sandwiches?"

Owner: "No, we have calzones"

Me: "But your sign says you serve boars head sandwiches"

Owner: "No more sandwiches, only calzones and coffee. And baklava"

Me: "Are you out of bread or something?"

Owner: "I just don't feel like making a sandwich. You should try the calzone, its home-made by my mother. Believe me, I wouldn't sell it if it wasn't the best"

Me: "Sure, i guess I'll try a calzone and a turkish coffee, with cream and sugar please, and a pistachio baklava"

--A few minutes later, I saw him unwrap a calzone with a label that said "Enzo's" and had an ingredient label--

Me: "If the calzone's are 'fresh', why do they have a label that says Enzo's?"

Owner: "You've just gotta believe, I'm gonna give you something that's good"

Me: "Alright, I guess I'm pretty hungry"

The coffee was ok- it was oily and lacked flavor. Honestly, it was on par with a cup of coffee you'd expect from Dunkin Donuts (I think the police could back me up here- I saw three different police officers stop in for coffee while I was there). 

The food, though, was worse than expected. The pre-packaged calzone wasn't cooked properly- it was soggy, barely warm, and wasn't heated all the way through. The baklava had the dry consistency of cardboard, and about as many pistachios. 

To make matters worse, the cup of coffee, piece of baklava, and calzone cost me almost $12. It was like polite robbery.

I wanted so badly to love this place, and for it to become a regular stop for me, but that will not be case. Oddly, I can excuse the poor quality of the coffee and the food, and I probably would have gone back if that were all that is wrong with Golden Bear.

Ironically, my disappointment with Golden Bear is closely related to the very thing that seems to make people love it- the personal relationship. While I can excuse mediocre food and coffee, I can't excuse laziness and dishonesty in the owner. I don't care if he greets me when I walk in or if he sits down and makes small talk while I eat, there is no excuse for being too lazy to make a sandwich at a place that advertises sandwiches, and there is certainly no excuse for lying to a customer's face.
author: Zameer A.

description:
I arrive from airport tired and hungry. 
I first hear the soothing music of Oud, a middle eastern instrument that to me smells like childhood. I follow it's sound to a corner grocery store where Maher and Sam (the owner) are playing and singing the night away. Sam greets with a smile, a delicious cup of coffee - and I'm Lebanese, I know what good coffee tastes like. "It's made with love," he said as he hands it to me. A grilled chicken sandwich follows and I devour it listening to the performance resuming. Moving to San Francisco and finding a suitable apartment isn't easy, and I have been stressed out about it for weeks. 
But in that instant - "enjoy the moment," Sam said - in that small coffee shop, I felt home.
author: Georges N.

description: This is a great coffee place and Sam knows exactly what amount of sugar or cream you mean when you tell him... It all runs on inspiration, that's how he lives, this good man...
author: Luis P.

description:
Was wandering through the neighborhood looking for a place to warm up with a cup of tea, came across this gem.  Ben poured some of the best tea that I've had in a very long time, and the pistachio Baklava he recommended was exceptional.  

I don't write Yelp reviews very often but this place delighted me on an otherwise vanilla Friday afternoon during my workday.
author: L S.

description:
I'm subletting up the street this month and had a chance to swing in here for a bite to eat and grab some small groceries. The store was empty since it was the middle of the workday, but that gave me the pleasure of meeting and chatting with Sam.

Sam is incredibly friendly and was persuasively telling me about their great coffee. I'm not a coffee fan and told him so he recommended a hot chocolate. Amazingly, this guy went as far as to make the drink, have me take a sip, and let him know if I liked it enough to buy. Same with the breakfast sandwich I ordered - everything bagel, bacon egg & cheese.

I'll say this - it's the best hot chocolate I've ever had. I had no problem adding that to the list of things I needed to walk out with. And the breakfast sandwich was great, too.

I'm definitely going to stop in and get a hot chocolate while I'm still in the neighborhood, and if I end up moving to this area permanently Sam's store will be a permanent fixture for some of my weekly treats. 

Thanks for the awesome service today, Sam! You made a customer for life.
author: James O.

description: Golden Bear Trading is by far my favorite coffee shop in SF. Sam is always funny and gracious to his customers. You must try the Tanzania Peaberry.
author: Jc N.

description: Nice place.. Good food, great coffee, large beverage selection, clean bathrooms, and friendly owner..5 stars!
author: Shannon S.

description:
1401 6th Ave
San Francisco, CA  94122
United States

The best coffee on Judah

Personalized coffee and many choices
author: Larry O.

description:
Wtf seriously? 

No. No. 

Jerk working there was on his phone the entire time, blabbing away about nothing. 

I order a piece of baklava, hoping to pick his brain for a suggestion on a Turkish dish to bring to a potluck. The place has a big ol sign advertising "turkish coffees", so I figured. 

He refers me to yumma's and just gives me an eyeroll. 

Thanks for nothing. What a jerk!!!! 

I work right nearby now so you lost a potential loyal customer- years ago as a student this was my go-to place for lunch, but not anymore.
author: Sf Momm Y.

description: I enjoy this place for their coffee, halva (SO GOOD), and selection of candy, beer, and ice cream. Not a fan of the aggressive owner, but I can ignore him for some good coffee and other stuff. If you can deal with having to interract with the pushy owner, go for it! A great, and often over-looked, addition to the neighborhood.
author: Alaska G.

description: This place has it all :) coffee, wine, and ice cream! Not to mention the owner is totally worth the visit!
author: Angel S.

description: This quaint little store is as charming as it gets. The coffee is handcrafted in front of you by pourover. The barista will then adjust the cream and sugar levels until your cup is just perfect. The Turkish pastries and deserts are moist and delicious. They also have a wide selection of wines, beers, and spirits in addition to energy drinks and spirits. The owner Sam might seem a bit intense when you first meet him, however he has a heart of gold and loves his customers dearly. When I told him it was my birthday one day he gave me a free coffee and desert and wished me the best birthday of my life. The atmosphere is very clean and modern with comfortable seating and modern furniture and counters. The bathroom is very classy and new. And the wifi is very fast and reliable. I mean the password is cupoflove for godsakes. You can tell that Sam puts all his heart and soul into delivering the best possible coffee to the Inner Sunset community and his business is a much appreciated asset to the neighborhood. I get my daily morning coffee there and it is always a pleasant experience.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Sam.... I came in here late last Wednesday after a 13 hour shift and you were a great ending to my evening. The coffee was great and kept me up for my long ride home. 
Thanks 
Blue eyes lol
author: Tony S.

description: Came here at 6:45am on Sunday morning. Suppose to be open, but all dark and looked up.
author: Peter V.

description: Delicious coffee and a passionate proprietor.  He really loves his beans and so do I.
author: Sarah A.

description: If you come into this gem, you'll probably be greeted by the exuberant owner, Sam. You've got a extensive wall of both teas and coffee beans that are brewed one cup at a time. Not feeling the caffeine options? How about a neatly shelved wall of white/red wines that will have you feeling like you're at a BevMo? Cause if you shimmy to your right, you'll find your whiskeys, vodkas, tequilas and even some moonshine! The bright lighting and cold beers makes this spot appropriate for grabbing your brewskis or some coffee (Irish...if you're lucky) Cheers!
author: Linja L.

description:
4 stars for their turkish coffee. 
This market is around the corner on 6th and judah, with walls painted in green from the outside and says "the best turkish coffee in town" (or something similar to that). I've lived near UCSF for almost 3 years now and always see it when I walk pass it but never went in...since I'm moving away soon, I decided to give this place a try. I really like Philz coffee so wanted to see how their coffee compare to Philz. 

I actually really like their turkish coffee. The guy makes the drip coffee right after you order and asks if you want everything (cream/sugar). I had both cream and sugar and it tasted good, right balance of cream and sugar and not too sweet. The price is $3 dollars a cup, I would say it is pretty reasonable for what it is. I'd come back for more. It's a little bit less greasy and less sweet than Philz, I think I like both about equally. 

Before coming in, I was reading reviews about the store and some people did complain about the service. From what I've read and what I experienced is that the type of service you get really depends on the guy's mood. He was not super friendly or didn't seem to care about me as a customer when I walked in the store (I said "Hi" and got no response). He was basically on the phone the whole time and barely paid much attention to me besides making my coffee and selling it to me. I didn't really care because I wasn't there for the service but more for the coffee. If I had to take the service into account for this review I'd give it a 3 stars.
author: Whitney W.

description:
Golden Bear Market literally made me the worst sandwich I've ever been served -- the bread was disgustingly moldy and the avocado was brown and spoiled. 

I wish I could give them 0 stars.
author: Robby K.

description: Sam is kind, funny and makes sure you get your coffee exactly as you like it. He's patient with people that are not the most friendly of customers and gets to know locals. I've been all over the country and its one of the best cups of coffee you can get at a reasonable price. They also sell beautiful flowers and have space for working and awesome sandwiches! Thanks Sam!
author: Lauren L.

description:
Sam is a friendly guy who likes to joke around and make more small talk than the average barista or liquor store owner. I've once hung out here with a friend and had a good time talking to Sam for an extended period of time. I would totally recommend supporting Golden Bear Market, especially in a time when it seems like small, local businesses are dying out. 

The turkish coffee is made single-cup drip using "Cup of Love" beans. You will always be assured that you're getting "the best cup of coffee in the world". Sometimes, when I'm feeling particularly drowsy or cloudy, I'm inclined to believe it. I usually take my coffee black, but the added cream and sugar really add a nice dimension to the coffee. It gives it this really pleasant nutty flavor and I would highly recommend it (if you can stifle your gasp at how much brown sugar he actually scoops in). 

Try to bring cash if possible. Credit cards are apparently aversive and distasteful. You might experience a "Are you serious? You got nothing else?", but push through and use your card if you have to.
author: Dan K.

description: I got the baklava and it was by far the worst baklava I have ever had. It only had honey on the bottom layer and they used peanuts which is definitely not an ingredient used in traditional baklava. It was $8 for only 3 small pieces which is also overpriced especially for such bad baklava. Will never come here again.
author: Maddy P.

description: The coffee is good. There's no denying it. The owner, however, is awful. I walked in while he was chatting with someone. He continued to chat with them, even though he saw me waiting to order. After several minutes, he took my order. He kept boasting about how wonderful his coffee was and that I should give him a great review on yelp. After making my coffee, a man came into the shop. I was trying to pay and leave, but the owner IMMEDIATELY tried to serve the new customer. I was pretty annoyed. I told the owner that I'd like to pay, and he made a big show to the other customer, saying he'll just be a moment. I'm not coming back.
author: Seghel Y.

description:
Great place; awesome food and drinks; get treated like family. 

Come for breakfast. Be prepared for awesome, bespoke coffee and fresh-made breakfast sandwiches. And, like coming home, be prepared for some good-natured jesting from the friendly staff. :)

Also a great place to pick up a snack or a bottle of wine. You should totally stop by.
author: Jon B.

description: Golden Bear hits the top of my list as a quaint coffee shop with an excellent array of coffee - and delicious pastries! Love that they have a well-stocked beverage section of beer and wine and spirits. Definitely worth a visit to support a local small business.
author: Nicolle M.

description: First of all, I'm not a big coffee drinker, but I've just moved into the neighborhood and that might be changing soon. Sam offered me a free cup of Turkish Coffee and holy cow was it good. Way better than any other coffee I've ever had. And the Baklava is second to none!
author: J S.

description: Great coffee served by Sam. I had the Turkish coffee and was right on the mark. Also get the halwa.
author: Zeeshan P.

description: Sam wakes me up without coffee. A good man and incredible dark chocolate and almond halavah!!
author: Chris C.

description: I've never written a yelp review, but Sam convinced me to! Sam made me a deal that he'd give me the best hot chocolate and baklava in the world and he wasn't lying! So good it brought a tear to my eye. Sam brings a great vibe and attitude to his shop. I'll definitely be back.
author: David J.

description: First time here and the owner Sam took care of me and my gf! We asked what he recommended and he suggested their special for the season, which is Jamaican blue mountain. He asked how we like our coffee and I said I usually like it black. He suggested with a little cream and sugar. First sip was HEAVEN just like he said it was gonna be! He asked if we wanted their special Baklava and we said no since we were still full from lunch. He gave us a little for free cuz he said he loves seeing people smile. :)
author: Jiaming X.

description: The coffee is strong and flavorful, and the desserts are amazing. Go for the cold brew.
author: Judy K.

description: Sam is the man. It's not too often you enter a business that genuinely cares about the customer's satisfaction. Not happy with your coffee? (Unlikely) but you don't pay until you're happy. The best way to start your day. I made a yelp account just so I can tell the world how great this place is. #1 in SF.
author: Bryson G.

description:
I was in the neighborhood while visiting a friend for Outside Lands and made a stop in this Market for some breakfast before the Festival! 

I asked for a cup of coffee and didn't expect to get THE BEST cup of turkish coffee i have ever had!!! It gave me the perfect kick to my step and tasted amazing!!!

I highly recommend this place! : )
author: charisse K.

description: An open, airy space with a great variety of excellent, fresh coffee and good food. Sam made me feel at home! I will most definitely visit again if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Scott M.

description: Great food and awesome, honest business owner. They take pride in this business and let the food speak for itself.
author: Grant S.

description: Hey! Sam was great. Good coffee. My girlfriend loved to come here when she visited. And she knew her coffee
author: Peter I.

description: This place is terrible. For some reason it takes about 20 minutes for a cup of coffee here. I get it, you want it to be good. That's great. The owner is constantly making excuses for why nobody else is there to help him while he fumbles around trying to make coffee. Pour over coffee. It's dumping hot water on fucking coffee. That's all. That's all it is. What the fuck?!
author: Wizardbunz Z.

description:
The new store is beautiful, nice lighting and everything looks like its glowing! Sam of course is such a kind man and I couldn't be happier to have such a great establishment in my neighborhood! 

My hot chocolate was so tasty! He used special chocolate (no nestle processed stuff) and even gave me the option on making Mexican hot chocolate! 

Going to come back soon for a breakfast sandwich!
author: Alyssa A.

description: Golden Bear Trading Company is the best way to start your day in San Francisco! Sam, the owner, makes such an exquisite cup of coffee that me and my fiancé couldn't help but get a second round to go. It's refreshing to find someone who takes so much pride in their establishment and who goes the extra mile to make sure their customer is happy. Sam has curated a fine shop filled with the finest coffee, quality food and impressive wine and liquor selection! Go check out Golden Bear Trading Company and kick start your day!
author: Shelby R.

description:
My wife and I recently went on vacation for a week to Inner Sunset San Francisco. The first day there we stopped by the Golden Bear Market. We walked in and met the kindest most warm and affectionate man named Sam. 

I asked if there was anything he recommended and he said yes. He the told us to sit down and make ourselves comfortable and he would bring us our lunch. We then went to the curb side table and soon after Sam showed up with some of the best coffee and Quiche I have ever had......it was truly spectacular! 

Sam was one of the nicest people I have ever had the opportunity to meet and can honestly say that every time I am in town I will be going by the market to have some amazing food and say hello to an incredible man who really cares for the people he serves. 

We are truly grateful to have walked into the Golden Bear market!

Thanks Sam, 

Rich and Miranda
author: Rich V.

description: Ah, what can we say?  What a fabulous discovery!l The Golden Bear is located on a quiet corner in the Sunset.  Great views, and a lovely sunny spot combined with hospitality that makes you feel as though today is going to be a GREAT day! Sam  handcrafts his coffees, teas and along with breakfast, lunch and abundant assortment of desserts. Yes, we will be coming back every day we are here to start the day right!! Make this a must visit spot when you are in the City!!
author: Anna P.

description:
What a great coffee shop to stumble upon. Stopped here in the middle of a cross country road trip. As a coffee shop owner myself, I have extremely high standards when it comes to coffee. 
Sam, the owner, assured me he had the BEST drip coffee. He was without a doubt right! The special drip blend is AMAZING. Packed full of flavor and smooth going down. By far, the best coffee and service in my 3,500 miles of travel so far! Best wishes for you and your business, Sam.
author: Lori S.

description:
I came in because there was a sign that said "Best Turkish Coffee" and I wanted to see if the drink was as bold as the statement. I don't take that shiz lightly. 

I came in while Sam, the owner, was on the couch watching news on his iPad. He casually welcomed me, engrossed in the story of the day. He jumped up and introduced himself when I told him I was there to taste his Turkish stuff. 

The more we talked, the more I liked him. The coffee was definitely made with love, and the baklava was nutty and crazy-delicious. Spent some more time chatting and I was on my way with a tasty sandwich too. 

Sam does it all and he does it well.
author: Max S.

description:
I don't live in the neighborhood, nor am I a "regular". But while visiting the museum, the park, or going to hang out with some friends, each time we've stopped by Golden Bear Market, Sam, the owner has treated us as if we'd been fixtures in the place for years. He remembered our names, how we liked our coffee, and was so very welcoming and engaging.

AND...the coffee, and the baklava...was delicious! Highly recommended!!!
author: Steven W.

description: Came in here today to order a couple of sandwiches. Guy behind the counter was not friendly. Everything I asked for he said they were out of--only had one type of bread, two types of cheese and one type of meat. Still waiting for sandwich. Will update if the sandwich somehow knocks my socks off.
author: Jeffrey B.

description: My poor rating is due to unethical treatment I got from this business. I wanted to get a latte but I did not see latte on the board. So I asked the lady if she makes latte. She said "yes" and I asked her to make me small latte. She actually just made regular coffee and added cream. Then she charged me $4. The regular size coffee is listed as $3. So she just charged me extra $1 for bit of cream?? Plus if they do not make something why don't they just say so?
author: Mia I.

description: Awesome place! Sam, the owner, brings an amazing energy to his cafe. He makes a concerted effort to get to know everyone who walks through the door. Also, his joint makes some great coffee! Not only does this place have coffee, he's got a pretty good collection of spirits, if you happen to be making some cocktails.
author: Kim N.

description: Awesome quality one cup at a time Turkish coffee. Great baklava - and a great variety. And, the dude who runs the place (of Haifa) is full of vim and vigor.
author: Andrew K.

description: Sam engages you immediately. Overpromises but then DOES serve up some of the best coffee you'll ever have. Italian roast was perfect. Single cup from just-ground beans made in front of you. So if you're  lucky enough to find street parking around UCSF and have time for a quick cup at Golden Bear, the rest of your day will go great.
author: Jordan N.

description: I absolutely love it here. Sam makes you feel at home as soon as you walk in. If you have a lot of work to do, this is the place. If you need some coffee, this is the place. If you need a nice bottle of win or bourbon, this also the place. It's always extremely clean the ambiance is unbeatable. I see myself becoming a regular here when I move to the neighborhood.
author: Jody F.

description:
When I walked into Golden Bear this Monday morning, I saw the owner standing in the middle of the spotless shop peering out on the bustling, foggy city. As I entered he gently asked how I was today. We exchanged pleasantries as I walked up to the counter, and he behind it. I saw the many cambros of whole beans behind him as we worked together to decide which coffee would align with my tastes. We settled on the Jamaican Blue Mountain, the most expensive of the available varietals at $7 for a medium size. The owner introduced himself as Sam, as he guaranteed me that if the coffee did not meet or exceed my expectations, I would not even have to open my wallet. How could I refuse this honest offer? 

And so, as Sam went to work, I made my way around the perimeter of the shop, eyeing the impressive and varied selection of wine and high-quality liquors resting on the shelves. Some time later, Sam summoned me back to the counter, again promising me a beautiful experience, having prepared this cup to my specification. He handed me the cup over the protective glass, and as I took the sip he studied my reaction. The coffee rolled around smoothly in the mouth, and as I swallowed I felt as though I indeed experienced something special. Sam asked me to take my time imbibing, because "when it's gone, it's gone". And so I did, sitting down in the shop and enjoying the cup over the next hour or so, speaking with Sam about life between his responsibilities to his other customers. Sam even enjoyed a sample of the Jamaican with me, relating that he does not usually drink coffee--preferring tea--but finding occasion today to share an experience with me. "It's gonna be a beautiful day," he said between joyful sips. 

Perhaps it was the coffee itself, perhaps if I isolated this cup and was sipping at home or in the park, I would feel the same. But I don't think so. As I see it, Sam is a master director, setting the stage for an amazing drinking experience, but also, more generally, an inspirational touch-down to reality, to the moment. Favorite quote from today was Sam sipping the Jamaican Blue, speaking in the third person: "He's tasting his own love."
author: David A.

description:
Since I last went there, 4 years ago, they remodeled and now have only wine, flowers, a variety of coffees, and a deli case where they make sandwiches (I guess) and breakfast pastries. I decided that I'd give it another try, since I live literally 1/2 block from this place and have been avoiding it for years. Also there was a different guy (Asian older man) behind the counter than the usual guy (Middle Eastern? Turkish? Don't know, don't care, middle-aged big guy who is totally obnoxious) or the usual lady (crazy screaming older woman who wears scarf). This new guy had a welcoming smile and looked friendly and sane. This is a great sign! Maybe I can make his place my new local on-the-go breakfast place instead of walking two blocks to posh bagel for my breakfast croissandwich, I'm thinking. So I walked up to the counter, looked at the menu board behind the counter, and after the nice guy behind the counter asked me what I would like, I ordered an egg croissant breakfast sandwich and a coffee.

Just then, who pops out from a back room, chewing on something and wiping his hands? The obnoxious guy that runs the place (described in the paragraph above). And he yells out, "We're out of croissant. We'll make it for you on a bagel!" I don't want it on a bagel, so I say, nicely, "That's ok. Thanks." And leave. He yells after me, "What's wrong with bagel?!" I didn't feel like debating the merits of croissant vs bagel and having him force a bagel eggwich on me, so I just kept walking.

Here's an idea - you have an eraseable menu board... When you're out of something ERASE IT! I  had really high hopes that this place had changed, not only due to the remodel and change of items for sale, but because of the different staff (new normal guy) I was thinking maybe the owner finally caught a clue that their previous style of dealing with customers wasn't working, and was actually driving customers away. The obnoxious guy should let the nice, sane, normal guy deal with customers. Stay in the back room and continue to eat or whatever. I don't know who actually ENJOYS dealing with obnoxious, pushy, rude, cheap counter people, but I can assure that that doesn't fly in San Francisco. We prefer laid back, non-confrontational customer service. Have a good product, sell it for a reasonable price, and let sane people deal with the customers.

I'd give it the lowest amount of stars, but I never got to taste the food, so here's an extra star just in case the food is so phenomenal, it makes up for all the crazy.

So I guess I'll keep giving my $10 a day to posh bagel. They are never out of croissants, they never yell weird stuff at me, they are nice, quiet, polite, and non-confrontational.
author: Zelda K.

description: Ok the owner is crazy and I only go here in an absolute pinch. I would highly recommend going to any other stop in the area besides this one. The owners favorite line is "I have the best coffee in town, I'll give you your next coffee free and 10% off". The coffee is ok but I have yet to have a "free coffee or 10% off". GO TO MARTHA & BROS. for your coffee/food and Roxie's for your spirits.
author: Lisa E.

description:
Sam is the man. The service at this place is top notch, I go in for a coffee after work and I feel like I learn something new about life each time. 

And their coffee is spectacular. Pour-over with just the right cream and sugar for each cup. They should be charging at least twice as much, it would be well worth it. 

The selection for home brew is solid, too. Reminds me a lot of Philz with all the different roasts. Highly recommend for people in the area, and anyone who works at ucsf.
author: Quinn A.

description: Every time I go in here the lady at the counter yells at me.
author: Bonnie C.

description: This place has had multiple facelifts but still retains that attentive service which sets it apart. I like how Sam greats you right as you walk in and recommends sweat treats/awesome coffee. This place's coffee is always exceptional and will stand up to any of the best coffee places in san francisco. I especially like the ethiopian coffee!!! (Kudos on the selection). Sam is awesome but sometimes his personality could be off putting as he is always pushing products on you (don't get me wrong, everything I tried has been great). Definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a great coffee served by an interesting character.
author: Nebiyou S.

description: Amazing cup of coffee, filled with love!  The layers of baklava are heavenly!  Bring your friends, your family, and the stranger on the bus.  Let's outdo Starbucks, Peetz, and Phils, independent coffee is the future!
author: Max S.

description:
Looking for the best coffee in SF? Look no more, Golden Bear Trading Co. offers 36 different coffee beans. Sam service was welcoming and kind hearted- top notch customer service! 

Breakfast burritos, scrambled egg sandwich,   and muffins galore. My favorite is the pistachio baclava! Thanks Golden Bear Trading Co. for a perfect Saturday afternoon! 
I'll be back:)
author: Ashley A.

description:
Just the most amazingly strong sweet aromatic drip coffee (definitely go maxi on the cardamom) from a real local.
Sam is a great guy; interested in his community and the general goings-on and worth supporting.
He is definitely my neighbourhood go-to.
Yum!
author: Amy W.

description: Best ice coffee (always with no ice and perfect on sunny day).  The Organic Peru is delicious.  Sam is always friendly and knows his stuff.  It's worth the trek down the hill (looking at you UCSF people in line at Starbucks).
author: Ian D.

description: Great service! Plus 10% off for UCSF students and employees :)
author: Stacy W.

description:
Sam's the Man. I popped in this morning 6/9/2013 after taking my newborn son, and beautiful wife to St. Anna's Catholic Church. I pick up some Turkish coffee, and then proceed to brag about my handsome son. After some friendly back and forth Sam hands me the best damn Turkish coffee this side of Istanbul!!! I'm a quarter Turkish so I've had more than a fair taste of the competition, and I must say Sam knows his way around a coffeemaker. Turkish coffee is like basmati rice in the sense that it's seemingly easy to make, but even easier to make wrong. Thanks again Sam you'll see be seeing me. 
PS My wife loved her coffee too.
author: George S.

description:
Beautiful, clean space - great to work in. The music is really loud so be forewarned if that disrupts your concentration. 

The owner is fantastic and uber helpful. One of his staff members, an old Asian man... not so much. I purchased a diet coke and asked for some ice in my own tumbler. He was bluntly and curtly refused, saying I would have to buy iced coffee first. This would have been okay if he'd at least been polite about it, but he was pretty rude.
author: Aiko S.

description:
If you want an amazing cup of freshly brewed, customized coffee served with lots of love in this amazing foggy neighborhood... this is just the right place. 

Sam (owner) is an excellent host who  makes sure everyone is happy and content with their orders. Also the Baclava he has is worth a try..
author: Pratik S.

description:
Met Sam this morning.... around 8am.
Sam is a cool cat.
Seemed to be just a smidgen grouchy this morning....
but...
It's only my SUBJECTIVE opinion, and WHO ISN'T grouchy in the morning???
I sure the fug am... 
I was the only one there...
I told Sam about how I heard a lot about his coffee... 
He asked...
"Where did  you hear about it?"
I replied... "On Yelp."
Sam grinds his beans per cup and pours over freshly ground beans into your cup of Turkish.  
Now... Here's where I am torn....  I am a Philz FREAK.  I love Philz' Turkish.  
The cup I had this morning...  A little sweet for me.  
STILL.
A DAMN GOOD CUP OF COFFEE.
I would most definitely go back here.  I always support the 'little guy'.
The independent local businesses which help give this city so much FLAVA.
Flavor this store has.
Cheers~!
author: Barry A.

description:
Single cup coffee, beans, sandwiches, desserts, beer, alcohol. Sam's got it all. He's makes a good cup of coffee and will let you know about it too. Lots of varieties and I've probably tried all of the dark roasts. 

Super close to UCSF and 10% off with ID too!
author: Bryan M.

description: Great coffee that is ground and brewed on the spot! Sam's always good for a conversation while he makes you your coffee. And there are alcohol items for sale as well. This is a great local coffee place!
author: sanjeev r.

description:
Whats with the negative reviews?? This place is a gem! I've been hesitant to write a review because I don't want this place to get overcrowded. 

Great coffee, free WiFi, lots of morning sunshine, and the baklava is incredible. I'm a fan of the 4 Barrels, Flywheels, Philz, Ritual, but for an everyday place to grab a coffee and get work done this is my spot. Another nice thing about this location is if I need to take a call its easy to step outside and its usually pretty quiet on the street. 

Come in here with your expectations and attitude in check and you'll probably enjoy the experience.

And Sam is the man!!
author: Ryan A.

description: I came here early in the morning to pick up some coffee and tea for my boyfriend.  I live kind of far away and I must say it was well worth the trip! Sam was cleaning in the morning and greeted me warmly. I asked him for a suggestion for someone who likes French roast black coffee and he gave me Kenya double A. Perfect match! He even double filtered it. I got the chamomile tea with sugar and cream and it was delicious! It's such a joy seeing such  a friendly face in the morning. Sam really knows how to run business!
author: Nancy W.

description: Have been a patron of this place for many years, sporadically. Had a wonderful experience today with a delicious cup of coffee (not a latte, not a mocha, nothing fancy); just a tasty, well made cup of coffee with cream and sugar. Yes, the folks here have personality - we are in San Francisco, it comes with the territory, and it's marvelous! Seems like a lot of folks have experienced the quirks of the personalities here and we enjoy it! Thank you for having a unique store, with personalities. Yes it's expensive (we are in San Francisco), but I found it worth the extra buck it will cost to have a fresh cup of coffee made to order. I look forward to coming back on my way to work.
author: Cristina M.
