description: I came in today with my sister and was kindly greeted by the owner. He suggested I try the Turkish black tea and it was the best tea I've had. Not that tea bag stuff you get in boxes. He creates a great atmosphere and I really enjoyed the baklava he had my sister and I try. I definitely recommend this shop!
author: Allison R.

description: Got hot chocolate and coffee and they were pretty good. We tried the baklava which is super over priced and it wasnt even that good or fresh. We also got there around 7:15 & within 10 mins we were given 3 warnings that the place was closing at 7:30. He rushed us out of there and the other customer that was in there in a rude manner. Besides that seems like a normal coffee shop.
author: Ece T.

description: AMAZING COFFEE!  Ground and fresh brewed when you order. Really nice selection of coffees. Starbucks and Pete's both suck compared to this place. And it's local/independent.... WIN! Seriously check it out :)
author: Shannon L.

description:
Loved the Mediterranean music when I walked in the first time, and then I was greeted by Sam, the most enthusiastic, energetic man I've ever met at 8am. 

Oh -- and the coffee is amazing. Get the Turkish coffee, "Sam's way". Never had anything like it.
author: Robi M.

description: Amazing coffee that allows you to harmonize your day.   Sam is a skilled coffee guru and always welcomes you with a big smile and open heart.  His coffee is his pride, his life, and his goodness transcends beyond just the coffee beans.
author: Anand R.

description: I have been in town for about a week and lucky enough I found this gem right off the bat. Sam is great business owner with great coffee, the best hands down.
author: Scott B.

description: Tried their drip coffee (italian medium roast) and I usually don't care for coffee much but this cup of joe was very good. I can't wait to come back. Their baklava was really delightful as well.
author: T N.

description: We must  have come on an off day, Sunday. We ordered 2 Turkish coffees and a hot chocolate.  We paid Philz coffee prices for some of the worst coffees of our lives. Even the hot chocolate was bad. It was made with pure hot water with a touch of cream. The lady behind the counter was extremely kind and sweet but the drinks were awful. We've had many Turkish coffees and this was pure hot water with a splash of coffee. Won't be going back anytime soon.
author: A R.

description:
Today I had the pleasure of eating with a new friend, Sam (owner of Golden Bear Market). 

I had just finished my appointments at UCSF and was STAR-VING! At first I went to an Indian restaurant but as soon as I opened the door, something told me to turn around. I have to say, it was probably good food at this restaurant because it was crowded but I just felt overwhelmed by all the people and energy. Then I went across the street to Golden Bear Market. I walked in, looked around, sighed and felt much more comfortable, and welcomed. One of the first things I saw were some baklava. I held myself back and said....wait...protein before sweets. 

I asked the man at the counter what his best sandwich was. He said, "I'll make you a chicken sandwich. If you don't like it, don't pay for it." I thought....wow, that confident about what you make....I've gotta try it, nothing to lose! I said, "OK, let's go for it." Then he added, "you sit down and eat with me." Heck, sure why not! Best decision I made today. We talked and enjoyed the food.

The chicken sandwich was delicious. Tender chicken breast, fresh lettuce and the fixins' with some kickin' sauce. BUT I feel the secret ingredient in everything Sam creates is LOVE. (I agree with Ida M.) 

After the sandwich I had to treat myself. I asked for this "best coffee ever" of his and baklava. The coffee was definitely awesome. Usually I'd drown my coffee with cream and sugar, but this one didn't need all of that. You'd just ruin the flavor of the coffee. He crafted the coffee with the right amount of cream and sugar. First sip and I'm a believer. It was truly one of the best coffee I've ever had (and I'm a Peet's coffee-whore!) Then I took a bite of the baklava and it was an explosion of sweet goodness in my mouth. Baklava and coffee = best combo ever!

You MUST, MUST visit Golden Bear Market at least once if you're in SF. You not only get great food, coffee, and treats made with love but you also get amazing service with love.
author: Audrey M.

description: The wonderfully nice and sweet lady running the shop made my "tea with love". You don't get that level of home usually unless you are - well - home. What a (by chance) find passing the the neighborhood. Please visit this cute lil shop and get high quality babushka (sp) treatment :)
author: Sean S.

description: Great coffee! Perfect for a cold night after a spenlid view at twin peaks. Pity we couldn't try more items since it was around closing time, but we will definitely come again!
author: Yuan Ming L.

description: A great neighborhood corner shop, with a solid selection of gourmet coffee and wine. The proprietor, Sam, is a character and will always brighten up your day.
author: Ted R.

description: Not the best coffee nor the best food. He kepts boasting how great his stuff is. Prices change according to his feeling each time. The place was clean, but his obvious insistence & greed takes the atmosphere away.
author: Lou F.

description: Delicious coffee and great service! Sam is always so friendly :)
author: Sarah U.

description:
I'll never leave the Inner Sunset because of Sam, Sam's cup of love (coffee), and Sam's bhaklava. There would be a lot less love in this world if he wasn't around.

I live around the corner and I love stopping by to see Sam. I just finished a cup of coffee and a piece of delicious bhaklava and I am happy to say the least :)

Life is better when Sam's a part of it.
author: Sheela S.

description: Sam was awesome! He was even nice enough to make a rare exception by letting me use their private bathroom (very clean by the way). The baclava was excellent and he's the best! Will definitely return!
author: Graham H.

description:
I work nearby so there has been many mornings when I'll stop into Golden Bear to pick up smokes.  Since I stop in super early in the morning, I always have a cup of coffee from home or from some commerical chain in my hand.  Sam would give me that fatherly "tsk tsk" look and say "dump that crap and have a cup of my coffee.  it'll change your life."  (okay maybe he didnt say that word-for-word but something along those lines.)  Yet more mornings go by and I still haven't tried Sam's famous brew...until today...

It was about 3PM and I was hitting the afternoon wall hard.  A cup of something hot and caffinated was in order.  The coffee truck at work had gone for the day and I didn't want to take the trek up to Starbucks so I stopped in at Golden Bear for a cup of joe.  Sam wasn't there but some younger gentleman was and made my coffee.  

Each cup is brewed to order and they'll put in the cream and sugar for you.  The beans are freshly ground and the cream was shaken in its container to make it nice and thick.  If you've ever gone to coffee places like Philz, then you'll know what I'm talking about.  He hands over the cup of coffee and asked me to try it.  Instantly I smiled a big o' smile and said thank you.  It was exactly what I needed.

Sam, I should've listened to you a long time ago...except at $2.99 a cup, I don't know if I can make this a daily habit.
author: Sally T.

description: The service and food are equally amazing!! The owner gave me their special iced coffee, which didnt even need ice!! Great bagels, coffee, and even better service
author: Edsel E.

description: Sam has always been so kind and friendly. He always makes the right tea to brighten up my day. Throw in a baklava and it's a perfect combo. Highly recommended.
author: Jennifer R.

description: Only amazing things to say about this place! I went here right as they were closing while I was on the job and the owner treated me as if I was the first customer of the day. Honestly I think he was closed but served me all the same. The coffee here was amazing! The owner knew exactly what I wanted even when I didn't. Ultimately I ended up buying a bag of the coffee that he made me! Next time I am on this side of town I will be stopping here for my pick me up.
author: Aron H.

description: I love this place!  Sam is a great guy and you can tell he truly cares about his customers.  Every cup of coffee he makes is made with love! In addition to having great coffee, pastries and sandwiches, golden bear has an amazing wine selection.  I go here when I want to find a high quality, boutique wine at a great price.  He has an amazing selection and his prices are very fair and affordable.  Ask him what he suggests and he will be sure to give you something to please your palate.  I don't even live in SF yet I still come here a few times a week.  Stop by, say hi to Sam, and ask him for a cup of coffee and a bottle of wine for your dinner!
author: Michelle B.

description: I love proprietors who are proud of their product, but this guy is too pushy and it is uncomfortable!
author: Amy Nicole W.

description:
if you are looking for high-quality, coffee, tea, and tasty treats (sandwiches, balaclava, pastries etc.) expertly and lovingly prepared by an authentic and charismatic proprietor, then you will love sam and the golden bear.

we were spending time at the ucsf hospital a few short blocks away and it was a welcome respite to make the walk down to chat with sam and pick up some delicious and nutritious, snacks, coffee, and tea.

sam prepares unique coffees and teas in the same league as (if not better than) philz, peet's, blue bottle, ritual, sightglass, four barrel etc. etc. no espresso here, just lovingly-prepared pour-over concoctions.
author: MATTHEW G.

description:
The friendliest  place with the best coffee and pastries around UCSF and the City.

Danny
author: Danny F.

description: The coffee is very good and Sam will take good care of you.  I have had nothing but great service and gotten great stuff here.  The baklava, which comes in both pistachio and walnut, is very good.
author: Chelsey B.

description: Excellent coffee, delicious baklava, and the owner Sam is a cool guy. I will be coming back on my next visit to UCSF.
author: Grisel B.

description: Great drip coffee! I always get the Ethiopian Yirgacheffe but i'll try to be more open minded next time. Customer service is great! Sam is a very welcoming guy.
author: leba g.

description: I've been living in the Inner Sunset for about 4 years and my apartment is approximately two blocks from Golden Bear.  I frequent the place quite a bit and normally go in for odds and ends (beer, ice cream, juices, etc); and always stop to chat with the owner, Sam.  He's very passionate about his business, his coffee, and getting to know his patrons.  Sam makes the neighborhood a better place for everyone who lives here and I highly recommend stopping in if you get a chance.
author: Alex R.

description:
Sam and staff were very accomdating and nice.   I'm visiting the area for work and I Was looking for a coffee shop that I could get some computer admin done while enjoying a great single brewed  cup of coffee and some delights from the pastry counter.   Great location perfect place to people watch and just chill.  

I will be back!!!
author: Phil B.

description:
The Turkish Coffee here is amazing. I can't believe more places don't carry some version of Turkish Coffee as it is head and shoulders better than most of the coffee out there. The guy here makes it regular brew style, but I think he will also do traditional Turkish style. At least, he keeps telling me he'll do it for me, but I always forget to ask or don't feel like waiting. 

My only complaint is they should have soy milk. Wait, I guess my only complaint is I always forget to ask if they have soy milk, as I've never actually done that. 

The falafel are pretty good too and are a bit different than the usual Greek falafel in the area.

If I could give this place 8 Stars I would, but -1 Star for me becoming forgetful when I come here, so 7 Stars out of 5.
author: Adam R.

description: I just moved in next door and I have to echo all the other great reviews of this place. Sam is a great guy and makes a mean cup of coffee. Try his coffee with cardamom, you won't be disappointed. Also, the baklava is DELICIOUS! The atmosphere is bright, open and friendly and Sam is a very welcoming and happy person.
author: Jim M.

description: Quiet setting, clean and bright. Baklava delicious. Barista(?) didn't seem to know difference between coffee and latte, otherwise was ok. Unusual selections in the store, mostly soft drinks, wine & ice cream.
author: Oscar C.

description: Great Coffee, great food!  I had a ham and cheese quiche that was delightful!  My kids had a turkey and cheese sandwich that was delicious!  Sam (owner) made my kids and I feel like we were the best part of his day!
author: Petra C.

description: Amazing place! I had the turkish with cardamom, and cream and sugar. The owner was friendly and knew his stuff. Ill definitely be coming back!
author: Rahul M.

description: This place is amazing! I've been there to get wine before but this morning I stopped in for breakfast and my life was forever changed.  The coffee is handbrewed and FANTASTIC, the breakfast sandwich was made fresh with fresh ground black pepper in the eggs.  Highly recommend, and it's so convenient to stop by on your way to UCSF. Will be making this my Friday morning tradition
author: Deanna B.

description: Great coffee and great people. Truly a neighborhood staple. The owner Sam is the man!
author: Alton P.

description: Sam's Turkish coffee is smoothest most delicious coffee, 110% authentic and I've tried the best coffee traveling through Turkey. Sam is so friendly and excellent customer service. I will most definitely become a regular here!
author: Aline M.

description: Best coffee ever! If your a local or a tourist doesn't matter come stop by and try a excellent cup of love, this coffee will change your life.
author: Paul J.

description: Great coffee, tea, and sandwiches. The Turkish Red Blend with cardamom is amazing! The guy who runs the place is fantastically quirky and provides great customer service. This place is a hidden gem.
author: Roberta B.

description: I have always gone for the amazing coffee and Sam's company. This time we tried the quiche (out if this world), breakfast sandwich (delicious) and the scones. Best scone ever!!!  Easy stop to grab something for breakfast on your way to work.
author: Joanne Y.

description:
it's better than Philz, because it doesn't need cream to taste good

this is the best coffee I've tasted in SF.

also, the halva snacks are great.
author: Marcel B.

description: This place is awesome! Its my favorite place to get coffee in the area. The coffee and pastries are delicious and the service is A+. Sam hooked me up big time and did it with a smile. Definitely recommend this place to anyone, especially for UC students to study bc they get 10% off!
author: Chris F.

description: Great coffee, never bitter. Hand crafted. Lots of variety: Kenya aa, Turkish, Sumatra, Italian. Great owner. Sam gave me a free baklava for my birthday. Quiet place too. Recommended for artisan coffee and birthday treats.
author: V L.

description:
Just moved to the area...I was walking around and discovered this place.
What a nice gentleman and very tasty coffee he makes. :) 
Coffee with love :)
author: Jasmina T.

description: I never enjoyed baklava until I had it there, bought more for the drive back to LA. Sam was a gracious host, the coffees were great, savouries were above average but I wouldn't go there specifically for them again. It's a great store with an amazing selection of beers. It's a little off the main foot traffic in the area, but well worth the extra block it takes to get there.
author: Sean K.

description: A wonderful market with the most perfect and decadent selection of goods. Sam the owner is lovely, passionate, and unforgettable. I'll be here often, something tells me.
author: Julie D.

description: My wife and I love this shop! Sam is an extremely helpful and attentive owner and knows how to make a great cup of coffee! My wife tends to like sweeter coffee and I usually go for just a little cream, but we both can agree that his cold brew with some cream and sugar is absolutely perfect! I am ecstatic to have this shop so close to where I live and plan on stopping by more frequently.
author: Steven B.

description:
Note: This coffee is made "with love."  And boy is there a lotta love in one cup!

 I mean, honestly, I was not even that much of a coffee freak until I started working down the block and realized that this nectar of the Gods was at my fingertips-every morning! 

It's what I like to call a "good" addiction. :)

Plus Sam is possibly the most fabulous Middle Eastern man you will meet! Between the coffee and the nice banter-definitely a wonderful place to call your coffee shop!
author: Stefani K.

description:
As a loyal Philz customer I'm always hesitant to get try other coffee places but I was in the area and in desperate need of a pick-me-up... And let me tell you, I'm sure glad I did. Had no idea which Dark blend to choose so the friendly guy behind the counter (who turned out to be the owner Sam) picked something for me. He assured me that if it wasn't perfect, I wouldn't have to pay for it. Well put it this way, there's a reason he's so confident. The coffee was exceptionally tasty, and importantly for those of us who are in a hurry to get someplace, ready in no time at all.

Will definitely be back. Thanks Sam!
author: James C.

description: The owner is very nice, the chocolate was perfect. Very cool location with free wifi.
author: Danilo C.

description: My friend and I stopped by, since we wanted to try the "Turkish coffee."  I've never tried Turkish coffee or never seen it being made.  I guess it was Sam who served us.  He's jack of all trades.  He sells real estate on the side!  Any way, back to the coffee.  He grind it, let us smell the fragrance.  He let us smell the grounded cardamon.  He boiled the coffee grind with a sprinkle of cardamon, takes 20 minutes.  While waiting, we had the baklava, which was really fresh.  The place is a hosh posh of everything not matching.  It seems like he's moved his living room in front of this supposedly market.  I've been caffeine free for two weeks and he got me off the caffeine wagon.  He offered me a cup, black.  Yes, it was very smooth and enjoyable.   The cardamon was subtle.  Thanks, Sam for the love and the hospitality.
author: Helen L.

description:
I just moved to the Inner Sunset, and was so happy to find a spot that caters to all of my needs. Coffee, Beer, Sandwiches, & Small Talk.

They have the best Turkish coffee ever, great deals on beer, and inexpensive Boar's Head Brand Sandwiches. Sam is awesome, and welcomes me every time I walk or stumble in. Highly recommended if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Nick P.

description: You are in good hands with Sam! From a great cup of handcrafted coffee to homemade pistachio baklava, everything is terrific. This cafe/market (complete with beer, wine and liquor) is clean, bright and comfortable. The friendly and energetic Sam was kind enough to suggest a few items and said. "if you don't like, you don't pay..." Well, I would have paid twice it was that good. Make a trip.
author: Luke J.

description: This is my new favorite coffee spot. Sam, the owner, is friendly, familiar and very attentive. The store is beautiful and welcoming. Definitely visiting again soon.
author: Kathleen S.

description: I noticed this place awhile ago and stopped by on a hunch a few weeks ago. They made best hand crafted drip decaf I have ever had. And they have pistachio baklava to die for!!! If you don't make a visit to this little gem, you are missing out!!
author: Pamela F.

description: Sam and his shoppe is by far the absolute best neighborhood shoppe. First, let's start with Sam. He will instantly make you feel like a regular. He's funny, friendly, and full of great information about the neighborhood. Next, his coffee REALLY is the best coffee you will ever have. Breakfast is great too. He also has a great beer, wine, and spirit collection. We've often stopped by his place to pick up adult beverages, baklava, and watch the sunset. He always has fresh flowers too, making this a great little place to spark a little romance in your life. Hubba hubba.
author: Julie S.

description: Had the Turkish coffee and baklava. Both were fantastic: coffee was smooth and balanced, baklava was flaky, sweet, and not drowning in honey.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Not a fan. I'd rather walk to 9th or 8th. The guy is always chilling and I've had to wait in front of the register on avg of 5 min with noone else in the store to get the guy to ring me up. The coffee is ok, but better coffee shops are in the sunset imo.
author: Cody M.

description:
It's my first time at golden bear. I ask Sam to  advice my coffee then he made it. 
He said "you gonna like it" Amazing Wow!!! I love it. How can he know by just looking at me. Golden bear is my fav now. Try!!!
author: Kornwipa H.

description: Sam is great. Very friendly! Great egg sandwhich and a spectacular mocha. Definitely coming back soon!
author: Erik W.

description:
Sam is Golden Bear. Some folks may not "get" his personality--outwardly a little bit caustic with a biting wit and a touch of cynicism--BUT talk to him for more than a minute and you'll soon feel his warmth and inner Will Rogers. And he makes a killer cup o Turkish coffee which you can enjoy on the couch or outside at the picnic table. 

Golden Bear is the kind of small business that makes SF a land of  true neighborhoods and not just a bleak landscape of corporate outposts. You're not gonna get water pipes at Starbucks.
author: john m.

description: Amazing coffee, amazing bagel sandwiches and Sam is awesome. He is always happy and friendly.
author: M H.

description: While in SF recently I was just looking for a decent coffee. Upon entrance were greeted by the owner who had a great personality, very friendly.  Amazing coffee selection, all single serving drip, and made to order (better than I could even do for my own taste).  Next time I visit this area of SF I will go out of my way to grab a coffee here again, and again, and again!!
author: Adam T.

description:
My son and I were in a rush and it was late. We are not from the area and by chance, we stumbled into Sam's place. Or was it really by chance? We ended  up being served a fantastic cup of coffee and Baklava that was out of this world. 

What happened next was a true blessing. Sam, my son and I ended up having a very real and intimate conversation that nor I or my son will forget. Sam if you read this, I am sure you will remember as well. See, this was the first time I had been with my son in 20 years. Thank you Sam for being a part of our experience.

May the blessings of our Heavenly Father be on you my new friend. I will be back because the sincerity of Sam alone is worth the trip. The coffee is great as well!
author: Greg N.

description:
Sam probably makes the best cup of coffee in the neighborhood. I saw the sign out front that said "Turkish Coffee" and thought I would check it out; now I frequently run down the hill to get a cup between classes at UCSF.

Let's talk about the coffee: The beans are roasted daily and locally to Sam's specifications. He's got a couple different blends, my favorite being the Amazing Arabic. It's stalwart black, but if you prefer he uses real cream. Each cup is individually crafted to how you like it. If you're not sure, just ask Sam how he likes it and he'll make you a great cup. If you like Philz, you'll like Sam's.

And Sam. He's friendly and he remembers my face: that's enough to keep me coming back, even if the coffee wasn't the best in the area. He deserves the business.

If you wan't an espresso drink, this isn't the place to come. What you can get is a great cup of coffee that is made to order from freshly roasted beans.
author: Tristin J.

description:
I just moved into the neighborhood last month, and in my first week, I had the pleasure of meeting Sam. What a great guy! Such a friendly person, and very down to Earth. He really makes me feel at home in the area.

Great coffee and baklava, as well!
author: C D.

description: Golden Bear is awesome!  Sam is a passionate man about his coffee and his "love" is evident in the great coffee he serves.  A refreshing treat in this "corporate coffee" world!
author: Beverly K.

description:
Sam is great. He is such a nice guy. He talks like a Middle Eastern mafia don. "Sam, this tea is amazing...what is it called?" "...you ask too many questions." LOL, But let me tell you, his Turkish Coffee is out of this world! He makes all the blends himself (my favorite one being the Amazing Arabic), and puts in the perfect amount of sugar and this thick cream that he foams with a spoon for the perfect taste.

Every time we're in here, we feel like family. Good service, great coffee, and an unexpectedly diverse beer selection! Golden Bear is ten blocks away from where we live. Though we only moved in 2 weeks ago, we have already gone there 4 times. 

All that aside, it's not just the coffee we frequent Golden Bear for. Sam's become a good friend. Every time we walk in, he greets us so warmly and makes us laugh. If other reviewers think he is rude, it's because there's maybe a slight language barrier that people need to see past. By the way, the baklava in here is out of this world. Try the Pistachio one (I like it better than the mixed nut baklava).
author: Josh L.

description:
As the owner Sam will tell you...the Turkish coffee is "Amazing".

This place is rad!
author: Jonathan B.

description: This place gets an absolute 5*, not only because of the service, but because of the gentlemen that runs this place. His name is Sam, and please pay him a visit, because you will never meet a better guy in your life. Sam acts out of kindness and purity. He is real, just like you. Nobody has better customer service then Sam...ppyip
author: David F.

description: I got yet another great cup of joe from my friends at golden bear! Come try it before it becomes famous! Service and quality simply can't be beat! Try it you won't be sorry!
author: J C.

description: Great coffee! Delicious sandwiches. Great wine and liquor selection. And Sam (owner) makes sure that all his customers are happy with their order.
author: Rebecca J.

description: Delicious coffee and baklavas. The owner is so friendly and welcoming. It's a great neighborhood spot.
author: Gelareh N.

description: Sam is great,  his coffee is amazing!  Loved having this little place just down the road from where we stayed in San Francisco.  His breakfast sandwiches and pastries were also really good.
author: Dal L.

description:
If I got served by Sam then I think I know what everyone is talking about. My girlfriend once got coffee for me here and I remembered loving it. Today I went in for a cup of Java. It was quality (burp). 

As I said, If that was Sam then you must know:
-Down to Earth 
-Great Guy
-Good Service
-A People Person 

Sam must be making Golden Bear Market, Golden Bear Market!
author: Kenneth F.

description: Sam and his staff are incredibly friendly and make excellent coffee. There is a wide selection available, and at reasonable prices too. The 10% discount for UCSF students / employees is the icing on the cake!
author: Yixuan W.

description:
This place is so much better since the Turkish Coffee Guy took over.  The product array has come up a notch, and he just turned me into a coffee drinker.  I had given it up years ago in favor of tea, but then he offered to make me a Cup of Love.

He ground the beans and dripped me a fine cuppa joe with a spoonful of brown sugar and a thick fatty splash of heavy cream.  This is so much better than just coffee with cream & sugar.  It smells better, it tastes better. 

If you are in the neighborhood and avoiding that corner because the lady who used to run the place kinda freaked you out, it's worth a return visit.  

Ask for the Cup of Love.
author: Sal C.

description: Golden Bear Trading Company serves the best coffee I have ever had. Whenever I am in the area, I make it a point to grab a cup here. They also serve pastries to go along with your cup of joe. The owner is very funny and you can tell that he cares about what he does. I recommended anyone who finds themselves in the UCSF area to check this place out. You will not regret it.
author: Jack l.

description: Not all reviews can be trusted. But this is the one you can hang your hat on. The shop is clean and orderly, wines and fine liqueur bottles lining the walls tempting the coffee drinker to make an event of the day. My conversation with the owner (?) Sam was cordial and personal. He inquired as to why I decided to step into his shop. "600+ reviews can't be wrong." "But what if they lie?" He said. "I'm willing to be a follower when it comes to coffee. Politics, no, but coffee I'm willing to take a chance on." Good thing I did. The Mexican Hot Chocolate was smooth and dark, not too sweet, just how I like it. And the drip coffee for the husband did the trick. While the atmosphere isn't all that cozy (you won't find any couches or overstuffed chairs here), it's perfect for catching up on some emails or shooting out a quick memo to the team. Reminded me if cafés I used to frequent in Europe. Enjoy! Just don't ask for an Americano. ;)
author: Susan P.

description: Their Ice Coffee is delicious. Every time I stop by to get a cup, I am enthusiastically greeted by Sam who makes the delicious cup. I would definitely give it a try if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Phillip S.

description: excellent coffee - service is awesome and old school in a modern space - wifi was great - all around awesome place.  The owner is hilarouis so be prepared to laugh!  great beer selection.
author: Jeremy F.

description: Great customer service, amazing tea selection, and delicious pastries! What more can you ask for? Plenty of places to sit.  Highly recommend this place.
author: Lila S.

description: New in San Francisco and found this place right outside UCSF, best coffee in town. They have something good going on here don't avoid this place! Free wifi, inside and outside seating, plus they give discounts to UC employees and students.
author: Mark U.

description: I stopped in here with some friends in search of a restroom and ended up leaving with a cup of iced coffee. When I took my first sip I was surprised at how good it was! Very fragrant, great flavor. It was probably one of the best cups of coffee I've had. Not to mention, the owners were friendly and made sure that the coffee was made to my taste.  And to those on a budget, the price of coffee here definitely does not break the bank!
author: Jude W.

description:
Pride - in the name of Love! For Coffee.

We recently moved to the neighborhood and were delighted to find the Golden Bear Trading Company close to our house. Sam is committed to making the best coffee on the planet. Not only do I love that attitude, but the results are great!

The also have REAL Swedish fish, and great balklava!

This place is a must to pass by when you are in the neighborhood.
author: Bjorn E.

description: Sam is the best and so is his coffee... Just ask him!!! My son and I had a great breakfast here this week. My son told me I should give him 10 stars... 5 for me and 5 for him. Great selection of coffee, pastries and specialty grocery items. We will be back!
author: Ross H.

description: This is one of the very few places I've been in my life where they hand craft your food as well as your coffee!  Sam serves up very tasty food - you must try this place.
author: Brian D.

description:
The owner (Sam) and his wife are the sweetest, and always make you feel welcome! It seems like they brew each cup with love and really enjoy what they do, and they always recommend different things they think you'd enjoy (e.g. I don't drink coffee that often, so Sam suggested one of their Turkish teas). 

This is one of those places where you want to come back again and again, just to support a local business because the owners are that wonderful and you know they care about their customers. It's also a terrific study spot, and if you're seated at the window, you can people/dog-watch during study breaks! 

I also really love their baklava and something chocolate almond halwa - delicious and decadent little treats! And finally, this is my go-to place for Ben & Jerry's ice cream runs because they have way more options than most places (Chocolate Therapy is my current fav).
author: Jas M.

description: Sam, the owner, is very friendly. Each coffee individually made, fresh to order. Great coffee paired with homemade baklava.
author: Darryl E.

description: Dropped by just to see what was up. Left with an AMAZING cup of coffee. Sam, you rule, I'll definitely be back for one of those delicious looking falafel sandwiches.
author: Andy S.

description: Small unassuming spot that has killed it when it comes to well roasted coffee. Had a cup of "Turkish: Red Sea Blend" and it immediately  became my new go to blend. We were offered up some Baklava and it was to die for, we immediately ordered  a half dozen pieces and two pounds of coffee. If you are a coffee enthusiast ( real coffee, none of this flavored trendy crap) this place prepares a perfect well brewed cup of Joe. I highly recommend this spot in the Inner Sunset for a cup of the perfect brewed coffee.
author: V A.

description: There is rarely a coffee respite that I can go to where I can truly relax and enjoy great conversation. I travel all over the country and I finally found such a great place here in San Francisco. Two short blocks from UCSF is the Golden Bear Trading Co. If you think you know tea like I do, let your adventurous spirit come out and let Sam make you your tea HIS way. You will not only love the tea (with a freshly picked sprig of mint that sits on top and adds a wonderful unexpected scent), but go ahead and engage yourself in a conversation with Sam. Sam is a business owner who loves what he does - putting smiles on the faces of all who enter his establishment. Two thumbs up for sure for me and a regular and favorite place to visit, relax, and even buy a bottle of great wine or liquor to take home.
author: Craig C.

description:
This is supposed to be "turkish coffee"????

I had a most bizarre experience here today.  I've never had turkish style coffee before but has become curious as I've expanded my caffeine palate.  The proprietor who served me was very friendly and engaging enough.  But it would be wrong to call him a barista in any meaningful sense of the word.  I'm perplexed at all the great reviews for this place because all the while this guy is raving about how great his skills are, I watched him before my eyes make a haphazard (but admittedly fresh) cup of drip brew that tasted pretty thin even by drip brew standards.  I thought turkish coffee was supposed to be thick and made with beans ground to a fine consistency.  WTF?  And was it supposed to cost me $3?  Definitely not worth the experience or the money in my opinion.
author: Renhao Z.

description: Essential source of coffee, neighborhood news, and good cheer! I sometimes get the tiny Turkish coffee with baklava, and sometimes just grab a 12oz pourover to go. Both are great.
author: Mikhail S.

description: Amazing food, great service and the friendliest owner. He insisted we try a piece of baklava on the house. Amazing.
author: Aaron D.

description:
The Golden Bear Market is so much more than terrific coffee, great sandwiches and a convenience store.  Sam, the owner, makes the visit a San Francisco experience to remember.  He's not bashful about telling you how "amazing" is coffee is and about how he'll serve you the "best sandwich you've every had."  

The falafel sandwich he made for me was truly great and The turkish drip coffee is spectacularly good.  Also, you're dealing with an independent operator and a second generation store owner, not some international firm hiring kids for $10 an hour - that's becoming a rare thing in the city these days.    

Once you get your coffee, grab a seat and stay for the conversation.  You won't be let down.  

Enjoy your "Cup of Love."
author: Chris K.

description: I stop by this place ocasionally and they make the best cup of coffee ever. Love this place.
author: martin d.

description: Sam makes a great coffee and I love the smoked salmon breakfast sandwich.  If you don't like what he makes he says he will redo it but that hasn't ever happened to me!  Everything is nice and fresh. UCSF discounts!
author: Laura W.

description: I was walking through the UCSF area craving coffee and just happened to stumble upon this place. I'm so glad I did. I was promised the best cup of coffee by Sam, and that's exactly what I got.  Not only that, but it was so refreshing to see someone who loves doing his job and does it so well. This is exactly the kind of business I want to support. If I lived in the area, I can't think of a better way to start my day than to visit Sam and grab a cup of coffee at Golden Bear.
author: Neha L.

description: Sam's coffee is almost as good as making love. Seriously this is must try coffee. Sam is the owner and he is a really nice guys to talk to. Great service, great coffee, what more could you ask for?
author: Brendan V.

description: Two things you need to know about the Inner Sunset: it's not as far out as people might tell you and Golden Bear makes the best cup of coffee in the neighborhood. If you don't believe it, your cup is on the great owner, Sam. Give it a shot, you won't regret it.
author: Will H.

description: I had the pleasure of spending about 4 hours this evening studying at Golden Bear Trading Co. Sam not only creates a one-of-a-kind cup of coffee, but he also fosters a community within his café. Each and every interaction with his customers, new and old, is one of compassion and love. Sam even pulled me outside to take a study break to watch the sunset with him. Golden Bear Trading Co. Is the definition of a 5 star establishment. Sam has proven that you can and will make happiness happen through love, compassion, and hard work!
author: Aria W.

description: Last time I was here, Sam made me an iced tea latte. I don't know what teas were in it, but Sam said it was his own special blend of several teas, plus a little bit of milk and sugar. Delicious and perfect for an unusually hot day in the Sunset!
author: Brittany V.

description: Excellent coffee, hand-pulled espresso drinks. I love the latte I get there. Once in a while a guitarist will play in the shop, which is done in sleek white and lends a relaxing atmosphere to your visit. Nice selection of bottled whiskeys, with some of the newer American single malts about.
author: Larry E.

description: I like the vibe of this place - large space, plenty of seating...would make the perfect study spot. They also sell wine and have a little convenience store section. I also like that they grind their coffee in front of you and have a wide variety of beans to choose from. HOWEVER, this place does not know how to make a simple cafe latte. I have been there twice and had two different servers, and they both just make a coffee with milk (not even cafe au lait). That is not a latte. A latte is made with 1-3 espresso shots and steamed milk (I like mine with soy milk) and foam on top. What these guys do is brew coffee and fill your cup 3/4 of the way with it and then add cold soy milk from the refrigerator on top. I remarked that I never saw a latte made that way and the guy said, "we don't use machines here." Ok, fair enough, I can dig that...just don't pretend to make me a latte then. PLUS, one of the guys who seemed to be the owner came from outside and went straight to working on my "latte" WITHOUT washing his hands beforehand. His hands were all over the rims of the cup...I was kinda grossed out, but my years in the Peace Corps allow me to quickly excuse such offenses-but it was noted! I would give them one star, but they're nice, so they get an extra star for that.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Sam is the nicest and most welcoming coffee shop owner I have met in SF. Fantastic hospitality and great coffee! The decor is  extremely calming too, great lighting and great big open windows. Great assortment of healthy snacks and alcohol if you so choose (sounds strange but trust me it works). Love this place and recommend to all.
author: Paul Y.

description: Inviting atmosphere, friendly owner and great coffee. Throw in the amazing baklava and really what more could you want! Highly recommend.
author: Rosanne F.

description: The turkish coffee, the one served in a ceramic cup not the one to take away with you, has a strong and interesting flavor coming from the coffee and the rest of the spices used on it. As it rests and you sip into it becomes slightly stronger as the rests of coffee grounds in the cup get more time in the water, excellent to pair it up with a baklava. When Sam, the owner, asked if "is it good?" I always answer him that "good would be an understatement".
author: Maic L.

description: Best coffee! Be sure to pair it with a baklava, and have a chat with Sam, the owner.
author: Will M.

description: I just moved around the corner and am already addicted! Great coffee and very friendly service from Sam.
author: Haley K.

description: 0 stars! All hype, all BS, all sleezy salesman techniques to sell the WORST cup of coffee I have ever had. It was horrific! It tasted like tea with some funky chemical taste, and after about 5 minutes this greasy substance formed in 4 circles on top of the coffee. It was not hot when given to me but rather luke warm with tiny bubbles. It was the oddest crap I have ever had. The pastry which he claimed were amazing and homemade, were stale, tasteless and NOT homemade, unless homemade means in a large Costco site. I am taking my coffee to  a lab to see what is in it, Im serious. Butter? Low fat milk? chemicals? This shite was odd. He sold it as best cup ever. Best BS ever! I will never go back. I mean never ever ever if it were the last store in the city I would sit at home and make a cuppa of folgers and be glad I dont have to drink that slop. In all reality I would probably make a cup of Philz or Blue Bottle , but you get my point. The reviews MUST be fake. Dont trust YELP, it is hella shady. yet I am here to speak truth. I wanted to RUN out of the place but my friend was like dude i need coffee. Creepy as hell, not kind, not cool, not friendly and horrible FOOD and COFFEE IN MY OPINION.
author: SForiginal T.

description:
I'd skip this corner store unless you're desperate. I wanted to make a cake and the box of golden brown sugar I needed might as well have been a brick. 

The prices are the same as Safeway, and at least they rotate out their food more often.

The guy who runs this place is hilarious though, so if you need something quickly and you want a laugh, it's a good place to stop. Last time I was here the owner refused to give the girl in front of me her wine until she promised to come back and visit with her sister -- and he said he'd have champagne ready.
author: Ash S.

description: An absolutely heavenly cup of coffee.  Today, I had the honor of my cafe mocha being painstakingly prepared by Sam himself, who was committed to crafting the best cup of coffee I have ever had.  The final product greatly exceeded my expectations--I look forward to making this part of my daily routine.
author: Amanda J.

description: Golden Bear Coffee is amazing and one of the best parts is the owner, Sam. He is always so cheerful and helpful, even when he seems to have a broken heart, he will make your day so much brighter! Be sure to stop by here for some of the best coffee in town and a wonderful interaction with Sam.
author: Jane M.

description: Definitely the best cup of coffee in the area! After a tiring day of classes and a long walk in the cold, my evening was brightened up by stopping here. It was the first time I tried this coffee, but it surely surpassed my expectations!  The market has a lovely variety of items, the service is spectacular, and I felt very welcomed here. I will HAVE to be back very soon!
author: Brittany F.

description: My husband and I stopped in for a quick coffee trying to find something to warm us up. I have to say I think I had one of the best cups of coffee I have ever had. We choose the Panama dark roast, it was exceptional (bought the beans to take home too). We also had the baklava-about as good as it gets-excellant. The owner was very nice and welcoming, When he explains his various types of coffees you can see he takes pride in his business and knowledge of his trade. When we are back in this area of the city we will make a point of stopping here again because it was that good.
author: Sandy G.

description: Last night I stopped by the Golden Bear on my way home from work. Sam's Turkish coffee has made many a morning warm and friendly for me. He invited me to kick up my feet and, knowing I love music, cranked the Persian pop that was playing. My long day melted away to the ood, zils, and singing in three languages. That lead to him staying open late and teaching me traditional men's dances. Never before have I had a neighborhood coffee shop that felt like being welcomed into someone's home.
author: Ted M.

description: Hands down the best coffee in the inner sunset!  The owner is a trip.  I always walk out with a smile and usually some level of confusion.  The couch is also very comfortable and there are power outlets for your laptop.
author: Jay R.

description: I had to stop by here b/c I was starving one time and I saw that they had piroshkies.  I was so hungry I didn't even ask how much it was - I just had to have one.  It ended up being some ridiculous price like $6-7 or something.  And I asked the lady if she could heat it up and she went on some tirade about how she had just made them so they were warm even though they definitely looked like they had been sitting out for a while.  I politely asked if she could just heat it up and she insisted that that wasn't necessary (or at least that's what I comprehended - I could only understand about 50% of what she was saying b/c her accent was really thick and she was yelling at me!).  Fine.  Of course, the second I bite into it, it's cold.  Awesome.
author: Derrick C.

description: Sam's coffee is simply the best! It's like drinking a cup of coffee straight from heaven! Won't find coffee made with any more love than here!!!
author: Michelle G.

description:
"Oh wow." 

That's all you need to know. 

Go there and get some coffee and baklava right now. Seriously. The pistachios are incredible. 

Sam is also very friendly and will invite you to join him to hang out for a bit.

 I'm definitely kicking myself for not walking in here earlier given that I pass it daily.  Don't make the same mistake.
author: Tony R.

description: Excellent Coffee!   Brewed with lots of TLC.  This is not the place to run in and be treated with indifference.  Yeah! What a difference that makes in the morning.  Nice place to sit outside, enjoy the morning sunshine and commune with the carefully tended succulents.  A good place to start your day!
author: Kimberly P.

description: Sam, the owner of this fine establishment, is a lovable maniac. He will have you laughing, crying, singing, dancing, yelling all while you're just trying to buy a pack of gum. He has some comfortable couches to sit on and nice benches outside for when it's sunny. If you have the time, it's good to hang around for a while just to watch how he handles his vendors. But the real reason to go see Sam, the real reason, is his incredible coffee. Although the single-drip trend is really blowing up right now, Sam has taken it to perfection. Seriously. He's right up there with Blue Bottle or Philz and arguably better. Obviously people will take there brand loyalty to death, at least until the next trendy spot opens up, but Sam is a humble man with a nice little store that makes some great coffee.
author: Ian M.

description:
I haven't had any sandwiches here.

A friendly dude runs the place now, I think. He's really nice, offered liquor suggestions, and seemed pretty cool. They have a decent beer, wine, and booze selection for a corner store, and I was surprised about how much they had in the way of groceries.

That said, there's no real reason to go here unless you're in the neighborhood. It's kind of expensive, but that's the price you pay for convenience. What more can you expect?
author: Justin T.

description: I've been a customer for just about a year now, and I'd have to say this store is pretty awesome and convenient. Recently, I was walking by the neighborhood I smelled something pretty delicious that caught my attention. I walked into Golden Bear Market and Sam (the owner) commenced to tell me it was his Turkish coffee that he has recently put on the market. He told me that it would change my life. Behind Jesus, my girlfriend, and my mom, I'd put his coffee in a solid 4th. Seriously, it's delicious and it's the best coffee in SF!
author: Gilbert C.

description:
My girlfriend and I walked into buy a snack, and we already had cups from Starbucks. Sam, the owner, immediately challenged us to his coffee. If we didn't like it more than the brown water we had, he'd give us a hundred bucks. Well, shit. I know a good deal when I see it. If I win, I get a hundo. If he does, I get a better coffee. 

Well, Sam, engaging gentleman that he is, prepped our drip coffees, sang us some Turkish melodies, and insisted on giving my lady her coffee first, since "he's old fashioned" like that. Well, he won. He kindly threw our Starbucks out for us, and we got better coffees for really no more expensive than 'bucks.
author: Vincent C.

description: Turkish coffee will change your life!!! I used to work at Starbucks and it ain't nothing like this
author: Edward C.

description: This place has the best Turkish coffee ever!! I would come here every day if I could. The owner is the first person I met when I moved into the neighborhood and he made me feel like I was at home.
author: Lisa K.

description: The turkish coffee is awesome!!! Forget starbucks, support this local business.
author: Victor N.

description: This is the perfect neighborhood market and the best coffee in the city.  I am truly blessed that this market is only two blocks from my house.  Sam the owner is also a very kind and generous man that just wants to make you smile.  If you haven't been here you need to experience its wonderfulness.
author: Amy E.

description:
I'm not sure about the negative reviews. I get a feeling those people simply have no sense of humor OR too arrogant (read stupid). 

This place is special. Simple because the coffee Sam makes is really special. 

The other guys from one of the negative reviews said the coffee was similar to chain coffee shop coffees. ARE YOU NUTS or what?!! 

This is by far the best coffee in the city. Coffee bean are amazing, no coffee machine used - all old traditional way (hot water through paper filer filled with fresh coffee powder) + cane sugar and cream - this is why me and my wife drive here 15 minutes every Sat and Sun to make our day beautiful from start. 

Thank you Sam. 
your friends Alex and Masha
author: Alex P.

description: A simple review: it is always an excellent experience when you can walk into a store, be called by your first name, and walk out with a great bottle of wine and a fantastic cup of coffee.  Thanks Sam!
author: Shaft S.

description: On a visit to San Francisco, I discovered this coffee shop and loved it. The service is personable and warm. Sam, the man behind the counter, really took the time to greet all his customers. Moreover, the coffee (all brewed by hand) was wonderful. I got the Ethiopian one. $3.50 for a large, score! The shop itself is clean with a nice seating area. There is also a wide selection of wines. Great little shop!
author: Leslie A.

description: Great little coffee shop! Owner has the best attitude, truly adds to the experience! Coffee and pastries were so yummy! Made my day here in San Fran.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
The only good thing about this corner store was the crazy lady amusing my friends and I with her non-sense and gibberish. That alone was almost worth the overpricing of everything.
 
Now that she's gone and Sam is in there is doesn't have the same entertainment. Even though the prices might be a little lower, a block away the other corner store guy is nicer. But they do this every year and in no time the crazy lady will be back working and the prices will be high again never fails like clockwork.
author: Marlene M.

description: I stumbled upon this gem after a hike in the sutro hills. I walked in and instantly knew it was special. The owner, Sam, Is friendly and hilarious and made my day. The entire time I was there he made everyone feel welcome. I enjoyed the most delicious cup of turkish coffee brewed with love. Seriously, best in the city! I sat outside on the picnic table with beautiful succulents all around. This is the definition of a neighborhood store, and whats makes Golden Bear Market (Sam's) such a special and unique place.
author: Sunni P.

description: Sam's coffee is undeniably exquisite. If that isn't enough, the man himself is nothing short of cavalier. Go see him. Order a Turkish Coffee with cream and sugar (I always drink coffee black, but never Sam's). Tell him you love him.
author: Elliot C.

description: The Coffee was great and the grilled chicken breast with jalapeños was one the best sandwiches I have ever tasted.  The best part of the experience was the pride the owner took in the quality of his products.  A great place to stop if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Brad E.

description: Love this place. Great place to get an amazing cup of coffee on my way to work and a great place to get a bottle or wine on my way home from work. The owner is a little cray cray but he's nice enough. His turkish coffee is incredible and gets me going for a 12 hour shift. If Iv'e had a rough day and need a botttle of champers or wine I can always count on Golden Bear to hook it up. Pretty good alcohol selection for such a small place. I guess they know whats important in life.
author: Lauren N.

description:
Haha--- just came out from my first experience at Golden Bear, and it was quite a "provocative" experience to say the least, for what was meant to be a simple purchase. 

I came in to get a simple frozen meal, but  when I walked to the counter I glanced at the Baklava. The owner caught my glimpse, and immediately began telling me how delicious their baklava was-- "the finest I'd ever eat, home cooked by their family recipe!". How could I say no to this? I bought their baklava and made my way further to the counter when passing by their "Brici"; the greek/turkish coffee maker. A simple glance at the Brici and the owner now began giving me a speech about how their coffee is the best in the world and incomparable to any coffee I'd ever had.  After a short chat with him, I found myself buying a cup of coffee at 9:15pm.  The owner told me I would be a lifetime customer after today, and insisted I tell all of my friends and family about this place. He told me he had done his part, and now it was time for me to do mine. I asked him how long his family had been working there, and he told me they take things "one year at a time" which confused me, but whatever! lol

So, all in all, it was a pretty humorous experience. I read other reviews about people getting convinced to buy more than they walked in for, and kind of laughed since that's what happened to me too. I felt kinda like I was at some Arabic hustlers trading post, and the zeal of him to recruit me as a lifetime customer was amusing as well. 

The good news is that the coffee was EXCELLENT, and the baklava was good as well.  He did not lie, they are truly exceptional products and I will be back for a cup of their Turkish coffee and bring my friends to try it too.  Philz coffee has a very similar style coffee to them, but now I don't have to drive across the city for a good Turkish coffee.
author: James M.

description: My wife and I came here for the first time this morning and both had great cups of coffee and split a cinnamon roll.  Sam was incredibly welcoming and helpful in selecting our coffee from the many types he offers.  There's plenty of seating and power outlets if you need to do work.  Given the great coffee, food, and service, I will be coming back many times to come.
author: Chris F.

description:
Friendly, outgoing and fun service and the Turkish coffee is incredible! Didn't try the baklava or sandwiches, but others were ordering and looked delicious. 

Great friendly neighborhood place to support and the coffee can't be beat.
author: Sophia E.

description: So friendly and welcoming. Sam goes out of his way to make your cup as good as possible. Best coffee place in inner sunset for sure.
author: Henrik Z.

description: This is my local corner store so I'm there pretty much every day.  It's a homey little place with a good selection.  Now that they've added coffee and pastries I don't need to go down the street anymore.  The coffee is great.  Despite the bad yelp press, this store has a lot of character and Sam is a good guy.  I recommend it
author: Reno D.

description:
A touch of cardamon is what gives the coffee its distinct taste. I've tried the to go version- with cream, no sugar. For the authentic Turkish experience, the coffee grounds are boiled and strained (no paper filter) out just before the coffee is served (black).

A delicious alternative to your run-of-the-mill latte from Starbucks.
author: Gene G.

description: Great find! Excellent pour over coffee, friendly service and tasty food. There are many coffees and teas to choose from, I went with the Kenyan. It was delicious. I used to have a similar coffee shop next to my place in San Carlos but it closed - I'm thinking of moving up to the Sunset just for this coffee. Try the pistachio baklava too. I was given a free sample, but it's worth paying for ( I ended up buying more). Can't wait for my next morning in SF so I can stop by.
author: Brian M.

description:
I love the mixed reviews for this place.  Yea, the owners are crazy.  I've been, um, visiting this place from back when Sam was a bachelor and used to ogle all the girls' bosums as they walked by.  This place is where Seinfeld got the idea for his soup nazi I think.  For me, I only buy from this place when I can't get down to Roxie's on 9th-Kirkham.  In their favor though:  once when I locked myself out of my apartment, Sam let me make a long distance call to the only person who had duplicate keys--for free!  He knew me from the neighborhood so was very kind about letting me do that.

I always liked the lady (now retired) who used to run the place when Sam wasn't available.  She was a very pretty  when she was younger and practiced good bazaar techniques--seller tries to sell you stuff, if you don't have the confidence to stand up for yourself and refuse what she tries to push on you then you deserve to be ripped off.  The way she conducted business was probably very much as they do in her native country where she grew up and if you understood this, you would have known how to handle the situation.  BTW, she wasn't Sam's wife (I don't know how they were related).  Sam married a woman much younger than himself and they have 2 kids, now grown.
author: Kai T.

description: Walked in not knowing to expect, and was greeted warmly by Sam. The baklava was delicious and went great with the coffee. The egg sandwich was simple, tasty, inexpensive (for the destitute med student), and most importantly served HOT. Great spot for a quick bite.
author: André B.

description:
The lady who runs this place is a freaking riot! She's definitely a character . . . is one word (of many) that I'd use for her. My friends and I asked her if she had lime (we were also getting tequila) and all of a sudden three shriveled up, wrinkled lemons appear in the palm of her hand and she said she'd give us a discount on them because she "liked" my friend. On another occasion, another friend of mine who apparently stopped by to pick up something went at a time when they were stacking shelves, or something of that nature, and they basically made him work for them for the next twenty minutes or so! I mean, the two stars alone I'm giving are because of how freaking amused walking by this corner store will always leave me.

But, Yelper-approved, useful reasons why I'm giving this place a low rating:
1. Well, we asked for limes and she gave us wrinkled lemons, so, yeah?
2. The sign advertised 1800 tequila for sale and we pointed to the sign and she nods, then proceeds to take out the bigger bottle and charge us twice as much.
3. When we asked her for the discount price and for the smaller sized bottle, she wagged her finger at us, basically insinuating that we were cheap college students and instead told us they were out of 1800 in that size and offered us two bottles of wine for four bucks. I mean, good deal, but when you walk into a liquor store wanting hard alcohol, you don't exactly expect to walk out with anything but that, you know?

It's not my place to put down the lady or her husband (I think?) who owns this joint, I'm always for the mom/pop stores and smaller businesses and to be totally fair, she definitely was not rude or mean . . . a little short circuited and trying to hustle us a little bit, maybe, but not evil. But, seriously, your practical needs of the alcoholic nature may be better left off to the other liquor/corner stores in the area. To be amused, however, stick around.
author: Betty W.

description: Sam makes this place for me. The sandwiches are excellent and the coffee is STRONG (that's good). I've stopped going to other places for work lunch because I can sit outside, have my coffee and baklava and head back to the hospital satiated and with a nice coffee buzz.
author: Gnat C.

description: Nice little corner store. Sam the owner is quite a character who also happens to make some of the best coffee in the city.
author: Scott S.

description:
In terms of a neighborhood market, Golden Bear really stands out.  To be more specific-the owner, Sam, makes the market great!

This place is right down the hill from UCSF.I initially went in for a cup of coffee after a few hours of studying.  Sam told me I'd come to the right place-his coffee was the best I'd ever have!  I was pretty skeptical but he said if I didn't like it, it would be free.  He was right though, the coffee was absolutely delicious and not at all bitter.  Unfortunately, when it came time to pay I was 50 cents short-he spotted me the 50 cents and said to just pay him back the next time I came for coffee.

In summary-super nice owner, great coffee, perfect neighborhood store.
author: Rob W.

description: This place has THE best falafels and tea I've ever had in my life - Period. The owner Sam is awesome too.
author: Nic D.

description:
Absolutely the best coffee in the city! Each cup made fresh, however you want it. Great sandwiches, calzones, baklava....super chill atmosphere plus outstanding customer service.

Medic 57
author: Jen W.

description:
Speed Hump (no punctuation)
Speed Hump!!! (Kim D.'s interpretation)

* write your own Darin I. joke and insert it HERE *

The yellow caution sign loomed over me, as I took in the sun of last week's amazing Indian Summer that reached even this neighborhood joint.  I mean, it's such a bizarre and sophomorically amusing, yet Cal-Trans sanctioned piece of signage, I can't help but believe most drivers would drop the transmission out of their cars while missing the point of it altogether.  

I found myself wandering around the UCSF Campus, with my purse securely inside an office several blocks away and unintentionally taking a required lunch break, much to my chagrin.  "Hey - where did you get that pierogi thingie that you fed the Cadet a few weeks ago when we were up here?"  

Caveman directed me to this liquor store/mini mart, but I recognized the Eastern European Lady who runs the shop.  A delivery guy from one of the beverage vendors was repairing a refrigerated display case - the unseasonably warm weather had him literally sweating.  

"Would you like something cold to drink?"  She offered him, graciously.  He smiled and waved her off, handing her a clipboard to sign.  "Thank you.  I love you.  See you next time," she called after him, as he jumped into his truck.

"Hiiiiiiiiii..."  I'm always eloquent when ordering home made ethnic food of dubious provenance at liquor stores.  "May I please have a pierogi?  One?"  She rattled off a selection of fillings; I chose beef, which I think is what the Cadet had... She popped it in the microwave and nuked it for 45 seconds.  

It was a reasonable facsimile of the fresh out of the oven version from which I'd commandeered several large bites, despite the Cadet's objections.  I snagged a drink from the case, and got ready to pay for my impromptu midday nourishment.  

I had $3, some lint, lip-gloss and a C-note in my pocket.  She leaned in and inspected my large-bill offering, then swept my hand aside and plucked the three dollar bills up in her fingers.  "You come back next time, pay me - it's okay.  Maybe make it a double.  I love you!" 

She beamed and nodded, completely confident that I would sooner commit ritual suicide than betray the goodwill and effortless trust of a shop owner whom I'd never met before.  

I ate half of my microwaved meat-filled bread puck, remembered that I had Prilosec in my purse, back at the office... and made a mental note to time it so that I could sample the freshly-made version again... which was soft, piping hot and pillowy.  

I sat outside, shaded by the generosity of a stranger and the welcome half-shadow of the building itself, chewing vigorously and contemplating the odd innuendo of the street sign before me.  

When in doubt, SPEED HUMP!!!
author: Kim D.

description: I love this place so much I cannot even fathom how anybody could give this place a bad review. I am new to the neighborhood and Sam treats my boyfriend and I like family. He makes the best freaking Turkish coffee. The baklava is also sooooo good! Sam is such a character he always makes us laugh and he remember everything you tell him. I never even have to tell him how I like my coffee he just knows!  The coffee is so much better than any other coffee in the area and its a much better deal.
author: Lauren L.

description:
I'm not a particularly picky person, but the woman who runs this store is so evil I refuse to go there, despite the fact that I live nearby and have to walk an extra two blocks to get to the next store. In my life, this is the only place/product I've ever boycotted.

During the months I bought from her, she routinely overcharged me for merchandise, pressured me to buy more than I wanted, or added stuff to my bill without asking me. She's so accustomed to overcharing, that when she didn't, she would point that fact out, as though honest business practises aren't routine in the first place. 

The first time I shopped there she became visibly annoyed at me because I didn't end up buying flowers from her. She *actually said this*: "Listen to me pretty face [pointing her finger at me]...the next time you buy flowers I charge twice as much for wasting my time!"
author: Scott M.

description: Sam was very nice and the Jasmine tea was wonderful.  The chocolate almond roll was delicious.  Nice little place right down from UCSF.
author: Alesia J.

description:
So I just moved to the neighborhood, and I wanted to grab some beer to go with dinner. My boyfriend was driving and literally refused to stop and the Golden Bear, which is a few blocks from his place, because of the horrific experiences he had endured with the old woman who works there. I made a mental note to myself to check it out, as naturally I was intrigued. 

A couple of days later, I went to pick up some wine for a new years eve dinner party (I swear, Im not an alcoholic). When I walked in, the old woman was friendly enough, and didn't bother me while I perused the isles. 

When I had been standing in front of the wine shelves for several minutes trying to make up my mind, she came over and started harassing me about buying the wine that was on sale. She continued to shove the wine in my face for what felt like an hour, until I finally relented and agreed to purchase the wine. I begrudgingly stepped up to the register where she proceeded to INSIST on me purchasing a second bottle of sale wine at a "special price". I flat out refused four times but at the last minute before swiping my ATM card, she added the extra wine on my tab. By this point I was furious and vowed to never EVER again shop at the Golden Bear market.  

Do yourself  a favor and boycott this market until the management figures out that she is driving away all potential business and puts us all out of our misery.
author: erin s.

description:
I live only a couple blocks from Golden Bear and it's the perfect corner store. Apart from having all the liquor/beer/toiletries/snacks you'd want, the real pull factor this place has is Sam. Always behind the counter and ready to start up a conversation (usually an inappropriate one). To be honest I totally forgot what this market was called until I went to make this review--my friends and I just call it Sam's place. Honestly, half of the trips I take there are just to chat with Sam while eating an It's-It. 
I do have to say, Sam just rearranged the stacks of goods and the place looks MUCH better. I definitely recommend going there, grabbing a coffee and just hang out with Sam for 15 minutes. The store comes equipped with comfy couches and a chess board.
author: David B.

description: Where to start... Golden Bear market is the place to be if you want a cup of coffee, a sandwich, some delicious pastries, alcohol, or just daily living supplies- He as it all.  The cup of coffee that Sam (the owner) makes is to perfection- as he would say "its amazzzzzziiiiiing"- and he is definitely not lying.  I live right around the corner and I try and make it in almost everyday for his cup of coffee and his baklava -which is also delicious.  Not only is the service, food, and coffee amazing; Sam the owner by far makes the experience that much better.  His personality and high energy really livens up the place and keeps you coming for more.  I highly recommend you try Golden Bear Market- you will be coming back for more.
author: Ida M.

description:
CAUTION - This place is interesting, but as a store, fails miserably.

Here's why:  The lady who runs the place is super nice, and will talk to you for hours about the ins and outs of the neighborhood.  This can be a good thing because she is very kind and entertaining, but if you want to get something quickly, it is not.  Prices here are somewhat random.  It's a gamble; items are unmarked for the most part, and you might end up paying almost six dollars for a gallon of milk--but you may also get something for free.  Money is tight while I am in school, and I must say that I avoid this place for anything other than the sport of a vibrant conversation.  If you have just moved to the city or neighborhood, though, you should go meet Cathy--she's super nice.
author: Eyre C.

description: I live around the corner from the Golden Bear and love Sam and his establishment! Just 2 days ago I had a delicious cup of his new Turkish coffee that he made right there in front of me. Delicious! Oh, and I bought my groceries too! A great place to shop!   -AB
author: Andy B.

description: Sam the proprietor is a friendly outgoing guy, very pleasant. Turkish coffee was smooth and flavorful. Very nice. Give it a shot!
author: Raul E.

description: Visited here while at UCSF for my first child. The coffee in Moffitt Cafeteria is Peets, which my wife doesn't like, and I try to find something more interesting than Starbucks when I can. I wandered by here at 7AM (having seen it the day before) and the owner was wonderfully friendly -- "My coffee is made with love and passion!" It reminds me a lot of Philz (and Phil) back when they were small: wonderful, charismatic owner who hand-makes each cup of coffee and really wants you to be happy with what you get. Totally recommend, and after the first cup every coffee run was to here. Unfortunately I can't remember his name -- but he dances well when a song he really likes comes on. :)
author: Philip L.

description: This place boasts an incredible selection of coffee, all of which is great. Each cup is ground and brewed to order. The owner is very friendly and takes a personal interest in ensuring everything you order is to your liking.
author: Eric H.

description:
I love neighborhood personalities - and I rather like the lady that runs the spot. She's a firecracker.

I stopped in to get a bundle of wood for the fireplace of a friend having a housewarming party. She insisted on carrying it herself, as I was in a dress, she even brought it to my car on the corner. Of course I tried and bought some of her cookies! 

Since I've stopped by for flowers, or a drink and I don't think she remembers me, but that woody day she told me to keep come by and see her sometime. A Mae West corner store lady? LOL
author: Cheryl D.

description: This place has a fun energy because the guy had his Arabic music cranked up way high and he was really into doing his job and listening to his music. I just like to see people happy doing what they do. I wanted to charge the wine I was getting. Because it was under 10 dollars he wanted to charge a fee, but for me he let it pass.
author: Sandy H.

description: I don't know what the guy's name is who runs this place now... I've been seeing a lot of reviews talking about an old lady, and to be frank I think the Golden Bear market would be well suited to have her back. The "gentleman" who is running the show now is borderline bipolar, boisterous, not cool in any way, and flat out a menace to society. I live about a block and a half away from this place, and NEVER go there. It would be easy for me to, but I am frankly reticent to give this dude business. He is such a self-centered, obnoxious crazy man, I felt the need to warn other folks. We need to force him out of business. Seriously, I'm not a mean-spirited person, but he needs to go. Anyone who's been there will know what I mean. How is he still in business?
author: Jeremy F.

description:
Sixth Avenue between Lincoln and Kirkham is probably one of my favorite places in the city. Not only because it's a repository of some of the city's finest Arts and Crafts architecture, or a fine example of late 19th century transit oriented ("streetcar suburb") development, but because it's just so nice. Urban yet forested and placid, with several high quality neighborhood small businesses. 

Like Golden Bear Market. A more bourgesie corner store than the Stand-Bi (because on 8th Avenue we roll dirty like that), with basically the same stock but cuter signage, sandwiches, and flowers.  

The thing is, though, the lady who runs the place is kind of hardcore. If you're trying to quit smoking, this could be a good thing because if you tell her not to sell you any cigarettes, she will hound your ass forever about it. However, if you're just looking to pick up a six pack of beer, you may wind up with several other items you didn't plan on, including some dying flowers.
author: Megan W.

description: pretty rude guy working there, I think his name was Sam.  I was in a good mood and didn't take it personally at first, but he never got any friendlier, except when a woman entered the place.  The coffee was a little better than he was rude.  When I asked his about the coffee, he said, "just let me make the coffee, ok?".  I am NOT one of those people who walks into Starbucks and orders a double skinny soy chai no foam light whip or anything, so I like the idea of just getting what a place has, BUT.  I even ended up asking to buy another middle eastern product and he goes, "It's right there in front of you- " as if being visually overwhelmed in a new store is an indication of a passive aggressive customer or something.  Would like to go back for the coffee, but that dude needs to check his attitude or stay home and work out whatever it is that's bothering him.
author: Raphael N.

description:
The old woman who runs this store annoys the crap out of me. If I'm walking by (sometimes on my way to another store like this, but further away) she'll try and harass me into to coming into the store.

HER: "Hello there! Want a nice loaf of bread?"
ME: (trying to run past), "Uh no. Take care!" (runs away)

On those rare occasions when I'm just too lazy to walk an extra mini block to next store, I get harassed into buying all sorts of random junk I don't need.

ME: (holding a soda)
HER: "Would you like a nice bottle of wine with that?"
ME: Uh no.
HER: "How about a X,Y and Z?"
ME: Uh no, just the soda please"

You get the point. If your still reading, well, they have flowers, a limited selection of random stuff and they tend to close earlier than most other convenience stores close by (woo hoo!)
author: Andrew M.

description: Sam is the guy to go to get a decent cup of coffee that hasn't been sitting stewing in a pot until it tastes burnt and needs recycling. Truly a "Cup of Love" as Sam will engage anyone and everyone with friendly conversation and make you feel at home.  A great place to hang out if you have a few spare minutes, and the coffee is great!
author: Jack N.

description: The Mexican hot chocolate is perfection! I just met Sam, the owner, and he's great. As a new UCSF resident, I'm sure I'll be frequenting here often.
author: Gregory B.

description: Best coffee in the inner sunset.  Service is always fantastic and friendly.
author: Augy K.

description: Friendly owner, awesome Turkish coffee and baklava!
author: Lynn F.

description:
Great store great people!
AND my muffler just fell off this afternoon  right outside this place & the guy who works there came & wired it up for me so I can take it to the shop tomorrow!
See there still are good people out there and the one I encountered today works at the Golden bear!
Thanks for being there!
author: Margie C.

description: I can't believe this place has any positive reviews.  The owner just sucks.  He's a creeper, with bizarre, pushy behavior that annoyed the crap out of me so much I decided never to go here even though it's 2 blocks closer than any other convenience store.  When I moved to the neighborhood 2 years ago I'd go in for a 6 pack, or a pack of cigarettes and he'd just be acting like a a**hole or go on and on about how his prices were they best when they were far from it.  Bottom line, the guy is weird, not in a good or amusing way.  Everyone I've spoken to in the area says the same, which is way the overall rating surprised me, I should read them, they're probably from him.
